summary: In this scene, Pete and Monica return to Pete's apartment after a date. Pete, in a romantic and dramatic tone, reveals his grand ambition to become the Ultimate Fighting Champion. He explains his extensive preparations, including training with a specialized trainer and designing his own octagon ring. Monica, initially unsure and skeptical, reacts with mild sarcasm, suggesting that her parents would be thrilled by Pete's new endeavor. The scene highlights Pete's over-the-top ambition and Monica's bemused reaction to his plans.

background: Scene: Phoebe's, Phoebe is opening the door.

lines.dialogue: Hi! Oh, Alice, hi! Thanks. I'm so glad you could come, 'cause I've got a real umm, Home Ec emergency. (Points to the table cloth, which has a huge mustard stain on it.)
Oh my God, who died on this?!
Yeah, I know. It's a real mustard-tastrophe. Can you help me?
Absolutely. Okay, first we'll start with a little club soda and salt, and then if that doesn't work we can go back to...
Y'know what, forget it. It's ruined.
Oh no-no, never say that. If we can't get it out then we can cut around the stain, add a little lace, you make a stylish throw.
Or instead, maybe you could just not marry my brother Frank.

summary: In this scene, Phoebe opens the door to Alice, who she is clearly happy to see. Phoebe immediately explains that she has a "Home Ec emergency," pointing to a large mustard stain on her tablecloth. Alice reacts dramatically, exclaiming, "Oh my God, who died on this?!" Phoebe agrees that it's a "mustard-tastrophe" and asks for Alice's help. Alice suggests using club soda and salt to remove the stain, but Phoebe quickly dismisses the idea, declaring the tablecloth ruined. Alice, however, remains optimistic, proposing to cut around the stain and add lace to turn it into a stylish throw. Phoebe then unexpectedly shifts the conversation, suggesting that Alice might not want to marry her brother Frank instead. The scene ends with this unexpected twist.

background: Scene: A Street, Phoebe is walking with her second date, Jason.

lines.dialogue: ...and I know I'll never miss doing it, but I gotta tell you, it's pretty cool knowing that you're making a difference in a kid's life.
That is so great! Oh, I... (sees that a parked car near them has caught on fire) Oh my God!
Whoa!
(the fire has worsened) Oh my God!!!
Ahh-ahh, we'd better call the fire department!
(stopping him) No! No!
No, no?
Well, we don't n-n-n-n-need a fireman, we'd, we'd like a good mechanic. (hears the sound of approaching sirens) Oh my God, here they come! Well, we gotta get out of here!
W-w-w-wait! Why?!
Well look, if I wanted to see a fireman, I would date one. Okay? (she drags him away)

summary: In this scene, Phoebe and Jason are on their second date, walking down a street. Jason is sharing how fulfilling it is to mentor a child, and Phoebe seems genuinely impressed. However, their conversation is interrupted when a parked car nearby suddenly catches fire. Both are shocked, and Jason suggests calling the fire department. Phoebe, however, stops him, insisting they don't need a fireman but rather a mechanic. As the sound of approaching firetruck sirens grows louder, Phoebe panics and drags Jason away, explaining that if she wanted to see a fireman, she would date one. The scene ends with Phoebe's quirky and somewhat defensive reaction to the situation.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is entering numbers on a calculator as Ross reads off how much he's sold.

lines.dialogue: ....and 12, 22, 18, four... (Chandler starts laughing) What?
I spelled out boobies.
(comes up and starts looking through Ross's cookie supply) Ross, but me down for another box of the mint treasures, okay. Where, where are the mint treasures?
Ah, we're out. I sold them all.
What?
Monica, I'm cutting you off.
No. No, just, just, just a couple more boxes. It-it-it's no big deal, all right, I'm-I'm cool. You gotta help me out with a couple more boxes!
Mon, look at yourself. You have cookie on your neck.
(covers her neck) Oh God! (runs to the bathroom)
So, how many have you sold so far?
Check this out. Five hundred and seventeen boxes!
Oh my God, how did you do that?

Okay, the other night I was leaving the museum just as 'Laser Floyd' was letting out of the planetarium, without even trying I sold 50 boxes! That's when it occurred to me, the key to my success, 'the munchies.' So I ah, started hitting the NYU dorms around midnight. I am selling cookies by the case. They call me
(entering) Okay, stop what you're doing, I need envelope stuffers, I need stamp lickers.....
Well hey, who did these resumes for ya?
Me! On my computer.
Well you sure used a large font.
Eh, yeah, well ah, waitress at a coffee shop and cheer squad co-captain only took up so much room.
Hey-hey-hey that's funny! Your funny Chandler! Your a funny guy! You wanna know what else is really funny?!
Something else I might have said?
I don't know, I don't know, weren't you the guy that told me to quit my job when I had absolutely nothing else to do. Ha! Ha! Ha! Ha! Ha!!
Sweetie, calm down, it's gonna be okay.
No, it's not gonna be okay Ross, tomorrow is my last day, and I don't have a lead. Okay, y'know what, I'm just gonna, I'm just gonna call Gunther and I'm gonna tell him, I'm not quitting.
You-you-you don't wanna give into the fear.
You and your stupid fear. I hate your fear. I would like to take you and your fear....
(entering, interrupting Rachel) Hey! I got great news!
Run, Joey! Run for your life! (runs out)
What? Rachel, listen, have you ever heard of Fortunata Fashions?
No.
Well my old man is doing a plumbing job down there and he heard they have an opening. So, you want me to see if I can get you an interview?
Oh my God! Yes, I would love that, oh, that is soo sweet, Joey.
Not a problem.
Thanks.
And now for the great news.
What, that wasn't the great news?
Only if you think it's better than this... (holds up an aerosol can) snow-in-a-can!! I got it at work. Mon, you want me to decorate the window, give it a kind of Christmas lookie.
Christmas cookie?

summary:
In this scene, Ross is proudly recounting his success in selling cookies, using creative strategies like targeting NYU dorms at midnight to capitalize on "the munchies." Monica is upset because Ross has sold out of her favorite cookies, the mint treasures, and Ross is trying to cut her off from buying more. Meanwhile, Chandler accidentally spells "boobies" on the calculator, causing laughter.

Rachel enters, stressed about her job situation, having quit her job at Central Perk without another lined up. She lashes out at Chandler for encouraging her to quit when she had nothing else to do. Joey interrupts the tension with news of a potential job opportunity at Fortunata Fashions, which Rachel is grateful for. Joey also reveals he has "snow-in-a-can" to decorate Monica's window for Christmas.

background: Scene: The Ultimate Fighting Championship, Ross and Monica are there watching Pete.

lines.dialogue: (walking up with this huge tub-o-popcorn and drink) Hey!
God Ross, what is that?
Yeah, it's the Ultimate Fighting Combo. Yeah, I saved thirty cents, plus I get to keep the cup. Yay!!
From New York City, New York! Appearing in his Ultimate Fighting Championship debut! He's known for his confrontational business style. Ladies and Gentlemen, introducing Pete Beck-errrr!!

summary: In this scene, Ross and Monica are at the Ultimate Fighting Championship, where they are watching Pete's debut. Ross arrives with a large tub of popcorn and a drink, proudly announcing that he saved money by getting the "Ultimate Fighting Combo." Monica is slightly exasperated by his enthusiasm. The announcer then introduces Pete, who is making his debut in the championship.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is telling Phoebe about Mark, as Gunther eavesdrops behind them.

lines.dialogue: Wow! I cannot believe Mark asked you out.
I know.
What, so what are you gonna tell him?
Well, I told him I would think about it, but I'm gonna tell him no.
Huh.

I mean I think I'd say no to anybody right now. (Hearing this Gunther swoops back to cleaning tables.) Oh, but it was so strange. I mean I'm standing there with this charming, cute guy, who's asking me to go out with him, which I'm allowed to do, and I felt guilty. Y'know, like I'd be cheating on Ross or something.
Wow. So, okay, maybe that means that, you're not over Ross yet and you have issues with your father.
I don't have any issues with my Father.
Okay, so it's probably just the Ross thing then.

summary: In this scene, Rachel and Phoebe are at Central Perk, where Rachel is discussing Mark's recent invitation to go out with her. Rachel expresses her surprise at being asked out and reveals that she plans to decline the offer. She explains that she feels guilty about the idea of dating someone else, as if she would be betraying Ross. Phoebe suggests that Rachel's feelings might indicate that she is not yet over Ross, possibly influenced by unresolved issues with her father. Rachel denies having issues with her father, leading Phoebe to conclude that it's primarily the Ross situation that's affecting her. Meanwhile, Gunther overhears their conversation and retreats to cleaning tables.

background: Scene: Mattress King, Monica is trying to return her bed.

lines.dialogue: Uh, may I help you?
Yeah, I talked to you on the phone, I'm the lady that got stuck with the racecar bed.
Look, it's like I told you, there's nothing I can do. You signed for it, Monica Velula Geller.
All right, Jester man, look we wanna see the king.
Nobody sees the king!
Oh-ho-kay, I'm talking to the king. (starts to go to a back room)
Hey! You can't go back there!
Oh my God.

summary: In this scene, Monica is at the Mattress King store, attempting to return a racecar bed she had previously purchased. Jester, the store employee, informs her that there's nothing he can do because she signed for the bed. Joey, frustrated, demands to speak to the "king" (presumably the manager or owner), but Jester insists that no one sees the king. Joey tries to go to the back room to find the king, but Jester stops him. Meanwhile, Janice reacts with surprise to the situation.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's bathroom, Joey and Monica are admiring the new floor.

lines.dialogue: It's beautiful! It's like the first bathroom floor there ever was. (Chandler tries to go to the bathroom) Whoa! Are you going in there for?
What, like a number?
(entering) Hey!
Hi! Bye! (runs to the bathroom)
Okay, I'm done with my choices, these are final. (holds up a little card)
Well, it's about time.
Ooh, very official.
Oh, yeah, well y'know Chandler printed it up on his computer.
And who laminated it?
That would be me.
All right let me see. (grabs the card) Uma Thurman, Winona Ryder, Elizabeth Hurely, Michelle Pfieffer, and Dorothy Hammel?
Hey, it's my list.
Okay honey, you do realize she only spins like that on ice.

summary:
In this scene, Monica and Joey are admiring the new bathroom floor in Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica is very excited about it, describing it as the "first bathroom floor there ever was." Chandler tries to enter the bathroom, but Monica stops him, asking if he's going in for a specific reason. Chandler jokingly responds, "What, like a number?" Ross then enters the scene and announces that he has made his final choices, holding up a laminated card. Rachel, Joey, and Monica are curious about the card, and Ross explains that Chandler printed it up on his computer and he laminated it.

Rachel reads the list on the card, which includes names like Uma Thurman, Winona Ryder, Elizabeth Hurley, Michelle Pfeiffer, and Dorothy Hamill. Ross defends his list, but Rachel points out that Dorothy Hamill is primarily known for her figure skating, not for being a romantic interest. The scene ends with a light-hearted moment of banter between the friends.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Gunther is pouring Rachel coffee.

lines.dialogue: Here you go.
Thank you.

(In his head) Say Rachel, I was wondering if you'd like to go to a movie with me sometime. As my lover! Nnnsch, too out there. Maybe you'd just like to ah, get something to eat with me sometime? As my lover.
(entering) Hi!
Hi! All right, let's go shoppin'!!
Um, y'know, before we go ah, there's something I need to say.
Oh, okay.

I've kinda of had this ah, this crush on you. (Rachel is shocked) But since you were with Ross, I-I didn't do anything about it. But, now that you're not, I'd really like to ask you out sometime. So-so that's-that's what I'm doing, now.
Wow! Umm....
I dropped a cup.

summary: In this scene, set at Central Perk, Gunther is serving Rachel coffee while secretly fantasizing about asking her out, but he struggles with how to phrase it. Meanwhile, Mark enters and interrupts the moment. He confesses to Rachel that he has had a crush on her and asks her out, leaving Rachel surprised and unsure how to respond. Gunther, witnessing the interaction, accidentally drops a cup in shock.

background: Scene: Dr. Rhodes's Office, a rather large group of doctors has now gathered to take a look at Ross's thing. Ross is none too pleased with the developments, he has a disgusted look on his face.

lines.dialogue: Y'know I have dinner plans!!
Thank you soo much for coming on such a short notice. Ladies and gentlemen, I've-I've-I've been practicing medicine for twenty-three years, and I'm stumped.
Whoa. (they all lean in to get a closer look, Ross isn't pleased)

summary: In the scene, Ross is visibly upset as a large group of doctors gathers in Dr. Rhodes's office to examine something related to him. Ross expresses his frustration, stating that he has dinner plans, implying he doesn't appreciate the sudden interruption. Dr. Rhodes, who has been practicing medicine for 23 years, admits that he is stumped by the situation, which piques the curiosity of the other doctors. They all lean in to get a closer look, much to Ross's displeasure.

background: Scene: The Theatre, after the party. Joey is trying to comfort Kate.

lines.dialogue: Hey! Are you okay?
Fabulous.
Listen, drama critics they're nothing but, but people who couldn't make it as actors. You know what you should do?
Become a drama critic!
(entering, drunk) I am hurt! (to Joey and Kate) A plague on both your houses! (walks away)
By the way, he dumped me tonight after he read my review.
Oh, classy.
Yep! I sure know how to pick 'em, huh? Y'know I gave up a part on a soap for this!
Wow! Yeah I ah, I gave up a job too.
Really. What?
Uh, de-clawing cats. Hey, tell ya what. Let me walk you home. We'll stop by every news stand and burn every copy of their Times and the Post.
Why the Post?
Oh, you didn't see the Post?
No. You?
No. Why?

summary: In this scene, Joey is trying to comfort Kate after a party at the theatre. Kate is clearly upset, though she initially responds sarcastically. Joey reassures her by dismissing drama critics as failed actors and suggests she could become one herself. The Director enters, drunk, and makes a dramatic exit, shouting a curse at them. Kate reveals that the Director dumped her after reading her review, and she mentions giving up a role on a soap opera for this current situation. Joey shares that he also gave up a job, specifically de-clawing cats, to pursue his acting career. To cheer Kate up, he humorously suggests they walk her home and destroy copies of the Times and the Post, though he doesn't specify why they should target the Post. The scene ends with a hint of mystery about what might have been in the Post.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is reading The Shining, as Monica enters.

lines.dialogue: Hi.
(screams and grabs a potato masher to defend herself) Sorry. I'm sorry.
You would not believe my day! I had to work two shifts, and then to top it off, I lost one of my fake boobs, (opens her coat revealing a large burn mark over her left breast.) in a grill fire.
What are you smiling at?
I'm sorry, I was just thinking you're day could still pick up.
Yeah, right.
Hello.
I love this friend thing!

summary: In this scene, Rachel is reading *The Shining* at Monica and Rachel's apartment when Monica enters. Rachel is startled and grabs a potato masher as a makeshift weapon. Monica complains about her terrible day, explaining that she worked two shifts and accidentally lost one of her fake breasts in a grill fire, showing Rachel a burn mark on her chest. Rachel tries to lighten the mood by suggesting that Monica's day could still improve, but Monica dismisses the idea. Just then, Richard arrives, and Monica expresses her excitement about their "friend thing," implying their romantic relationship.

background: Scene: Outside the beach house, Ross is coming out to talk to Rachel.

lines.dialogue: Hi.
Hi!

I was having a little chat with ah, Bonnie, and ah, guess what, she-she happened to bring up y'know, who was behind the um, whole head shaving idea, and now, who was it? Oh, that's right, that's right, it was you!
That was her idea, I just gave her a nudge.
She said you gave her the razor!
(joining them) Hey guys.
Hey!
So, anyone up for a midnight dip in the ocean?
Ahh, no, I'm good.
Okay, I'll see you in a bit.
Okay, have fun! Wooo!!
Come on see, she doesn't look that bad.
You can see the moonlight bouncing off her head! What the hell were you thinking?!!
I don't know.
You don't know?! Rach, you balded my girlfriend!
All right! Ross, do you think it's easy for me to see you with somebody else?
Y'know, hey! You're the one who ended it, remember?
Yeah, because I was mad at you, not because I stopped loving you!
You still love me?
Noo.
You still love me.
Oh, y-yeah, so, you-you love me!
Noo, nnnnn. What does this mean? What do you, I mean do you wanna, get back together?
Noo! Maybe! I, I don't know. Ross, I still can't forgive you for what you did, I can't, I just, but sometimes when I'm with you I just, I feel so...
What?!
I just, I feel, I-I just...
What?
I feel...
(to Joey) Noo!! I don't care! I'm not, I'm not gonna playing one-on-one strip poker with you for practice!
But I made cards!!
Well! Good night. (to Ross) I'm going upstairs.
G'night.
(to Ross) Wanna play strip poker for practice?

summary: In this scene, Ross confronts Rachel about her role in Bonnie's decision to shave her head, which Ross finds shocking. Bonnie interrupts their conversation to suggest a midnight swim, but Ross declines. Rachel defends her actions, and the conversation quickly shifts to their unresolved feelings for each other. Rachel admits that she still loves Ross, but she's unsure if they should get back together due to her inability to fully forgive him. Meanwhile, Joey and Chandler are in the background, hilariously trying to convince Chandler to play strip poker. The scene ends with Rachel going upstairs, leaving Ross and Rachel's feelings in a complicated state.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey, Rachel, Monica, Phoebe, and Ross are holding the giant poking device.

lines.dialogue: All right now remember, something this big and long is going to be difficult to manuver, fortunately I have a lot of experience in that area.
Can we please focus here, a naked man's life hangs in the balance!
I'm telling you he's dead. What we are about to have here is a dead fat guy on a stick.

All right, ladies and gentlemen, let's poke. (they start to advance the giant poking device) Steady. Steady. Okay, a little higher. Careful of the angle. Okay, okay, we're approaching the window (as he says this the camera cuts to their view of Ugly Naked Guy, so that we actually see him!) Thread the needle. Thread the needle.
He's alive! He's a-live!!!
And yet, we're still poking him.
Okay, retract the device, retract the device.
He does not look happy.
Hey-hey, now he's showing us his poking device.
Hey, that's never gonna make it all the way over here, buddy!

summary:
In this scene from *Friends*, the group is attempting to use a giant poking device to check on their neighbor, Ugly Naked Guy, who lives across the courtyard. Joey, with his usual bravado, leads the operation, joking about his experience with "big and long" things. Ross tries to keep everyone focused, emphasizing the seriousness of the situation, while Phoebe is convinced that Ugly Naked Guy is already dead.

As they maneuver the poking device toward his window, they carefully adjust the angle, with Joey giving precise instructions. When they finally poke him, they discover that he is indeed alive, much to Phoebe's surprise. However, the poking seems to upset him, and he retaliates by showing them his own "poking device," much to the group's amusement. Joey confidently dismisses Ugly Naked Guy's attempt, saying it won't reach them. The scene ends with the group reacting to the awkward and humorous situation.

background: Scene: Central Perk, later.

lines.dialogue: Hey Phoebe.
Hey Leslie, how'd you know I'd be here?
I ran into Vlad at the place where they sell the big fish, and he said you played here a lot, so umm....
(to Ross) All right listen, I have to go to the bathroom, but if the place with the big fish comes up again. I'd like know whether that's several big fish or just one big fish.
(to Leslie) So ah, Phoebe tells us you write jingles.
Actually I said she abandoned me to write jingles.
(to Leslie) Ah, anything we might of heard of?
Ah, yeah, umm. (singing) Home is never far away..
(joining in) Home is Home Star stew.
Yeah, but, I don't do that anymore. I got kinda sick of it, and then I couldn't come up with anything good, so they fired me.
Hmm, bummer.
Well, I y'know, I was just, umm, I was just thinking and hoping, that umm, maybe you'd want to get back together?
No. But thanks.
Aw come on Phoebe would you just think about it?
Okay. No. But thanks.
Okay, ah, see ya Pheebs. (leaves)
(to Phoebe) Wow, that was kinda brutal.

Well okay, let this be a lesson to all of you, all right. Once you, once you betray me, I become like the ice woman, y'know. Very cold, hard, unyielding, y'know nothing, nothing can penetrate this icy exterior. (to Monica) Can I have a tissue, please?
Yeah, sure.

summary: In this scene, Phoebe is at Central Perk when her former friend Leslie shows up, having heard from Vlad that Phoebe often plays there. Leslie, who previously abandoned Phoebe to pursue jingle writing, tries to rekindle their friendship, but Phoebe firmly declines, stating that once someone betrays her, she becomes "the ice woman." Despite her tough exterior, she asks Monica for a tissue, hinting at her softer side. Meanwhile, Chandler is curious about the "place with the big fish," and Joey, Monica, and Ross join in on Leslie's jingle, "Home is Home Star stew," which Leslie no longer writes due to being fired for lack of creativity.

background: Scene: Kate's Apartment, Joey and Kate are returning from a night out on the town.

lines.dialogue: (drunk) So you really think those newspapers are just jealous of me?
Oh, absolutely! You're talented and you're good looking.
Oh, you're sweet and cute.
I know! That's why they trashed me!
Whoa. Wait a minute, wait a minute.
What?
I, I don't get you. I mean first, you hate me. Then you sleep with me. Then you want nothing to do with me, now you want me again.
What? So you never went out with an actress before?
Kate, do you even like me?
Of course I do.
Well so, how come you blew me off? Y'know? How come you were with him?
I don't know! I just, just do this! I-I always have to pick the like the smartest guy, or-or the most talented guy... Why can't I just pick someone like you?
Thanks.
You know what I mean. I mean like the sweetest guy. Joey, you're just so, you're so, so... (She passes out and slumps against his shoulder.)

(Checks to see if she's drooling on his shirt.) Okay. Okay, okay, hey. (Lays her down and covers her with a blanket.) There we go, let's get your feet up there. (Looks at her) Good night, Kate. Sweet dreams. (Picks up a garbage can) I'm gonna put this can right here in case you have to hurl.

summary: In this scene, Kate and Joey return to Kate's apartment after a night out. Kate is drunk and expresses her confusion about the negative press she's been receiving, which Joey dismisses as jealousy. They share some light-hearted banter, but the conversation takes a more serious turn when Joey questions Kate's inconsistent behavior towards him. Kate admits that she often feels the need to choose the "smartest" or "most talented" guy, rather than someone like Joey, who she describes as sweet. As she passes out, Joey gently lays her down, covers her with a blanket, and prepares for the possibility of her needing to vomit. The scene ends with Joey looking after Kate with care and concern.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the whole gang is there, the guys are watching football, the girls are cooking Thanksgiving dinner.

lines.dialogue: (reacting to a play) Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Awww!
Hey, it's your Thanksgiving too, y'know, instead of watching football, you could help.
We will. (they don't move)
Okay, Rachel, you wanna put the marshmellows in concentric circles.
No Mon, you want to put them in concentric circles. I want to do this.
Every year.

summary: In this scene, the group is gathered at Monica and Rachel's apartment for Thanksgiving. The guys are engrossed in watching football, reacting enthusiastically to the game. Phoebe points out that it's their Thanksgiving too and suggests they help with dinner instead of just watching football, but they casually agree without actually moving. Meanwhile, Monica and Rachel are in the kitchen, with Monica instructing Rachel to arrange marshmallows in concentric circles, but Rachel insists on doing something else, leading to a light-hearted exchange about their annual Thanksgiving routine.

background: Scene: The beach house, it's still raining. Chandler is building a sand castle, Rachel is doing Monica's nails, and they're all drinking margaritas, obviously bored.

lines.dialogue: (getting an idea) Hey, y'know what a really good rainy day game is?
What?!
I mean naked game. Strip poker, we should totally play strip poker.
No, no!
What are you crazy?!
Come on! When you go away, you-you have to play, it's like a law!
(to Monica) Allll done!
Aww, thank you.
Okay, who's next?! (She looks around the room, and stops when she comes to Ross.)
No-o-o! (Rachel gives him a “Please?” look.) No way!
Come on, please?! I'm boredddd! You let me do it once before.
Yeah well, if ah, if that's the rule this weekend... (She gets up) No!
Yes! (she starts creeping up on him)
Get away!
Just once!
Stay away!
Take it like a man, Ross!
(he gets up and starts to run away from her) No! (in his escape attempt he crushes Chandler's sand castle) No!
Oh, come on!
Big bullies!!
Ow! Ow! Oh, no-no-no!
(entering) Oh, hey!
Hey!
Hey!
Oh, so, how are we doing?
Bored and bored!
Hey, you know what naked card game is never boring?
Noo!!
(to Phoebe) So what's Phoebe like?
I'm kind, caring, and sweet. What's Monica like?
Ah no, the other Phoebe, the one you went to go see.
Ohh, I think she knows where my Dad is.
What?
Really?!
Oh well, where is he?!
She was acting, she was pretending like she hasn't heard from him on years, but I found this picture on her fridge, and look (shows Monica) ! Isn't this what he would look like now?
(gasps) Totally familiar. (Phoebe shows the rest of them.)
Oh, yeah.
Yeah!
Well, why would she lie to you?
I don't know, but we're having dinner tomorrow night, so I figured, she's gonna tell me then. Y'know maybe she just wanted to give him time to, buy me presents, I don't know! So, you're all bored?
Ohh!!
Yes!
All right, I'm gonna close my eyes and point to someone, and you, whoever I point has to come up with something fun for us to do, and we have to do it.
Okay, all right.
Okay.
Fan out! Fan out!
Okay. (Starts to spin) Ooh, y'know we could just do this. (She stops at Chandler)
Okay, umm, we all have to play strip poker.
(jumping in triumph) OH YES!!!!!

summary:
In this scene, the group is stuck indoors at the beach house due to the rain, and they are all bored. Joey suggests playing strip poker, which is immediately shot down by everyone. Meanwhile, Rachel finishes doing Monica's nails and tries to convince Ross to let her do his, but he refuses. Ross ends up accidentally crushing Chandler's sand castle while trying to escape Rachel.

Phoebe then enters and reveals that she visited another woman named Phoebe who might know the whereabouts of her father. She shows the group a picture of what her father might look like now, which they all recognize. Phoebe plans to confront the other Phoebe at dinner the next night.

To break the boredom, Phoebe suggests a game where she will randomly point to someone, and that person has to come up with a fun activity for everyone to do. When she points to Chandler, he jokingly suggests strip poker, much to Joey's delight.

background: Scene: Chandler and Joey's

lines.dialogue: So, I hear, you hate me!
I, ah, I never said hate, I was very careful about that.
A little birdie told me something about you wanting to rip your arm off and throw it at me.
And you got a 'hate' from that?! Your taking a big leap there...
All right, fine, fine, fine, fine, fine, we've got to do something about our little situation here Joey. So, this is my idea
But what does that gonna do...
For Chandler!
Okay. I'm in.
Okay. All right. This is what we're gonna call it
Does it have to be a whole day?
Yes, because that's how long it takes to love me.
Yeah, I know, I sleep in the next room.

summary: In this scene, Janice confronts Joey about his apparent dislike for her, which she heard from someone else. Joey denies using the word "hate" but doesn't exactly deny his frustration. Janice then proposes a plan to help Chandler, which Joey agrees to without much question. The scene ends with Janice playfully insisting that it will take a whole day to love her, to which Joey humorously responds by mentioning his proximity to her in the apartment. The dialogue is light-hearted and filled with the typical banter between the characters.

background: Scene: Monica's, Monica is coming out of the bathroom wearing nothing but a towel, as Chandler is entering.

lines.dialogue: Well, hello!
Hey.
Do you have any beers? We're out of beers.
(all depressed) Help yourself.
You okay?
Phoebe moved out.
Right.
I don't understand, I mean am I so hard to live, is this why I don't have a boyfriend?
Noo!! You don't have a boyfriend because....I don't, I don't know why you don't have a boyfriend. You should have a boyfriend.
Well, I think so.
Oh-ho, come here. (goes and hugs her) Listen, you are one of my favourite people and the most beautiful woman I've ever known in real life.

summary: In this scene, Monica exits the bathroom wearing only a towel, coincidentally as Chandler enters the apartment. Chandler casually asks if there are any beers left, to which Monica, feeling down, responds with a lack of enthusiasm. When Chandler inquires about her mood, Monica reveals that Phoebe has moved out, leading her to question whether her personality is the reason she doesn't have a boyfriend. Chandler reassures her, insisting that she deserves a boyfriend and that she is one of his favorite people and the most beautiful woman he knows. The scene ends with Chandler offering a comforting hug.

background: Scene: Joey's dance audition, Joey is warming up.

lines.dialogue: Ah Joey. Joey Tribbiani. Listen Joey, I got a problem, I just got a call from my dance captain, he's having a relationship crisis and can't get out of Long Island.
So, does that mean the audition is off?
Listen Joey, seeing as you've got the most experience, I want you to take these dancers and show them the combination.
What?!

Aw come on Joey, it's easy. Y'know, it's hand, hand, head, head, (very quickly, Joey watches stunned) up, pas de bouree, pas de bouree, big turn here, grand sissone, sissone, sissone, slide back, step, step, step, and jazz hands!
It's ah, step-ity, step and jazz hands.
Have fun.
Bye. (does the jazz hands)

summary: In this scene, Joey Tribbiani is at a dance audition, warming up, when the Director informs him that the dance captain is dealing with a personal crisis and can't make it. Joey initially thinks the audition might be canceled, but the Director, recognizing Joey's experience, asks him to lead the other dancers and teach them the dance combination. The Director quickly rattles off a series of dance moves, leaving Joey stunned. Joey attempts to summarize the moves as "step-ity, step and jazz hands," and the Director leaves him to it. The scene ends with Joey doing jazz hands.

background: Scene: The hallway between the two apartments, Pete and Monica are returning from their date.

lines.dialogue: ...so y'know, that's why, within a few years, that voice recognition is gonna be pretty much standard on any computer you buy. Y'know, so you could be like-like, 'Wash my car.' 'Clean my room.' It's not gonna be able to do any of those things, but it'll understand what you're saying.
Oh, this is so great.
Yeah, it was.
All right then. (He leans in to kiss her goodnight, but she quickly kisses him on the cheek and pats his shoulder.) Bye.
Hello, people who do not live here.
Hi! Hello!
I gave you a key for emergencies!
We were out of Doritos.
Hey, how'd the date go with Mr. Millionaire?
Mr. Millionaire, new from Snooty Playthings! Third wife sold separately.
He's great! I mean we have such a good time together! He's so funny, and sooo sweet, and I'm not attracted to him at all!!
Still?!
Noo!! It's driving me crazy. I mean every other way he's like the perfect guy, he has everything. Plus! He actually has everything.
Life-sized Imperial Storm Troopers from Sharper Image?
Two.
Wow!! Can Joey and I put them on and fight?
(entering, dancing and singing) Oh mommie, oh daddie, I am a big old baddie! Oh mommie, oh daddie, I am a big old baddie! (He dances around the dinner table and exits)
I guess he musta gotten the part in that play.
Oh.
Yeah, either that, or Gloria Estefan was right, eventually, the rhythm is going to get you.

summary:
In this scene, Pete and Monica return from their date, with Pete enthusiastically discussing the future of voice recognition technology. Monica seems to enjoy the conversation but quickly ends the interaction by giving Pete a friendly kiss on the cheek and saying goodbye. As they enter the hallway, they find their friends Ross, Chandler, Phoebe, and Joey waiting for them.

Monica is surprised to see them and reminds them that they only gave them a key for emergencies. Phoebe cheekily responds that they ran out of Doritos, prompting Ross to ask how the date went. Monica admits that while Pete is great—funny, sweet, and has everything—she still doesn't feel a romantic attraction to him, which frustrates her.

Chandler jokes about Pete's wealth, mentioning his life-sized Imperial Storm Troopers, which Monica confirms he has two of. Joey then enters, dancing and singing a silly song, indicating that he might have gotten a part in a play. Chandler quips that either Joey got the part or Gloria Estefan was right about the rhythm getting to him.

The scene ends with the group bantering and Monica reflecting on her complicated feelings about Pete.

background: Scene: A Restaurant, Monica and Phoebe are on their dates with Sergei and Mischa.

lines.dialogue: Oh, and I can also speak a little French. Voulez-vous coucher avec moi ce soir? (Mischa laughs) Why? What did I say?
Well, you just asked if I wanted to go to bed with you tonight.
Oh my God! No wonder I get such great service at Cafe Maurice.
(laughing and banging her spoon on the table) Knock, knock, knock, knock, hi. Um, could you please tell Sergei that um, I was fascinated by what Boutros Boutros Gali said in the New York Times.
You didn't say Boutros Boutros Gali.
(to Sergei) Boutros Boutros Gali.
He says he was too.
Interesting.
(to Monica) So I was wondering....
Okay, ah, before you get all talky again, umm, could you also please tell Sergei that I really like his suit.
(to Phoebe, very quickly) Eh, he said, thank you very much, he thinks you look very pretty tonight, your hair, golden like the sun. (to Monica) So you're a chef?
I'm also thinking about opening up my own restaurant.
Oh, really.
Monica, can I talk to you behind my menu, please. (Behind the menu) What are you doing?
Well, I was having a conversation.
Yeah but, Mischa is so interested in you, that Sergei and I haven't been able to say two words to each other.
What do you want me to do? Just sit here silently while you three have a conversation?
That would be great. Thank you.

summary:
In this scene, Monica and Phoebe are on dates with Mischa and Sergei, respectively, at a restaurant. Monica accidentally blurts out a risqué French phrase, thinking it was a harmless question, which leads to an awkward moment. Meanwhile, Phoebe tries to engage Sergei in conversation by mentioning Boutros Boutros Gali, but the interaction is brief. Phoebe then asks Mischa to relay compliments about Sergei's suit, which leads to a quick exchange of compliments between Phoebe and Sergei.

As the conversation continues, Monica discusses her career as a chef and her aspirations to open her own restaurant. However, Phoebe becomes frustrated because Mischa is more focused on Monica, leaving her and Sergei with little opportunity to talk. Phoebe asks Monica to be less engaging in the conversation so that she and Sergei can have a chance to interact, but Monica feels it's unfair to sit silently while the others talk.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is there as Monica enters carrying a huge stack of newspapers.

lines.dialogue: Hey! My first review is out!
Ohh! Oh, the Chelsea Reporter, ohh, this used to keep me so warm.
All right, look at my on the back page.

Oh, okay! (reading) "Would I go back to Allesandro’s? Sure, but I’d have to order two meals, one for me and one for the guy pointing the gun to my head." (to Monica) Wow! You really laid into this place.
Hey, they don’t pay me a penny a word to make friends.
Ooh, I gotta go. I found a guy that who could fix up the van for catering.
Oh! Do you need me to go with you?
No-no, it’s okay. But are we sure we don’t want the waterbed?
Haven’t we made this decision?
Yeah, all right. (starts to leave)
Bye!
Bye!
(answering it) Who is it?
It’s Allesandro, from Allesandro’s.
Oh my God.
I want to talk to you about your review.
Oh my God, oh my God. (on intercom) Call me on the phone!
Why? So you could hang up on me?
Look, I-I’m never gonna let you up so you may as well just go away.
Just give me a chance too…
(on intercom) Hey, do you need to get in? Here you go.
No! Phoebe!
Hey, Monica!

summary:
In this scene, Monica excitedly shares her first restaurant review with Phoebe, which appears in the Chelsea Reporter. The review is harsh, with the critic saying they would only return to Allesandro’s under duress. Phoebe jokes about the review being so negative it could have been written under threat. Monica defends her critical stance, saying she’s not paid to be friendly. Phoebe then mentions she’s found someone to fix the catering van, but Monica declines to join her, focusing instead on their ongoing debate about the waterbed.

The tension escalates when Allesandro, the owner of the restaurant Monica reviewed, shows up at their apartment. Monica panics and refuses to let him in, fearing a confrontation. Phoebe, however, inadvertently lets Allesandro into the apartment, much to Monica's dismay.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Chandler is attempting his pre-emptive strike.

lines.dialogue: Oh boy, I just love to sing!
Yes, I-I know that you do, but I think one of the reasons people were complaining though, was that they paid to hear the actor sing Old Man River.
Oh, look at us! Who would’ve thought that Cupid had a station at 14th Street Nails. (Does the laugh)
(laughs) Okay, we have to talk. I’m just getting out of a very serious relationship…
I know! And I’m just getting out of a marriage, I mean talk about meant to be!
Right! I just think that this is happening too soon.
Oh, too soon, too schmoon. Face it honey, I am not letting you get away this time.
I hear ya. (Pause) But! Unfortunately, my company is transferring me overseas!
Oh no! Where to? (Gasps) Too Paris?
No! No! Not, Paris.
Too London? No-no, Rome? Vienna? Ooh-ooh, Barcelona?
Okay, could you just stop talking for a second? (Thinks) Yemen. That’s right, yes, I’m being transferred to Yemen!
When?
I don’t know exactly.
Ugh, well I will just have to soak up every once of Chandler Bing until that moment comes.
But I do know that it’s some time tomorrow.

summary:
In this scene, Chandler is at Central Perk with Janice, trying to end their budding relationship before it begins. Janice is enthusiastic about their connection, even joking about how they met at a nail salon. Chandler, however, is uncomfortable and tries to explain that he's just coming out of a serious relationship and isn't ready for another one. Janice brushes off his concerns, insisting that they are "meant to be."

Chandler then lies about being transferred overseas to Yemen to get out of the situation, but Janice is undeterred, saying she'll enjoy their time together until he leaves. Chandler, desperate, blurts out that he's leaving the next day, trying to end things quickly.

background: Scene: The Doctor’s office, Dr. Zane is examining Phoebe as Frank and Alice watch.

lines.dialogue: It looks like your uterus is ready for implantation.
Oh! I knew it! I knew it! I felt really thick this morning.
Well, okay, so what’s now—go get, go get the eggs, put ‘em in there.
Okay, it’ll take just a little while to prepare the embryos.
Embryossss? As in, "More than one?"
Um-hmm, five actually.
Five? Okay, where am I giving birth, a hospital or a big box under the stairs?
We do five because that gives you a 25% chance that at least one will attach.
That’s it! 25 percent? That means that’s it’s like 75 percent chance of no baby at all!
Hey, y’know I was thinking, what are the odds like if-if, if you stuff like 200 of them in there?
Sweety, now, she’s a woman, not a gumball machine.
Okay, well y’know what, don’t worry you guys, ‘cause I’m-I’m gonna do this as many times as it takes to get it right.
Well, you see, the-the thing is, we-we only got, we kinda have one shot to make it right.
Umm, it costs $16,000 each time you do this. So, umm, we’re kinda using all the money we have to do it just this one time.
Whoa!! That—okay, that’s a lot of pressure on me and my uterus. (to Dr. Zane) So, well okay, so is there—is maybe is there something that I can do y’know just to like help make sure I get pregnant?
No, I’m sorry.
Wow! You guys really don’t know anything!
I know! Why don’t you get drunk! That worked for a lot of girls in my high school.

summary: In this scene, Phoebe is at the doctor's office with her friends Frank and Alice, where Dr. Zane informs her that her uterus is ready for implantation of embryos as part of an in vitro fertilization (IVF) procedure. Phoebe is excited and nervous, expressing her concerns about the process and the odds of success. Dr. Zane explains that they will implant five embryos, giving her a 25% chance that at least one will successfully attach. This leads to a humorous and tense exchange where Frank suggests implanting more embryos, Alice compares Phoebe to a gumball machine, and Phoebe expresses her determination to keep trying despite the high cost and pressure. The scene ends with Frank jokingly suggesting that getting drunk might help, which Phoebe dismisses as unhelpful advice.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is telling Monica about his new baby sitting job.

lines.dialogue: Oh come on! You're making it sound worse than it actually was.
Her date tipped me ten dollars. (Monica laughs)
Pheebs, what are you doing?
Okay, I wanna be sexy again so I'm trying to catch a cold. It should be easy, supposedly they're pretty common.
Phoebe, you'll catch pneumonia.
(entering) Okay. You were right. I'm in love with Joey's girlfriend.
What?!
Are you serious?
Well, how-how-how is that possible? You barely know her!

I don't know. I can't--I just, I can't get her out of my head. Y'know? I mean, I'm a very bad person. I'm a very, very bad person. I'm a horrible person. (he waits for a reaction, when he doesn't get one) No you're not Chandler! We still love you Chandler!
(sneezes) Oh gosh, Phoebe, I think I caught your cold.
You mean you stole it! (Monica sneezes again) Don't cover your mouth when you do that!
Hey.
(to Chandler) We were just talking about you.
Really?!
Yeah-yeah, I told her about the time you got drunk and fell asleep with your head in the toilet.
(laughs) Right in there!

summary: In this scene, Ross is discussing his new babysitting job with Monica, mentioning that the baby's date tipped him ten dollars, which Monica finds amusing. Meanwhile, Phoebe is trying to catch a cold to feel sexy again, despite Monica's warning about the risk of pneumonia. Chandler enters and shockingly confesses to being in love with Joey's girlfriend, Kathy. The group is stunned by Chandler's admission, with Phoebe questioning how he could feel that way since he barely knows her. Chandler expresses guilt over his feelings, calling himself a "horrible person." Monica, in the meantime, accidentally catches Phoebe's cold, leading to a humorous exchange about sneezing etiquette. The scene ends with Joey and Kathy joining the group, and Joey sharing a funny story about Chandler's drunken antics, which Chandler laughs off.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Rachel, and Phoebe are eating breakfast.

lines.dialogue: (to her babies) Stop it!
What?
One of the babies is kicking.
I thought that was a good thing.
It’s not kicking me, it’s kicking one of the other babies. Oh (looks down her dress)! Don’t make me come in there!
(entering) Hey!
Hey!
Do you guys have like a big bowl I can borrow?
Yeah, there’s one right under the cabinet.
(grabs it) Thanks.
Why do you need it?
Oh, we’re having a big party tomorrow night. Later! (Starts for the door.)
Whoa! Hey-hey, you planning on inviting us?
Nooo, later. (Walks out the door.)
Hey!! Get your ass back here, Tribbiani!! (Joey walks back in, scared.)
Hormones!
What Phoebe meant to say was umm, how come you’re having a party and we’re not invited?
Oh, it’s Ross’s bachelor party.
Sooo?
Are you bachelors?
Nooo!
Are you strippers?
Nooo!
Then you’re not invited. (Starts for the door again.)
All right fine! You’re not invited to the party we’re gonna have either.
Oh-whoa, what party?
Well umm…
The baby shower for Phoebe!
Baby shower. Wow! That sounds sooo like something I don’t want to do! Later! (Finally, he makes his exit.)
I can’t believe I’m gonna have a party! This is so great! (Really excited) A party! (Really, really excited) Yay!! (Suddenly, she starts crying and Rachel moves to comfort her.) I don’t know why.

summary: In this scene, Monica, Rachel, and Phoebe are having breakfast at Monica's apartment. Phoebe is pregnant with triplets and complains about one of the babies kicking another, which she finds distressing. Joey enters and borrows a bowl for a party he's planning. When Rachel and Monica express surprise that they weren't invited, Joey reveals it's Ross's bachelor party, which only bachelors and strippers are invited to. Monica and Rachel retaliate by announcing they're planning a baby shower for Phoebe, which Joey dismisses as something he wouldn't want to attend. Phoebe is initially excited about the baby shower but suddenly becomes emotional for no apparent reason, prompting Rachel to comfort her.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is on the couch as Rachel returns carrying a bunch of shopping bags.

lines.dialogue: Hey!
(depressed) Hi.
So, did shopping make you feel any better about Ross?
Manhattan does not have enough stores.
Well, I think I can help you get over him.
You can?
Yeah. I just need you to bring me some photos of Ross.
Um-hmm.
And a small piece of chocolate.
Okay.
And a glass of tepid water. (She gathers up all of these things.)
Ooh, is this one of those things where you throw it in a bag with some graveyard dirt and hang it from a north-facing tree?

Uh, only if you have the hiccups too. Yeah, the pictures are for you, the water and the chocolate is for me. I just didn't feel like getting up. Okay, I'm gonna show you a picture of Ross. Okay? And you're going to remember all of the bad things about him. All right? Really focus on his flaws.
I can do that. I certainly did it when we were going out.

Okay. Umm, before we get started, I just wanna say for the record that I love Ross, I think he's such a great guy. Here. (Hands her the picture, Rachel grabs it out of her hand.) Okay, now, close your eyes. And imagine that you're with Ross okay and imagine that you're kissing him. And you're-you're running your hands all over his body. And then you run your hands through his hair, but eew-oh gross it's some kind of grease, it's-uck! Hah?
I don't know, his uh, his hair never really bothered me that much, and y'know it was always more crunchy than it was greasy.
Okay, this is going to be harder than I thought. Umm, let's try some uh, aversion therapy.
Okay.
Okay?
All right.
So uh, now look at the picture...
Okay.
All right, and umm... (She grabs the picture and smacks her in the head.)
Ow!
Okay, how do you feel now?
Well, I like you less!

summary: In this scene, Rachel returns to Monica and Rachel's apartment after a shopping spree, clearly still upset about her breakup with Ross. Phoebe tries to help Rachel get over Ross by suggesting a quirky method involving photos of Ross, chocolate, and tepid water. Rachel is initially skeptical but goes along with it. Phoebe then attempts to help Rachel focus on Ross's flaws by having her imagine kissing him and running her hands through his hair, which she describes as greasy. Rachel, however, doesn't seem to be bothered by Ross's hair. Phoebe then resorts to aversion therapy, smacking Rachel in the head with the photo of Ross, which only makes Rachel like Phoebe less. The scene ends with Rachel still not over Ross and Phoebe's unconventional method failing.

background: Scene: Chandlers hotel room. Chandler and Monica are lying in the bed together talking. There's an awkward air between them. They are both clutching the covers in from of them.

lines.dialogue: Well I've-I've never done that with you before.
(In am uneasy voice.) Nope. (She chuckles uneasily.)
So, ahh, how are ya? How ya...How ya... You okay?
Yep, yep...You?
Yes...Yes..Uh-huh, You?(Looking over at her. She looks back.) We did you.
Well...I'd better get going.
Oh yea yea, absolutely.
(Scoots towards the side of the bed.) Could you not look?
I don't want to look.

summary:
In this scene, Chandler and Monica are in Chandler's hotel room after having an intimate moment together for the first time. The atmosphere is awkward and tense, as neither of them knows how to navigate the situation. Both are lying in bed, clutching the covers in front of them, trying to make small talk but failing to find the right words. Chandler awkwardly asks how Monica is doing, and she responds in a similarly uneasy manner. The conversation is stilted, and they both seem unsure of how to proceed.

Monica eventually decides to leave, and Chandler agrees, though the situation remains awkward. Monica asks Chandler not to look as she gets out of bed, and he assures her he doesn't want to look. The scene ends with both characters struggling to deal with the newfound intimacy and the awkwardness that comes with it.

background: Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross’s bachelor party. Ross is thanking Joey for the party.

lines.dialogue: Hey listen man, about the stripper…
Yeah?
Good call!
(banging a spoon against his beer bottle) Okay, a little announcement, a little announcement. I’ve decided that my best man is, my best friend Gunther!
What’s my last name?
Central Perk?
(to Ross) Thanks for not marrying Rachel. (He starts to leave.)
Oh-whoa-wait, Gunther don’t-don’t forget your shirt. (He gives Gunther his shirt and Gunther leaves.)
Hey-hey, what are those?
Oh, little party favours, check it out! (It’s a shirt that reads, "Ross Geller, Bachelor Bash 1998")
Wow! Yeah!
Oh-oh! (Shows him what’s on the back, "Best Man Joey Tribbiani, with a huge picture of him.)

(banging on the bottle again) Okay, okay, a little announcement, I just want everyone to know that the position of my best man is still open! And uh, (to the stripper) so is the position of the bride.
Great!

Smooth man. Yeah, you got some chilie on your neck. (Chandler checks and runs into the bathroom.) Well, I just want to say, thanks everyone, this-this was great. And hey! See you guys Monday morning. (They museum geeks wave at him.) Thanks Joey.
Oh, hey, don’t forget your shirt.
Oh, thanks! (Takes it and throws it back into the box and leaves.)

Okay, hey, museum geeks, party’s over. Okay. Wave bye-bye to the nice lady. There you go. Back to your parent’s basement. All right. (The museum geeks exit and Joey unlocks his door and lets the chick and the duck out.) Come on boys, come on out! Here you go. All right.
Ohhh, look at the little birdies! Are those yours?
Yeah!
Wow, I didn’t know they let you keep chickens and ducks as pets.
Oh yeah-yeah. And I got the duck totally trained. Watch this. Stare at the wall. (The duck complies.) Hardly move. (The duck complies.) Be white. (The duck complies.)
You are really good at that. So uh, I had fun tonight, you throw one hell of a party.
Oh thanks. Thanks. It was great meetin’ ya. And listen if any of my friends gets married, or have a birthday, or a Tuesday…
Yeah, that would be great. So I guess umm, good night.
Oh unless you uh, you wanna hang around.
Yeah?
Yeah. I’ll let you play with my duck.

summary:
In this scene, Ross is at his bachelor party at Chandler and Joey's apartment. Ross expresses his appreciation to Joey for the party, particularly for the stripper, which he finds enjoyable. Chandler, in a playful moment, announces that Gunther is his best man, though Gunther leaves after a brief exchange with Ross. Joey then shows Ross a special shirt he made for the occasion, which Ross appreciates.

Chandler continues to make announcements, jokingly suggesting that the position of best man is still open and even playfully suggesting the stripper could take the bride's place. The party concludes with Ross thanking everyone and leaving, while Joey handles the cleanup and interacts with the stripper. Joey even offers to let the stripper stay and play with his pet duck, adding a light-hearted and humorous touch to the scene.

background: Scene: Joey enters his hotel room. The phone is ringing.

lines.dialogue: Hello?
(Angrily.) Hey, were the hell have you been?!
Hey. I spent the night out. I met this cute bridesmaid. She is so...
I don’t want to hear about her!!
Ahh Pheebs, you know you’re still my number one girl.
No! No, we have an emergency. Okay? Rachel’s coming to London.
Ohh great!!!
No it’s not great. No, she’s coming to tell Ross that she loves him.
(Confused.) But, he loves Emily?
I KNOW THAT!!! You have to stop her!! She’s going to ruin the wedding!!
Okay.
All right, so, okay...
Hold on. Hold on. (Picking up a note pad and writing and reading the message aloud.) Rachel coming. Do...Something.
Okay, so I’m done my part, okay. It’s your responsibility now, okay. The burden is off me, right?
Right!
So tell me about this girl?
Hey.

summary:
In this scene, Joey enters his hotel room to find the phone ringing. He answers it, and Phoebe is on the other end, angry and demanding to know where he has been. Joey casually mentions that he spent the night out with a cute bridesmaid, but Phoebe interrupts, not interested in hearing about her. She reveals that there is an emergency: Rachel is coming to London to tell Ross that she loves him, which could potentially ruin his wedding to Emily. 

Joey is initially excited about the news, but Phoebe explains the seriousness of the situation. She urges Joey to stop Rachel before she causes any damage. Joey agrees, jotting down a quick note to remind himself of the task. Phoebe, feeling relieved that she has passed the responsibility to Joey, asks him to tell her about the bridesmaid again, but Joey simply says "Hey" and the scene ends.

background: Scene: Rachel’s office, Rachel and Sophie are sitting at their desks working as Joanna walks in.

lines.dialogue: Oh, uh, Joanna I was wondering if I could ask you something. There’s an opening for an assistant buyer in Junior Miss…
(interrupting) Okay, but that would actually be a big step down for me.
Well, actually, I meant for me. The hiring committee is meeting people all day and…
Oh. Well, I wish I could say no, but you can’t stay my assistant forever. Neither can you Sophie, but for different reasons.
God, I am so glad you don’t have a problem with this, because if you did, I wouldn’t even consider applying.
Really? Well, in that case…
(interrupting) And that’s I’m so glad… there’s no problem.
That’s fine, actually I’m on the hiring committee, so there’ll be at least one friendly face.
Ohh! That’s great!
You know, Junior Miss is where I started. Oh, I had to sleep with the ugliest guy to get that job.
Really?!

No-ho-ho! (pause) Yeah. (pause) I mean, no-no-no-no-no, don’t you worry, I’m sure with your qualifications you won’t need to sleep with some guy to get that job. Although, I might need some convincing.
Well, I, umm…
Kidding! God, I feel wild today!

summary: In this scene, Rachel is in her office with Sophie when Joanna enters. Rachel hesitates but eventually asks Joanna if she can apply for an open position as an assistant buyer in Junior Miss. Joanna initially misunderstands and thinks Rachel is suggesting she apply for the position, which she considers a step down. When Rachel clarifies that she is the one interested in the position, Joanna acknowledges that Rachel can't remain her assistant forever. Rachel expresses relief that Joanna doesn't have a problem with her applying. Joanna reveals that she is on the hiring committee, which Rachel finds encouraging. The conversation takes a playful turn when Joanna jokes about having to "sleep with the ugliest guy" to get her start in Junior Miss, but quickly clarifies that Rachel won't need to do the same. The scene ends with Joanna playfully teasing Rachel and feeling "wild" that day.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Frank and Alice are there talking with Phoebe.

lines.dialogue: Oh my God! I can’t believe my little brother is married!
Oh I know!! (Both he and Alice squeal hysterically)
You guys, why didn’t you tell me you were eloping?
‘Cause it just sorta happened, y’know we were at the courthouse, we were having lunch…
Wait, wait, why were you at the courthouse?
We were having lunch. Yeah and then all of the sudden we were like, "Hey! Y'know, we’re here, having lunch let’s get married!

Wow, a year and a half ago I didn’t even know I had a brother, and now I have a sister too. (They all hug, and Frank and Alice start kissing.) Okay. Okay. Stop it, don’t. So, I gotta get you a gift now. Is there anything you need?
Uhh, yeah.
We’ve been trying to get pregnant, uh pretty much ever since we got engaged, we thought we’d get a jump on things, y’know no one’s getting any younger.
See the thing is umm, we’re not able to y’know, uh, conceive.
And we’ve tried everything, we’ve seen a bunch of doctors.

Yeah, and they-and they say that our-that our only chance to have a baby is that if they take my sperm, her egg and put it together in a dish and then put it into another girl. So we were wondering if you could be the girl that we could put it into.
(shocked) That’s a really nice gift. I was thinking of like a gravy boat.

summary:
In this scene, Phoebe is surprised to learn that her younger brother Frank and his wife Alice have eloped. They explain that they were at the courthouse for lunch when they spontaneously decided to get married. Phoebe is amazed by the turn of events, as she didn’t even know she had a brother a year and a half ago.

As they discuss gifts, Frank and Alice reveal that they have been trying to get pregnant but have been unsuccessful. They explain that their only chance of having a baby is through in vitro fertilization, where Frank’s sperm and Alice’s egg would be combined in a dish and then implanted into another woman. They ask Phoebe if she would be willing to carry their baby, leaving Phoebe shocked and initially thinking of a more conventional gift like a gravy boat.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey is debriefing Rachel on her rejection earlier that day and telling her what she should’ve done. Ross and Phoebe are watching.

lines.dialogue: Okay, for next time, what do you say?
I have an extra ticket. An extra ticket. Not, two tickets, I have an extra ticket.
So the first time you ask a guy out, he-he turns you down?
He didn’t turn me down! He’s at the game isn’t he? I got the date, I’m just not on it!
(entering) Okay, it’s ready. Come on.
What’s ready?
Just come.
Oh my God!
Wow! Monica!
Great!
This is beautiful!
Oh did you—what did you—did you work for two days straight?
Pretty much. (to Joey) So, what do you, what do you think of the floor?
I don’t know, it looks the same.
You used to have carpet.
Oh yeah!
So I made snacks. Please, just hang out okay? I’m just gonna rest my eyes just a little bit.
Look, Mon, do you want us to uh, come back later?
Oh no-no-no, stay, stay, stay, just keep talking. I’m always the hostess.
Hey!
How’d it go?
Well, she wasn’t sleeping with him.
Oh good!
She is now.
What are you saying?

I’m saying that she… is a devil woman! Y’know I mean you think you know someone and then they turn around and they sleep with Nick! Nick, with his rock hard pecs, and his giant man-nipples! I hate him, I hate her! Well, I don’t hate her, I love her. This is all my fault really.
How? How is your fault?

Because, I-I should’ve called! Y’know if I had just called her after our big, stupid fight, she never would’ve gone out with Nick, and they would’ve ended up in bed together. I threw her at his man nipples!
Honey, this is not your fault, just because you guys had a fight, it does not justify her sleeping with someone.
Well, if-if she thought they were on a break…

summary:
In this scene, Joey is coaching Rachel on how to handle rejection after she tried to invite a guy to a game but wasn't successful in getting a date. Ross and Phoebe are also present, watching the interaction. Monica then enters, announcing that something is ready, and leads everyone to a surprise. It turns out Monica has redecorated Joey and Chandler's apartment, replacing the carpet with a new floor. Joey initially doesn't notice the change but eventually realizes what happened. Monica, exhausted from her efforts, asks everyone to hang out while she rests her eyes.

Meanwhile, Chandler arrives and shares the news that his girlfriend, who he had a fight with, ended up sleeping with someone else named Nick. Chandler blames himself for not calling her after their fight, which led to her seeking comfort elsewhere. Rachel and Ross try to console him, with Ross suggesting that if she thought they were "on a break," it might explain her actions. The scene ends with Chandler feeling guilty and everyone trying to comfort him.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is eating cereal from a bowl she has balanced on her stomach as Joey, Chandler, and Monica return.

lines.dialogue: Hey!
Hey!
Hi!
(To Joey) You ate meat! (Joey is shocked) (To Chandler and Monica) You had sex! (They're shocked.)
No we didn't!
I know you didn't, I was talking about Monica.
Phoebe, I did not have sex.
This pregnancy is throwing me all off.
All right, I'm gonna go say hi the chick and the duck.
Oh, me too!
Why would you need to say hi to them, you've been feeding them for four days?
Oh right, maybe I'll just go home.
Well, we certainly are alone.
Yes! Good thing we have that, 'Not in New York' rule.

Right. Umm, listen since we're-we-re on that subject, umm, I just wanted to tell you that uh, well, I-I was going through a really hard time in London, what with my brother getting married and that guy thinking I was Ross's mother...
Right.
Well, an-anyway, I just-that night meant a lot to me, I guess I'm just trying to say thanks.
Oh. Y'know, that night meant a lot to me too, and it wasn't because I was in a bad place or anything, it just meant a lot to me 'cause, you're really hot! Is that okay?
(laughs) That's okay.
And I'm cute too.
And you're cute too.
Thank you! (They hug.) All right, I gotta go unpack.
Okay.
Bye.
(entering) I'm still on London time, does that count?
That counts!
Oh, good! (They start kissing.)

summary:
In this scene, Phoebe is at Monica and Rachel's apartment, eating cereal in a quirky way, while Joey, Chandler, and Monica return. Phoebe playfully accuses Joey of eating meat and Chandler and Monica of having sex, which catches them off guard. Monica clarifies that she didn't have sex, and Phoebe admits her pregnancy is making her forgetful. Joey and Phoebe then joke about saying hi to the chick and the duck, but Phoebe decides to go home instead.

As Chandler and Monica are left alone, they start a heartfelt conversation about their experience in London. Monica expresses her gratitude for the night they shared, and Chandler reciprocates, admitting that he found her attractive. They both acknowledge their mutual feelings and share a hug. Chandler then jokingly asks if being on London time still counts for their "not in New York" rule, and they end the scene with a kiss.

background: Scene: Chandler and Joey's, erm, Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is there and is getting ready to direct a bunch of strippers, Monica, Rachel, and Phoebe on what to do in the upcoming orgy of lesbian lust. Yes, it’s a dream sequence, this isn’t cable.

lines.dialogue: All right ladies, here’s what we’re gonna do. (Points to a stripper.) You are gonna take off my clothes. (To another two strippers) You two, go get the oils. (To another stripper) And you just constantly scream at the top of your voice, "Chandler’s the king! Chandler’s the king!"
I-I wanna be with her, (points to the stripper next to her) I like her.
Oh, that’s fine! Go with your instincts, go with your instincts.
Wait, now, what am I doing again?
Come on! Would you please pay attention, I could wake up at any moment!
Hi, I’m Joshua, I’m here to pick up Rachel.
No-no-no, that’ not Joshua.

What do you want from me, I’ve never met the guy. So anyway, Rachel, I’m sorry you can’t stay, (Rachel is upset about leaving the orgy with the cigarette guy.) but the rest of us have a lot of work to do. (The cigarette guy starts rubbing Chandler’s back.) What are you doing? (The guy just nods) All right, listen, I’ve got to wake up!

summary:
In this dream sequence, Chandler is directing a group of strippers, including Monica, Rachel, and Phoebe, for an upcoming "orgy of lesbian lust." Chandler assigns roles to each of them, instructing one to take off his clothes, another two to get oils, and another to scream "Chandler’s the king!" Phoebe expresses her desire to be with one of the strippers, and Chandler encourages her to follow her instincts. Monica, however, is confused about her role and Chandler urges her to pay attention, fearing he might wake up at any moment.

The scene takes an unexpected turn when "The Cigarette Guy" (later identified as Joshua) arrives to pick up Rachel, disrupting the fantasy. Rachel protests, claiming it's not really Joshua, but Chandler dismisses her concerns, apologizing for her having to leave the orgy. As the Cigarette Guy starts rubbing Chandler's back, Chandler becomes increasingly uncomfortable and desperate to wake up from the dream.

background: Scene: Joey’s bedroom, he is asleep and snoring loudly. Chandler enters wondering who left their engine running.

lines.dialogue: Are you kidding me?! Joey. Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey!!
(joining in, in his sleep) Joey. Joey. Joey. Joey! Joey!!
Oh. Oh, did-did-did I wake you?

summary: In this scene, Chandler enters Joey's bedroom and is startled by Joey's loud snoring, which he humorously compares to an engine running. Chandler repeatedly calls out Joey's name in an exaggerated manner, trying to wake him up. Surprisingly, Joey, still asleep, starts responding to Chandler's calls in his sleep, mimicking Chandler's tone. Chandler then sarcastically asks if he woke Joey up, adding to the comedic effect of the scene.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, the next morning, Monica and Phoebe are eating breakfast.

lines.dialogue: Ohh!
What?
It kicked! I think the baby kicked!
Oh my God!
Oh no wait, oh no, the elastic on my underwear busted.
(running from his bedroom) Oh my God! I overslept! I was supposed to be on the set a half an hour ago! I gotta get out of here!
Oh wait, Joey, you can’t go like that! You stink!
Look, I know I feel asleep before I could shower and now I don’t have time! They’re just ten blocks away, if I run, I can make it.
Yeah. Run ten blocks, that’ll help the smell.
Hey—whoa, slow down. (Gets a whiff of him) No, keep moving. (Joey runs off.) Wow!
So? How did it go with Joshua last night?
Well, I didn’t see Joshua last night, but I did punch a girl in the face.
What?
Why?
The whole night was horrible, it was pouring down rain, and when I got there, there was no Rachel Green on the list, but there was a Rachel Greep.
Ohh! So, did you get to meet her?
No, there is no Rachel Greep, but then this other girl overheard us and she was all, "I’m Rachel Greep! I’m Rachel Greep!" and he let her right in.
So you hit her in the face?

No, she was already in, but then this big bitch behind me tried to steal my umbrella, so I clocked her. Ohhh! I can’t believe this, all I wanted was a few hours outside of work to see Joshua, so he can go ahead and start falling in love with me.
(going over to comfort her) Aww, Pheebs.
Honey, that’s you’re name.
That’s short for Phoebe?! I thought that was just what we called each other!
Hey! You’re wearing pants!
That’s right! Where are the guys? I’m ready to get drunk and see some strippers.
It’s 9
They got a breakfast buffet.
Hello. (Listens) Oh, hey Ross!
Ooh, let me talk to him!
Oh-oh, my God!
Well, can I just…
(to Chandler) Shh!! (On phone) Wait, what?
She’s shhing me! It’s my phone and she’s shhing me!
Shhh!! Please! What’s he saying?
He’s with Emily at a Bed and Breakfast in Vermont!
What? Oh my God!
What? Who the hell is Emily—(realises) noooo!!

summary:
In this scene, the friends are gathered at Monica and Rachel's apartment, now shared by Chandler and Joey. Phoebe excitedly announces that she felt the baby kick, but it turns out to be the elastic on her underwear breaking. Joey rushes in, panicked because he overslept and needs to get to the set, but he hasn't showered, leading to some humorous comments about his smell.

Rachel then shares her disastrous night, where she was denied entry to a venue because of a mistaken name, and ended up punching a girl who tried to steal her umbrella. Monica and Phoebe are shocked by her story.

Chandler enters, ready to go out with the guys, but Monica receives a call from Ross, who reveals he is with a woman named Emily at a Bed and Breakfast in Vermont. This news surprises and shocks everyone, especially Rachel, who realizes the implications of Ross being with someone new.

background: Scene: A beauty parlour, Rachel is getting a manicure while Chandler, yes Chandler, is getting a petticure (Does that scare you that I know those terms?  Well, it scares me.).

lines.dialogue: Y'know, I can't believe I'm getting my nails done!  And you said it was gonna be fun! (pause) Which it kinda is.  Also, you said there would be other guys here. There are no other guys here!
Chandler, there’s a guy right over there. (Points to the counter)
That’s a mailman! That’s our mailman! (Waves to the mailman) (Sarcastic) Hi. How are ya?

Chandler, don’t worry! This doesn’t make you any less of a guy! (Chandler starts blowing on his fingernails like women do.) That does! (Chandler stops blowing.) What am I sitting on? (She looks and finds a huge nail.) I hate to think what this woman was scratching when this broke off.
Hey, you know who used to have nails like that?
Hmm.
OH…MY…GAWD!! (Yep, you guessed it. It’s Janice.)

summary:
In this scene, Rachel and Chandler are at a beauty parlor. Rachel is getting a manicure, while Chandler, much to his surprise and discomfort, is getting a "petticure" (pedicure). Chandler expresses his disbelief at being there and complains that Rachel promised it would be fun and that there would be other guys present. Rachel points out a mailman as another guy, which Chandler sarcastically acknowledges.

Rachel reassures Chandler that getting a pedicure doesn't make him less of a man, but his attempt to blow on his nails like a woman does. They both notice a large nail on the seat, leading to a humorous comment about what the woman might have been scratching when it broke off.

The scene takes a turn when Janice, a loud and recognizable character, enters with her signature exclamation, "OH…MY…GAWD!!" This unexpected appearance adds an element of surprise and humor to the scene.

background: Scene: Ross and Chandler’s bank, they are there to close their accounts.

lines.dialogue: Hello.
Hi.
We’d like to close our accounts.
Close your accounts? Is there some kind of problem?
No-no.
No, we’d just like to close them.
Okay, Ms. Lambert handles all our closures. (to a beautiful woman) Would you come over here please?
Hi, I’m Karen.
I wanna quit the bank!

summary: In this scene, Ross and Chandler visit their bank to close their accounts. The bank officer is initially concerned that there might be a problem, but Ross and Chandler assure him that they simply want to close their accounts. The officer then calls over Ms. Lambert, a beautiful woman who handles account closures. Chandler, reacting to her presence, humorously exclaims, "I wanna quit the bank!"

background: Scene: A strip club, the girls are there with Chandler, who isn’t enjoying himself.

lines.dialogue: (coming back to the stage and sitting next to Chandler) Okay, I’ve got some Ones, you wanna put them in her panties?
No thanks, Mom!
Oh, no umm, hi, that-that, you have to put that out, ‘cause I’m pregnant.
(No, not the Cigarette Smoking Man from The X-Files.) Well, maybe you and your baby should go to another strip club.
Ha-ha, it’s not my baby, ha-ha-ha! (He leaves.)
Very good, (getting up and sliding a One into the dancer’s hot pants) so good.
(doing the same) I really, really enjoyed it. Very exotic.

(joining them) Well, I just checked our messages and Joshua didn’t call. I mean you’d think he’d be worried about me not showing up at his club. Ugh, you know what makes it so much worse, Ross is all happy in Vermont!
Come on! Look where you are!!
(to the waitress) When you get a sec, another round of daiquiris.
Remember, a virgin for me please.
Oh! And don’t let me leave without getting the name of that carpet guy.
Ahh, come on! Y’know what—y’know what, I think I’m just gonna go home and call Kathy.
Well, if you think it will help.

No! That was a test! In a couple of hours I’m gonna get really drunk and wanna call Kathy and you guys are gonna have to stop me! And then after that, I’m gonna get so drunk, I’m gonna wanna call Janice
You should! How is she?
Ohhh!!
I think somebody needs another lap dance. (Motions for one.)

summary:
In this scene, the group is at a strip club, and Chandler is clearly uncomfortable. Monica and Phoebe are enjoying themselves, engaging in the typical activities at a strip club, while Chandler is not. Phoebe, who is pregnant, asks a man smoking a cigarette to put it out, which he initially refuses to do but eventually leaves. Rachel is upset because Joshua, her love interest, hasn't called, and she's comparing her situation unfavorably to Ross's happiness in Vermont.

Chandler, feeling out of place, decides he wants to leave and calls out the group's behavior, suggesting that they should stop him from getting too drunk and calling his ex-girlfriends, Kathy and Janice. Monica and Phoebe, however, are not taking him seriously and continue to enjoy the club, with Monica even requesting another lap dance for Chandler. The scene ends with the group still at the club, with Chandler's discomfort contrasting with the others' enjoyment.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, later that same night. There is a knock on the door and Chandler answers it to reveal Emily standing behind it.

lines.dialogue: Are we in London?
What are you doing here? You can’t be here!
I’ve uh, I’ve come to talk to Ross.
What?
(pause) Nothing. No, nothing.
I was going to call him, but…
Oh, you came to tell him you love him! I knew it! (Points at Chandler) I was right! (Points to Emily) I’m right, right?
I’d really rather talk to him.
Oh.
I uh, I’ve been to his apartment and he wasn’t there, and uh. I need to talk to him, so do you have any idea where he is?

summary: In this scene, Emily unexpectedly shows up at Chandler and Joey's apartment, surprising everyone. Chandler initially jokes about being in London, but Monica is more focused on Emily's presence. Emily explains that she came to talk to Ross, but Monica excitedly assumes that Emily has come to confess her love for Ross. Emily, however, insists that she just wants to talk to him privately. She mentions that she went to Ross's apartment but couldn't find him, and asks if anyone knows where he might be. The scene ends with Emily's request for information about Ross's whereabouts.

background: Scene: Ross’s bedroom, he has fallen asleep waiting for Emily to call. He is awaken by the phone.

lines.dialogue: (Answers the phone.) Hello?
Ross.
Emily, hi! Uh, how-how was you flight?
It was dreadful. I felt terrible about how I acted when you said those wonderful things.
No, no, that-that, that’s all right. Umm, I’m just glad you called.
Ross umm, there’s something that I’ve got to tell you, there’s-there’s someone else.
Does that mean the same thing in England as it does in America?

summary: In this scene, Ross is asleep in his bedroom, waiting for Emily to call. He wakes up when the phone rings and answers it. Emily tells him that her flight was dreadful and she feels bad about how she reacted when Ross said nice things to her. Ross reassures her that it's okay and he's just glad she called. However, Emily then reveals that there's someone else in her life. Ross, confused, jokingly asks if "there's someone else" means the same thing in England as it does in America, implying that he's unsure if she's breaking up with him or if there's another meaning to her statement.

background: Scene: Outside Cheryl's apartment.

lines.dialogue: So you want to come inside?
(mustering up courage) Yes. Yes I do. (They go inside.)

I'll be right back. Make yourself comfortable. (Ross attempts to clear a place for his coat and fold it small enough to fit. Then hit sits on the couch. Something falls on him from above and he brushes his neck off frantically.)
(sneaking up behind Ross) Guess who?
Department of Sanitation?
It's me!
Oh! (She kisses him) Ah. (They kiss more, and move down onto the couch. Ross's hand moves under some garbage) Aw! (His hand is covered with something brown and gooey.)
What?
(trying to make his disgust into lust) Ah, Cheryl!
Oh, Ross!

summary:
In this scene, Ross and Cheryl are outside Cheryl's apartment. Cheryl invites Ross inside, and he agrees, showing some nervousness.
