Once inside, Cheryl leaves briefly, telling Ross to make himself comfortable. Ross tries to arrange his coat neatly but ends up sitting on the couch, where something falls on him from above, causing him to react with surprise.

Cheryl then sneaks up behind Ross and playfully asks, "Guess who?" Ross humorously guesses "Department of Sanitation," but Cheryl reveals herself with a kiss. The two share a passionate moment, moving to the couch, where Ross accidentally touches something messy and gooey under the couch. Despite his initial reaction of disgust, he tries to play it off as part of the moment, and they continue their interaction.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are sitting at the table.

lines.dialogue: Would you ever be a surrogate for anyone?
It depends on who asked.
What if I asked?
Oh, Mon, sure.
Really?
Yes. (Pause) You’re not asking are you?
No.
Yes! Totally!
Oh! Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! Yes! Thank you! (Runs back to Chandler)

summary: In this scene, Monica and Rachel are sitting at the table, and the conversation turns to surrogacy. Monica casually asks Rachel if she would ever consider being a surrogate for someone, to which Rachel responds that it depends on who is asking. Monica then playfully asks if Rachel would do it for her, and Rachel agrees, thinking it's hypothetical. However, Monica reveals that she is indeed asking for a reason, and Kathy, who has been listening in, excitedly thanks Rachel and runs off, presumably to tell Chandler. The scene ends with a humorous twist, suggesting that Rachel has just agreed to be a surrogate for Monica and Chandler.

background: Scene: Joanna’s office, Rachel and Chandler are still negotiating.

lines.dialogue: I ah, will buy and wrap all of your Christmas gifts.
No!
I ah… Oh! I’ll squeeze you fresh orange juice every morning!
With extra pulp?
(happily) Yeah!!
No!
D’oh!! (pause) I’ve got it!
You don’t have it.
I have so got it. There’s gonna be rumours about this, there’s no way to stop it. Sophie knows, Monica and Phoebe know.
How do Monica and Phoebe know?
Oh, I called them. And when they ask me what I saw, I can be very generous (Holds her hands far apart) or very (In a high pitched voice) stingy.
(intrigued) Go on.
I can make you a legend. I can make you this generation’s Milton Berle.
And Milton Berle has a…
Ohh, not compared to you. (Chandler nods in agreement)

summary: In this scene, Rachel and Chandler are negotiating, with Rachel trying to convince Chandler to agree to something. Rachel offers various concessions, such as buying and wrapping his Christmas gifts and providing fresh orange juice every morning, but Chandler repeatedly refuses. Rachel then suggests that she can control the rumors about what she saw, implying that she has some leverage over the situation. She mentions that she has already informed Monica and Phoebe, and she can either exaggerate or downplay the details, making Chandler a "legend" or not, depending on what she says. Chandler seems intrigued by the idea of being made into a legend, and the scene ends with him nodding in agreement, indicating that Rachel's offer has swayed him.

background: Scene: Bloomingdale’s, Rachel’s new job, she is waiting for Joshua and practising how to ask him out.

lines.dialogue: Would you like to go to a basketball game with me? (Tries again.) You know, its funny, basketball, because I happen to have tickets too… (Tries again.) Umm, who likes the Knicks—(Joshua comes in from the dressing room.)
What do you think?
Oh! Well, as a single woman, who is available, I think you look great!
Huh. (She starts brushing the lint off and checking him out in the mirror.) Yeah?
Yep. Oh, yeah, look you great. (She puts her arm in his and checks how they would look as a couple.) Oh yeah. Yeah, this looks great. (Pause) Umm, so you like it?
I do. I do. I love it. In fact, I think I’m gonna wear it home.
Great.
All right, thank you so much for all your help.
Sure.
Well, I guess this is uh, I guess this is it.
Yeah-eah-ha!
Thanks. (He starts to leave) Maybe I’ll see in the spring, with the uh, y’know, for the uh, bathing suits.
Oh well, you don’t want to do that now?!
Ah, that’s okay, thanks.
Okay.
Anyway, hopefully, I’ll see you around sometime. (He goes out the door.)
Basketball!
(coming back in) I’m sorry.
I uh, I have two tickets to the Knicks game tonight if you’re interested, just as a thank you for this week.
Wow! That would be great.
Really?
Yeah, that would be fantastic! My-my nephew is crazy about the Knicks! This is fantastic, thank you so much Rachel. (He takes the tickets and leaves as Mr. Waltham returns.)
Good morning.
Hi!

summary:
In this scene, Rachel is working at Bloomingdale’s and is preparing to ask Joshua out to a basketball game. She practices her lines nervously, but before she can fully ask him, Joshua appears from the dressing room, asking her opinion on an outfit. Rachel compliments him enthusiastically, even going as far as to imagine them as a couple. Joshua is appreciative of her help and decides to wear the outfit home.

As Joshua is about to leave, Rachel finally gets the courage to offer him the basketball tickets, framing it as a thank-you for his help during the week. Joshua happily accepts, mentioning that his nephew is a big Knicks fan. The scene ends with Mr. Waltham entering, and Joshua leaving with the tickets.

background: Scene: Kathy’s play, Ross and Chandler are waiting for her in the lobby after the play.

lines.dialogue: I’m right! Right? There was like no chemistry between them. Before they had heat, and now there’s no heat! Now you know what this means, Joey told us what this means!
All right, let’s not jump to any conclusions. All right? There was some sexual chemistry between them.
Come on, it was like cousins having sex up there!
Here she comes. Don’t say a word, okay? Just be cool, don’t be…y'know you.
Hey you guys!
Hey!
Hi! (Kisses Chandler) Thank you so much for coming again. Did you like it tonight?
Oh, absolutely! (Chandler mumbles something.)
Wasn’t Nick funny when he couldn’t get his match lit?
It’s a good play, isn’t it?
Oh, I loved the play. You were great, and Nick ditto. Clearly you’re having sex with him.
Okay, I… (Walks away.)
Clearly, I’m having sex with him?
Oh come on, it was so obvious! There was no chemistry between you two!
Okay, so let me just get this straight. You’re accusing me of cheating on you, and insulting my performance?
Y’know, I-I could see how this could happen, y'know you’re up there every night, you’re naked, touching, kissing.
Acting! Chandler, this is my job! I’m-I’m playing a part in a play! How can you not trust me?!
Well, you can understand, given how we started.
Oh, wow. I can’t believe you’re throwing that in my face.
Well, that is what happened, and I don’t even see you denying this!
I’ll tell you what, Chandler, why don’t you call me when you grow up!
Yeah, well, don’t expect that to happen anytime soon!

summary: In this scene, Ross and Chandler are waiting in the lobby after watching Kathy's play. Chandler is convinced that there is no chemistry between Kathy and her co-star, Nick, suggesting that they might be having an affair. Ross tries to calm Chandler down and advises him not to confront Kathy. When Kathy arrives, she asks for their opinions on the play, and Chandler bluntly accuses her of having an affair with Nick, based on his perceived lack of chemistry between them on stage. Kathy is shocked and hurt by Chandler's accusation, pointing out that she is simply acting in her role and that he should trust her. Chandler brings up their own past, implying that their relationship started under questionable circumstances, and Kathy responds by telling him to call her when he "grows up." The scene ends with a tense exchange between the two.

background: Scene: An airport in New York.

lines.dialogue: (Running to the ticket counter) Ooh, ooh, ooh,ooh,ooh. (Slightly out of breath) Hi.
(Cheerfully.) Hello.
(Faking cheerfulness.) Hello. Umm, when is your next flight to London?
(looking at her computer terminal) There’s one leaving in thirty minutes.
Ohh, good.
And I do have one seat left.
Ohh, thank you, thank you, thank you.
The last minute fare on this ticket is twenty seven hundred dollars.
(looking through her wallet.) Ohh, I just don’t think I have enough left on my credit card.
Well you can split it with another credit card.
Ohh, okay, how about five. (She hands her all the credit cards.) Ohh, thank you.
I’m just going to need to see your passport.

(Looking through her purse.) Okay, you know what? I don’t have it, but I can tell you exactly where it is on my night stand, and...okay. But you know what? I have my drivers license and I have a twenty. (She slides it across the counter.)
(Slides the twenty back and tosses her credit card onto the counter.)

summary:
In this scene, Rachel is in a hurry at the airport, trying to catch a flight to London. She asks the ticket agent about the next available flight, which is leaving in thirty minutes with one seat left. Rachel is relieved and expresses her gratitude. However, when the ticket agent mentions the high last-minute fare of $2,700, Rachel realizes she doesn't have enough on her credit card. The agent suggests splitting the payment across multiple cards, which Rachel agrees to.

As the transaction proceeds, the agent asks for Rachel's passport, but Rachel realizes she doesn't have it with her. She tries to explain where it is and offers her driver's license and a $20 bill instead. The agent rejects the $20 and returns her credit cards, indicating that the transaction cannot proceed without the passport. The scene ends with Rachel's attempt to board the flight being thwarted by her lack of identification.

background: Scene: Ross’s apartment, Carol has come to pick up Ben.

lines.dialogue: (opening the door.) Hey!
Hey! How’s Ben?

Well, I asked him if he wanted to eat, he said, "No." I asked him if he wanted to sleep, he said, "No." I asked him what he wanted to do, he said, "No." So, he’s sweeping. (We see Ben playing with a broom and a dustpan.)
Hey, Ben! Hey!
So umm, any word from Susan?
Ooh, yeah! She said she’s having sooo much fun with Emily.
Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Uh, by the by, did it uh, did it ever occur to you that, I don’t know, maybe they might be having a little too much fun?
What’s too much fun?
Y’know, the kind of fun, you and Susan had when we were married.
Oh my God, you are so paranoid!
Am I?!
Yes!
Am I?!
I can’t speak for Emily, but Susan is in a loving, committed relationship.

Uh-huh, Carol, so were we. All right, just-just imagine for a moment, Susan meets someone and-and they really hit it off. Y’know? Say-say they’re coming back from the theatre, and they-they stop at a pub for a couple of drinks, they’re laughing, y’know, someone innocently touches someone else… There’s electricity, it’s new. It’s exciting. Are you telling me there isn’t even the slightest possibility of something happening?
Maybe.
OH MY GOD!! I didn’t really believe it until you just said it!!

summary:
In this scene, Ross and Carol are at Ross's apartment, where Carol has come to pick up their son, Ben. Ross mentions that Ben has been uninterested in eating or sleeping and is currently playing with a broom. Carol updates Ross on Susan, her partner, who is enjoying time with her friend Emily.

Ross expresses his paranoia about Susan potentially having "too much fun" with Emily, hinting at the possibility of an affair. Carol dismisses his concerns, calling him paranoid. However, Ross presses the issue, painting a hypothetical scenario where Susan and Emily might develop feelings for each other. Carol reluctantly acknowledges the possibility, which shocks Ross, confirming his fears. The scene ends with Ross feeling validated in his suspicions, despite Carol's reassurances.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Continued from earlier, Rachel is now telling everyone of her experience in the garbage room.

lines.dialogue: Whoa-whoa, Treeger made you cry?
Yes! And he said really mean things that were only partly true.
I’m gonna go down there and teach that guy a lesson.
Joey, please don’t do that. I think it’s best that we just forget about it.
That’s easy for you to say, you weren’t almost just killed.
All right that’s it, school is in session! (Exits and slams the door.)
(Picking up a card from Chandler’s wallet.) My God! Is this a gym card?
Oh yeah, gym member. I try to go four times a week, but I’ve missed the last 1200 times.
So why don’t you quit?

You don’t think I’ve tried? You think I like having 50 dollars taken out of my bank account every month? No, they make you go all the way down there! Then they use all of these phrases and peppiness to try and confuse you! Then they bring out Maria.
Who is Maria?
Oh Maria. You can’t say no to her, she’s like this lycra spandex covered gym…treat.
You need me to go down there with you and hold your hand?
No!
So you’re strong enough to face her on your own?
Oh no, you’ll have to come.

summary: In this scene, Rachel recounts her upsetting encounter with the building superintendent, Mr. Treeger, in the garbage room, where he made her cry by saying mean things that were only partly true. Joey, outraged, decides to confront Mr. Treeger, despite Monica's plea to let it go. Meanwhile, Monica discovers Chandler's gym membership card and questions why he continues to pay for a gym he never uses. Chandler explains the gym's manipulative tactics, particularly their use of a persuasive employee named Maria, who he describes as a "gym treat" he can't resist. Ross offers to accompany Chandler to the gym to help him cancel his membership, showing Chandler's reluctance to face Maria alone.

background: Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is complaining about going to the clinic.

lines.dialogue: This sucks! I didn’t know I had to stay up all night before I went to this stupid sleep clinic! I’m so tired!
It’s 6
Yeah, well…
(entering) Hi!
Hey, I hear that you and Joshua are going out to dinner with Ross and Emily, and I think that’s, I think that’s really cool.
Yeah, Rach, I think you’re handling that really well.
Handling it? What do you mean, handling it? There’s nothing to handle. Now, maybe I would have a problem with this if it wasn’t for me and Joshua. Y’know, they’re not gonna get married anyway!
What?

Come on! They rushed into this thing so fast it’s ridiculous! I mean, they’re gonna be engaged for like what? A year? And somewhere along the way, one of them is gonna realise what they’ve done and they’re call the whole thing off. I’m telling ya, you’re gonna be dancing at my wedding before you’re dancing at there’s.
Yeah, well, I don’t dance at weddings.
Why not?
Because weddings are a great place to meet women, and when I dance, I look like this… (Starts to dancing really, really, really badly. Ross enters behind him and he stops.)
Hey man.
Hey!
So, what are you guys doing four weeks from today?
Nothing.
Nothing.
I am… (Looks in his date book.) free!
Great! Because Emily and I are getting married in a month!
What?!
Yep!
In a month?
Yeah!
You mean, you mean 30 days?
Yeah.
From now?
Yeah.
Well, that’s great.

Yeah! Yeah, Emily always wanted to get married in this beautiful place that her parents got married, but it’s going to be torn down, so… I mean, I-I know it’s crazy, but everything up ‘til now has been so crazy, and I don’t know, this just feels right. Y’know?
(still looking in date book) Hey! That’s the day after I stop menstruating! (They all look at him.) This isn’t mine.

summary: In this scene, Joey is complaining about having to stay up all night before going to a sleep clinic, feeling exhausted. Rachel enters and mentions that she’s going out to dinner with Joshua, Ross, and Emily, which Chandler and Joey commend her for handling well. Rachel dismisses Ross and Emily’s engagement, predicting that they’ll break up before getting married. Chandler reveals that he doesn’t dance at weddings because he uses them as opportunities to meet women, but his dancing is hilariously bad. Ross then enters and announces that he and Emily are getting married in a month, shocking everyone, especially Rachel, who had just dismissed the idea of their marriage lasting. Joey, in his usual comedic fashion, jokes about the timing of the wedding, mistaking someone else’s datebook for his own.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Rachel, Phoebe, and Chandler are there. Monica is entering from her room.

lines.dialogue: Hey Mon, what are you doing now? Wanna come see a movie with us?
Uhh, y'know actually I was gonna do some laundry.
Oh.
Hey Chandler, wanna do it with me?
Sure, I'll do it with ya.
Okay.
Okay great, hold on a sec! (She runs to her room and returns carrying a huge bag of laundry.) Oh, here you go! You don't mind do ya? That would really help me out a lot! Thanks!
I mean I-I don't I think I have enough quarters.
I have quarters! (She holds up a bag of quarters.)
(entering) Hey!
Hey Ross! Any word on the apartment yet?
Well, I called over there and it turns out Ugly Naked Guy is subletting it himself and he's already had like a hundred applicants.
Oh.
No-no, I got the edge. I know it's not exactly ethical but I sent him a little bribe to
Oh, is it that pinball machine with the big bow on it?
No.
That new mountain bike?
No.
Well what did you send?
A basket of mini-muffins.
But there's a whole table of mini-muffin baskets. Which one did you send?
The small one.
What?! You-you actually thought that basket was gonna get you the apartment?
Well yeah! Someone sent us a basket at work once and people went crazy over those little muffins. It was the best day.
Your work makes me sad.
Oh man! I want that place so much!! I was so sure that was gonna work! There's twelve bucks I'll never see again! (Exits.)
All right honey, we'd better go if we wanna catch that movie.
Bye!
Bye!
Bye Chandler! (She walks up to him.) (Quietly.) I miss you already. (She pinches his butt.)
(after they've left) Okay, did you see that?! With the inappropriate and the pinching!!
Actually, I did!
Okay, so now do you believe that she's attracted to me?
Ohhh, oh my God! Oh my God! She knows about us!
Are you serious?
Phoebe knows and she's just trying to freak us out! That's the only explanation for it!
(a little hurt) Okay but what about y'know my pinchable butt and my bulging biceps—She knows!

summary:
In this scene, Monica, Rachel, Phoebe, and Chandler are hanging out at Monica and Rachel's apartment. Rachel invites Monica to join them for a movie, but Monica initially declines, saying she wants to do laundry instead. Chandler offers to join her, and Rachel quickly takes advantage by handing over her laundry as well.

Meanwhile, Ross enters and updates everyone on his attempt to secure a new apartment. He reveals that he bribed the landlord, Ugly Naked Guy, with a basket of mini-muffins, hoping it would give him an edge in securing the place. The group is skeptical about the effectiveness of his bribe, and Ross leaves disappointed.

After Ross exits, Rachel and the others prepare to leave for the movie, bidding Monica and Chandler goodbye. Phoebe, however, lingers and playfully pinches Chandler's butt, which leads to a moment of tension between Monica and Chandler. They realize that Phoebe might know about their relationship and is teasing them, causing Chandler to feel a bit self-conscious about his "pinchable butt."

background: Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is pacing as Joey enters.

lines.dialogue: Dude! How come you took off?
Oh, I just went for a walk, around the living room. Whatever…
Is something wrong?
No. No I'm just tired. Y'know, from-from the walk.
Okay.
You dove in front of Ross! Ross!
That's what this is about! Oh my God, you hate Ross!
I do not hate Ross!
Of course you do! I saved him! You're mad at me! It all adds up! You want Ross out of the picture.
What picture?
I don't know, but I don't like what I'm hearing!
Look I'm very glad that you saved Ross from the car backfire, but y'know, it could've been a bullet and you y'know, you didn't try to save me!
Ohh, you're upset because you think I chose Ross over you! No! I…knew…you could take care of yourself. Y'know, I mean Ross, he need help. He's not street like us!
When it comes down to it, you would risk your life for Ross before you would for me. That's the bottom line.
Well, no, not exactly! All right, look, I, I wasn't trying to save Ross. Okay? My sandwich was next to Ross. All right? I was, I was trying to save my sandwich.
From a bullet!
I know it doesn't make much sense…
Much sense?!
Look Chandler, it was instinct! Okay? I just went for it!
So you risked your life, for a sandwich!
I know it sounds crazy, but Chandler this is (Goes and picks up the sandwich) the greatest sandwich in the world!
So you didn't uh, choose Ross before me.
No! I would never do that! You-you're like my brother!
Really?!
Yeah! In fact, to prove how much you mean to me, (He unwraps the sandwich and holds it out for Chandler) here.
Thanks. (He grabs the sandwich.)
No, eh, oh-oi, easy, it's not a hot dog!
How good is that?
(with his mouthful) Oh-oi-ho, yeah!
See?
Hm-hmm. (Goes to take another bite.)
Oh-whoa-hey, dude, what are you doing?!
I thought you were showing me how much you mean to me.
Yeah. With a bite! (Takes back the sandwich.) Gee-e-e-eez!

summary:
In this scene, Chandler is visibly upset and pacing around the apartment when Joey enters. Chandler initially brushes off Joey's concern, claiming he's just tired from a walk. However, Joey soon realizes that Chandler is upset because Joey had jumped in front of Ross to protect him from a car backfire, but didn't do the same for Chandler. Chandler feels that Joey values Ross more than him, which hurts his feelings.

Joey, trying to explain himself, reveals that he wasn't actually trying to save Ross—he was trying to save his sandwich, which was next to Ross. Chandler is incredulous, pointing out that Joey risked his life for a sandwich. Joey defends his actions, calling it instinct and insisting that the sandwich is the "greatest sandwich in the world."

To prove his loyalty to Chandler, Joey offers him a bite of the sandwich. Chandler takes a big bite, much to Joey's surprise, who then quickly takes the sandwich back, realizing Chandler misunderstood the gesture. The scene ends with Joey expressing frustration, while Chandler seems to have lightened up a bit, enjoying the sandwich.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Chandler is on the couch as Monica joins him.

lines.dialogue: Hey.
Hey. Okay, so umm, since that video camera thing didn't work out uh, I thought that I would give you just a little preview. (Hands him a Polaroid.)
(gasps) You're naked in this picture!
I know.
Ross?
(in a stupor) Hey Chandler. (Sees Monica.) Monica!
Ross, are you okay?
I'm fine! I saw a psychiatrist at work today.
Why?!
On account of my rage.
Which I may say, right now, is out of control.
He gave me a pill for it.
A pill?

Uh-huh. Well, when the psychiatrist told me I had to take a leave of absence because I yelled at my boss I started to get worked up again, so he offered me a tranquilizer. And I thought was a good idea so, I took it.
Wait a minute, they're making you take time off work?
And you're okay with that?
I don't know. It's going to be weird not having a job for a while, but I, I definitely don't care about my sandwich.

summary: In this scene, Monica hands Chandler a Polaroid of herself, which he is surprised to find her naked in. Meanwhile, Ross enters the scene in a dazed state, explaining that he saw a psychiatrist at work due to his anger issues. The psychiatrist prescribed him a tranquilizer and recommended a leave of absence from work. Ross seems to be in a tranquilized state, not fully understanding the implications of his situation, and is more concerned about not caring about his sandwich. Chandler and Monica express concern about Ross's state and the fact that he is being forced to take time off work.

background: Scene: Chandler and Joey's, 3:02 A.M., Chandler is up. There's a knock on the door and Chandler answers it.

lines.dialogue: (quietly) Hi!
(quietly) Hi! (They both start kissing.)
Monica? What time is it?
Uhh, 9. (He pushes the clock into the sink.)
But it's dark out.
Well that's because you always sleep to noon, silly! This is what 9 looks like.
I guess I'll get washed up then. Watch that sunrise. (He goes into the bathroom.)
I'm really getting tired of sneaking around.
I know, me too. Hey! Y'know what if we went away for a whole weekend? Y'know we'd have no interruptions and we could be naked the entire time.
All weekend? That's a whole lotta naked.
Yeah, I can say that I have a conference and you can say you have a chef thing.
Ohh, I've always wanted to go to this culinary fair that they have in Jersey!
Okay, y'know your not though. Let's go. (He starts for his bedroom.)
Wait! What about Joey?

summary:
In this scene, Chandler and Monica are sneaking around to spend time together, trying to avoid Joey finding out about their relationship. It's 3:02 A.M., and Monica has come over to Chandler's apartment. They start kissing, but Joey wakes up and asks what time it is. Chandler lies and says it's 9 A.M., even pushing the clock into the sink to hide the time. Monica plays along, teasing Joey about his sleeping habits.

After Joey goes to the bathroom, Monica expresses her frustration with sneaking around. Chandler suggests they go away for a weekend, promising uninterrupted time together where they could be "naked the entire time." Monica agrees, suggesting they use excuses to cover their absence—Chandler with a conference and Monica with a culinary fair in Jersey. However, they worry about what to do with Joey while they're gone.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, a post-coital Monica and Chandler are recovering on the couch.

lines.dialogue: That was amazing!
Phoebe and Gary are so gonna hear about this at dinner.
That was amazing.
We are the hottest! Huh? No one is hotter than we are! You're the best.
No, you're the best.
No, you're the best.
No, you're the best.
I am the best.
(entering) Hey guys! (Sees their state of undress) What 'cha been doin'? (Has a silly grin.)
(looking out the window) Hey Joey! Isn't that the girl that waved at you the other day?
I don't know. But I can see through your sheet. (He looks out the window.) Yeah, yeah, that's her. But y'know what? Doesn't matter, I'm never gonna get to meet her anyway.
Why?
Because it's impossible to find her apartment! She lives in some like of hot girl parallel universe, or something.
What are you talking about? (Pointing out the window.) She obviously lives on the second floor, seventh apartment from the left!
No. No. No. She lives on the third floor, eighth apartment from the left.
No, those first two windows, (Points) that's the lobby. And y'know the other one over there, that's the stairway. You've been counting wrong.
I did not know that! Thank you Monica. (Starts to leave) I can't believe I almost lost another girl because of counting.

summary: In this scene, Monica and Chandler are basking in the afterglow of a passionate moment on the couch, exchanging playful compliments about being "the best." Monica mentions they'll brag about it to Phoebe and Gary at dinner, emphasizing how "hot" they are. Joey enters, catching them in a slightly disheveled state, and playfully asks what they've been up to. Monica distracts Joey by pointing out a girl he had previously noticed, leading to a humorous exchange about Joey's inability to locate her apartment. Monica and Joey engage in a comedic debate over the exact location of the girl's apartment, with Monica ultimately correcting Joey's counting mistake. Joey leaves, grateful for the correction, while Monica and Chandler continue their playful banter.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning, Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe are eating breakfast.

lines.dialogue: (entering from her room) Hey, guess what I'm doing this weekend! I'm going to this culinary fair in New Jersey.
Oh weird, Chandler just told us he's got a conference there!
Oh now that-that-that's funny, it seems like Chandler's conference could've been in Connecticut or Vermont.
I'm not in charge of where the conference is held. Do you want people to think it's a fake conference? It's a real conference.
(entering) Hey.
Hey!
Hey.
Is Rachel here? I gotta talk to her.
No, she's out shopping.
Damn!
What's going on?
I told Emily to come. And I just need to y'know, talk to Rachel about it.
Wait a minute! So when Emily comes you're just, you're not gonna see Rachel anymore?
Well look, I'm just trying to focus on the "I get to see my wife," part, all right? And not the part that makes me do this. (He takes a big swig of Pepto Bismol.)
Wow, so you guys are, you're never gonna be in the same room together? How is that even gonna work?
I have no idea. I mean… But-but I assure you I will figure it out.
Doesn’t seem like it's going to work, I mean…
(entering) Hi, guys!
Hi!
Uh, hey!
What's going on?
We're flipping Monica's mattress.
So I'm thinking, basically we pick it up and then we flip it.
Yeah that's better than my way.
Oh okay, hey guys, would you flip mine too?
Aww, man! (They go into Monica's room.)
(going through the mail) Oh look! A letter from my mom.
So, Rach, y'know-y'know how Emily's coming right?
Oh yeah! I know.

summary: In this scene, Monica announces she's going to a culinary fair in New Jersey, which coincidentally is the same location as Chandler's conference. Chandler defends the legitimacy of his conference, while Monica seems suspicious. Ross enters and expresses his urgency to talk to Rachel about Emily coming to visit, hinting at the tension between his relationships with Emily and Rachel. Phoebe questions how Ross plans to avoid Rachel when Emily is around, and Ross admits he's unsure but will figure it out. The scene ends with Rachel entering, unaware of the conversation, and the group shifts focus to flipping mattresses.

background: Scene: Outside Central Perk, Phoebe is walking up and notices a car that is parked half on the curb and right in front of the door, making it difficult for people to enter Central Perk.

lines.dialogue: Excuse me, is this your car?
Yeah.
Well I don't think it's very nice of you to park here, y'know you're blocking the entrance.
Don't worry about it. It's not a problem.
Well, it's a problem for me, which means it's a problem for you 'cause I'm a cop. (Shows the badge.)
(he reaches into the car and slams his siren on the roof.) So am I!
Ohh, no. (Pause) Oh okay, so you're a cop which means you can park anywhere, 'cause I know that 'cause I'm a cop too. So, all right, keep up the good work. 10-4. (Tries to leave.)
(stopping her) Hey, wait a second! So wait, what precinct are you with?
I-I'm with the umm, the 57th.
Oh, I know a guy in homicide up there.
I'm in vice. Yeah, in fact I'm undercover right now. I'm a whore.
Who-who else is in vice up there?
Umm, do you know, umm Sipowicz?
Sipowicz? No, I don't think so.
Yeah, big guy, kinda bald.
No, I don't know him.
(starts to walk away, but stops) Don’t try to call him or anything, 'cause he's not there, he's out. His umm, his partner just died.
Wow umm, tell Sipowicz I'm real sorry for his loss.
I-I sure will, take care. (Starts walking off.)
(following her) Hey by the way, I'm sure Sipowicz is gonna be all right. I heard that kid from Silver Spoons is really good. (Phoebe's stunned) And where did you find my badge?
Oh. (She starts laughing. Then she throws the badge at him and runs away.)

summary: In this scene, Phoebe notices a car parked half on the curb and blocking the entrance to Central Perk. She confronts the driver, a guy who dismisses her concerns. Phoebe then pretends to be a cop by showing a fake badge, but the guy reveals that he is also a cop. Phoebe tries to bluff her way out by claiming to be undercover in vice, mentioning a fictional cop named Sipowicz. The real cop, however, starts questioning her, and Phoebe eventually admits her deception by laughing and throwing the badge at him before running away.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Gary, Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler are there.

lines.dialogue: (To Phoebe) Would you like some more coffee, baby-doll?
I'm fine, thanks.
(To Monica) Yeah, see, I can't pull of baby-doll can I?
No. I think we learned that from the sugarlips incident. I'm gonna get some tea.
Okay.
Hiya doin' pumpkin?
Nope. (Chandler nods in agreement.)

summary: In this scene, the group is at Central Perk. Gary, a new romantic interest of Phoebe's, tries to be charming by calling her "baby-doll" and offers her more coffee, which she politely declines. Chandler, observing this, tries to mimic Gary's affectionate nickname with Monica, but she reminds him of a previous failed attempt ("sugarlips incident") and declines his attempt. Monica then leaves to get tea. Chandler tries another nickname, "pumpkin," with Phoebe, but she immediately shuts it down, and Chandler nods in agreement, acknowledging his inability to pull off such terms.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is returning from his horrible trek back home without pants on. The whole gang is there.

lines.dialogue: Oh my God!
We heard about your pants, I'm so sorry.
This year was supposed to be great! But, it's only the second day and I'm a loser with stupid leather pants that don't even fit!
No. No, you're not a loser.
Look at me! (Chandler squeaks in an attempt not to make fun of him.)
Hey, hey, look. Look Ross, Ben drew a picture of you! (Shows him Ben's picture.) Huh? You're-you're a cowboy!
Oh, be-because of the leather pants.
See? Ben doesn't think you're a loser, he thinks you're a cowboy! Now that's something.
Yeah!
That really is something; that's really cool.
Howdy partner!

Maybe I should get another pair! Ooh, y'know, they-they had some with fringe all down the sides. (Chandler starts rubbing his temple again.) I'm gonna go kiss Ben goodnight. (He starts to head for Monica's bedroom.) I can't believe he thinks I'm a cowboy. (Pause.) I would make a good cowboy. (He struts into Monica's room.)
Okay, now that everything's wrapped up here, I think I'm, I'm gonna go do my laundry.
Oh yeah, me too. Y'know if this shirt is dirty. (Smells it.) Yep.
Okay, I'm gonna go too. I'm gonna go to the airport. I figure if I hang around there long enough, someone's bound to leave one of those planes unattended.
Good luck, honey!
Bye! (She exits, leaving Rachel and Joey alone.)
Hey, uh, Joey?
Umm?
Remember that big thing I was gonna tell you about?
Oh, no! (Starts that screaming thing again. Rachel stops him by pulling his fingers out of his ears.)
I'm not gonna tell you, but if you found out on your own, that would be okay and then we could talk about it. Right?
Well, then it wouldn't be a secret. So yeah, that would be okay. Yeah. Yeah!
(quietly) Yeah. Well. (Pause.) Hey uh Joe, would mind going over to Chandler's bedroom and get that book back that he borrowed from me?
Now? You want me to go over there now?
Yeah!
Do you know something?
Do you know something?
I might know something.
I might know something too.
What's the thing you know?
Oh no, I can't tell you until you tell me what you know.
I can't tell you what I know.
Well then I can't tell you what I know.
Okay, fine.
You don't know!
All right, how about I go over there and I will walk into Chandler's bedroom and I will see that thing that I think that I know is actually the thing that I think that I know! (Note
(gasps) YOU KNOW!!!!
AND YOU KNOW!!!
Yeah, I know!!!!
Chandler and Monica?!! Oh, this is unbelievable!! How long have you known?

Too long! Oh my God, Rach, I've been dying to talk to someone about this for so long! Listen, listen, we can't say anything about this to anybody, they're so weird about that! Listen… (Phoebe returns and interrupts them.)
Hey!
Hey! It's raining. I don't want to fly in the rain. So…
Oh, I am going to go for a walk in the rain.
Ohhh, yeah, me too.
That's weird. (Pause.) I bet they're doing it.

summary:
In this scene, Ross returns to Monica and Rachel's apartment after a humiliating experience involving his leather pants, which he had to remove during a long trek home. The gang comforts him, with Monica showing him a drawing by Ben that depicts Ross as a cowboy, which cheers him up. Ross decides he might want another pair of leather pants and heads to kiss Ben goodnight.

Meanwhile, Monica and Chandler both decide to do their laundry, and Phoebe hilariously plans to hang around the airport in hopes of finding an unattended plane. Rachel and Joey are left alone, and they engage in a playful back-and-forth about a secret they both seem to know but won't reveal. Eventually, they both realize they know about Chandler and Monica's secret relationship and are excited to finally be able to discuss it. However, their conversation is interrupted by Phoebe, who returns due to rain and makes a sly comment about their behavior, implying she suspects something is going on between Chandler and Monica.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is standing at the window waving at Ross.

lines.dialogue: That's right Ross, I can see you in your new apartment! And you can see me! Same as yesterday, (To Monica) same as the day before.
Is he doing his shark attack bit yet?
Nope. Op, wait! There he goes.

(waving) Very funny Ross! Very life-like and funny. Okay. (Notices that a woman is waving back.) Oh no-no-no, I wasn't waving at you lady. (She just stares at him.) (Joey sees how beautiful she is.) Whoa, maybe I was! Hey, Monica, this totally hot girl in Ross's building is flirting with me.
Get in there man! Flirt back, mix it up!

Yeah, I-I-I'm down with that. (He turns back to the woman.) Okay, here goes. (Thinks.) How (Holds up his hand like an Indian) you (Points at her) a-doin'? (Does a little twisting motion with both hands and ends up pointing at her, he then winks. She smiles and waves again.) (To Monica) It worked! She's waving me over. (Towards the woman.) Okay, I-I-I'll be right over. Let's see, she's on the third floor…
(joining him) Wow! She is pretty, huh?
Tell me about it, huh? (Realizes that she can see Monica.) Oh no-no-no, I'm not with her, she's just Monica! (He pantomimes that out.) Ewwuck! (He pushes Monica away and makes a disgusted face.)

summary:
In this scene, Joey is at Monica and Rachel's apartment, standing by the window and waving at Ross, who is in his new apartment across the way. Joey remarks that Ross has been doing the same thing for days, including his "shark attack" bit. Monica asks if Ross is doing the bit, and Joey confirms that he is, but then notices a beautiful woman in Ross's building waving back at him.

Joey initially tries to clarify that he wasn't waving at her, but when he realizes how attractive she is, he decides to flirt with her instead. Monica encourages him to flirt back, and Joey awkwardly attempts to communicate with her through gestures, eventually getting her to wave him over.

Joey is excited about the prospect of meeting her, but then realizes that the woman might think Monica is his girlfriend. He quickly tries to clarify that Monica is just a friend, pushing her away and making a disgusted face to emphasize the point. The scene ends with Joey planning to go meet the woman, who is on the third floor of Ross's building.

background: Scene: In front of Macys, Phoebe is collecting donations and ringing her bell.

lines.dialogue: Happy Holidays. Feliz Navidad. Allo, and Merry Christmas. (A man put some change in her bucket.) Ohh thank you sir. Here's some joy. (She waves her hand up and down as if she is spreading joy.)
(Walking in from off screen.) Phoebe!
Hey!
I just wanted to see how it's going.
Well, it's going okay.
(Taking out her wallet.) Well good, here let me help you out.
Oh, thanks!
Yeah!
Wow!
Is that a new Swede jacket? It looks really expensive.
Yeah. I guess. (She puts more money in the bucket.)
Just get your nails done?
Yes Phoebe, but this is all I have. Okay? (She pours out the rest of her change purse into the bucket.)
Okay! Thanks! Happy Holidays, here's your joy. (She waves her arm and spreads her joy.)
Thank you! And Happy Holidays.
Wait, you can't take the money out.
I'm making change. I need change for the bus.
But, can't you leave the dollar? This money is for the poor.
I'm poor! I gotta take the bus!
Okay, Seasons Greetings and everything, but still…
Bite me, blondie! (The man storms off.)
Oh, I'm going to give him something else besides joy, just… (She scowls at him.)

summary:
In this scene, Phoebe is ringing a bell and collecting donations for charity in front of Macy's. She greets people with various holiday wishes and spreads "joy" by waving her hand. Monica arrives to check on Phoebe and decides to contribute by emptying her wallet and change purse into the donation bucket. Phoebe notices Monica's new expensive jacket and comments on her recent manicure.

A man approaches, claiming he needs change for the bus, and takes some money from the bucket. Phoebe objects, stating the money is for the poor, but the man insists he is poor and needs the money for transportation. He angrily storms off, leaving Phoebe frustrated and muttering about giving him something other than joy.

background: Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Monica and Chandler are making out on one of the chairs.

lines.dialogue: (entering) Hey! Hey! Hey! Hey!! None of that, not while you're living under my roof!
What?!
Look, just because I know about you two, doesn't mean I like looking at it.
Aren't you supposed to be at an audition for another hour?

Well, I'm sorry if I'm not a middle-aged black woman! (Starts for his room.) And I'm also sorry if sometimes I go to the wrong audition! Okay, look, if I have to pretend I don't know about you two, then you two are gonna have to pretend there's nothing to know about.
Okay.
Sorry.
Sorry.
(from the bedroom) I can hear that!
(To Chandler) Rachel's at work.
I can still hear you!

summary: In this scene, Monica and Chandler are caught making out by Joey, who enters the apartment and immediately expresses his discomfort with their public display of affection. Joey insists that they should not be so open about their relationship while living under his roof, even though he already knows about it. Chandler tries to distract Joey by pointing out that he should be at an audition, but Joey reveals that he went to the wrong one. Joey then demands that if he has to pretend he doesn't know about their relationship, they should pretend there's nothing to know. Monica and Chandler agree and apologize, but Joey still hears them from his room, leading to a humorous exchange about their need for discretion.

background: Scene: Ross's Building, Joey is trying to find the hot girl's apartment. So he's walking up the hallway counting doors. He comes to what he thinks is the right one and knocks on it. Ross opens the door, it's his apartment.

lines.dialogue: Hey Joey! Great stuff huh?
This is your place?
Of course it is. Yeah, come on in. Ooh-ooh, go by the window you can pretend to be surfing. (He pretends he's surfing by the window.)
But I counted, you're not supposed to live here! Oh man! (Runs away.)

summary: In this scene, Joey is trying to locate the apartment of a hot girl he's interested in, and he's counting the doors in the hallway to find the right one. When he knocks on what he believes is her door, Ross opens it, revealing that it's actually his own apartment. Joey is surprised and disappointed, realizing he made a mistake in his counting. Ross, amused, invites Joey in and playfully suggests he pretend to surf by the window. Joey, frustrated by the mix-up, quickly runs away.

background: Scene: Ross and Rachel's room, they've pretty much consumed the entire mini-bar. Needless to say, they're feeling no pain and are still playing blackjack.

lines.dialogue: Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (She slows down with each one.)
(runs out of cards) We need more cards.

Yeah, and also we need more umm, drinks. Hold on a second. (Gets up but stumbles a little bit.) Whup, okay. (She makes it to the phone and picks it up, without dialing.) Hello! Vegas? Yeah, we would like some more alcohol, and y'know what else? We would like some more beers. Hello? Ohh, I forgot to dial!
That must be our alcohol and beers! (Gets up to answer it.)
Hey!
Ohh, it's Joey! I love Joey! (Hugs him.)
Ohh, I love Joey! Joey lives with a duck! (Goes and hugs Joey.)
Hi!
Hey!
Look-look-look you guys, I need some help! Okay? Someone is going to have to convince my hand twin to cooperate!

I'll do it. Hey, whatever you need me to do, I'm your man. (He starts to sit down on the bed. There's one problem though, he's about two feet to the left of it. Needless to say, he misses and falls on his butt.) (Looking up at Joey.) Whoa-oh-whoa! Are you, are you okay?
Yeah! I'm fine! Thanks! (He starts to leave, but gets an idea and stops.) Hey Rach, how you doin'?
I'm doin' good, baby. How you doin'?
Ross, don't let her drink anymore! (Exits)
Ohh, here's that Macadamia nut!
Ohhh!!
(he puts it in his mouth) Nope! Something else. (Throws it back under the bed.)
Oops! All right, so what do you want to do now?
I wanna get out of the room! Y'know, I…I really miss downstairs.
Okay, y'know what? There's only one way I'm leaving this hotel room.

summary:
In this scene, Ross and Rachel are in their hotel room, heavily intoxicated after consuming the entire mini-bar. They are playing blackjack, with Rachel repeatedly asking Ross to "hit me" until they run out of cards. Rachel hilariously attempts to order more alcohol over the phone, forgetting to dial and rambling about wanting more drinks and beers.

Meanwhile, Joey enters the room, and both Ross and Rachel enthusiastically greet him, with Rachel mentioning Joey's quirky living situation with a duck. Joey reveals that he needs help convincing his "hand twin" to cooperate, and Ross offers to assist, though he hilariously misses the bed while trying to sit down.

Joey warns Ross not to let Rachel drink anymore before leaving. The scene ends with Ross and Rachel deciding they want to leave the room, but Rachel insists there's only one way she's leaving the hotel room, hinting at their inebriated state.

background: Scene: Ross's apartment, Rachel is trying to repair the thing she broke earlier, but gets interrupted by hearing Ross at the door. She panics and throws the thing into the kitchen. And runs to the couch as Ross enters.

lines.dialogue: Hey! Hi!
Rach, what uh, what are you doing here?
Hey! Y'know what? You are in our apartment all the time! Okay? This is, this is just a drop in the bucket mister!
Y'know, it-it doesn't matter. The important thing is that you're here. You're my friend, and you're here. Oh! (He goes over and hugs her.)
Okay, just a little scared. What's going on Ross?
The most amazing thing happened tonight. I thought my number was up. I had an actual near death experience!
What?! What? What happened?!
Okay, okay, we were on the ride along with Gary, right?
Yeah!
And somebody took a shot at me!
(gasps) Really?!

No, a car backfired, but (Rachel suddenly calms down) I thought somebody was taking a shot at me. And Rach, I…I survived! And I was filled with this-this great respect for life. Y'know? I-I want to experience every moment. I want to seize every opportunity. I-I am seeing everything so-so clearly now.
Because a car backfired?
(stares at her briefly) Okay, why are you here?
Well, I-I-I don't know how this fits into your whole "seizing" thing but um, Emily called you today.
You talked to her?
No, she left a message. (He starts for the machine.) (Stopping him.) But it-it kinda got erased. There's just (Pause) something wrong with your machine.
Well, okay, what-what did she say?
Well, uh something about having second thoughts about the wedding and did you guys make a mistake breaking up and uh, she wants you to call her.
Wow!
Now, that-that was a good thing that I told you, right?
Huh? Yeah! Yes, of course!

Okay. Thank you! Thank you! Because—I'm sorry, all right. Because y'know what? She didn't want me—not important. The point is, I was right. Your decision. Okay? I was right. (She starts for the door.) (Stops) Your decision.
Right. I guess, I guess I should call Emily.
Okay, no, that's not the right decision. That's not, that's not right, no Ross-Ross, come on! I mean, that woman made you miserable! Okay, Ross, do you really want to get back into that?
Okay, look, yesterday I would've even considered calling her back, but my ex-wife calls on the same day I have a near death experience. I mean, that-that has got to mean something!
Ugh, Ross! That was not a near death experience! That was barely an experience!
You weren't there! Okay, maybe this is something that I-I'm supposed to seize! Y'know?
Okay, y'know what? Maybe, this is not about seizing stuff. Maybe this is about escaping stuff.
Huh.
I mean, look-look today you escaped (Pause) (Not believing it) death, y'know? And maybe this is a chance for you to escape getting back together with Emily?
That does make sense. Because I do wanna seize some opportunity, but I-I really don't wanna see or talk to her.
Well, there you go!
Yeah. Maybe today is just, close call day.
(laughing) Close call day.
Hey, thanks Rach. (They hug.)
Ohh, honey no problem. Okay. (Gets up.)
Oh wait-wait-wait! The message is blinking. Maybe you didn't erase it.
Oh?
(on machine) "Hey Ross, it's you!" (Hits the stop button) Oh yeah, no that's-that's an old message, nobody needs to hear that.
No. (She heads for the door again.)
(looking at the coffee table where his money was) Hey umm, was-was Monica here?
Yeah.
Yeah, I want my money back.
(going out the door) Yeah, uh you-you probably need that for stamps, right?

summary:
In this scene, Rachel is at Ross's apartment, trying to hide the fact that she broke something earlier. When Ross arrives, she quickly hides the item and pretends to be calm. Ross shares with Rachel that he had a "near-death experience" due to a car backfiring, which led him to feel a renewed appreciation for life and a desire to seize every opportunity.

Rachel then reveals that Emily, Ross's ex-wife, called and left a message expressing second thoughts about their breakup and wanting to talk. Ross initially considers calling her back, but Rachel argues against it, pointing out that Emily made him miserable. Ross eventually agrees with Rachel, deciding not to call Emily, and they both joke about the situation.

The scene ends with Ross discovering that Monica was there and asking for his money back, to which Rachel playfully responds by suggesting he needs it for stamps.

background: Scene: Chandler's bedroom, Chandler and Monica are there, of course. Like who else would it be, duh!

lines.dialogue: You are so cute! How did you get to be so cute?
Well, my Grandfather was Swedish and my Grandmother was actually a tiny little bunny.
Okay, now you're even cuter!!
Y'know that is a popular opinion today I must say.
What?
The weirdest thing happened at the coffee house, I think, I think Phoebe was hitting on me.
What are you talking about?
I'm telling you I think Phoebe thinks I'm foxy.
That's not possible!
Ow!
I'm sorry it's just, Phoebe just always thought you were, you were charming in a, in a sexless kind of way.
Oh, y'know I-I can't hear that enough.
I'm sorry, I think that you just misunderstood her.
No, I didn't misunderstand, okay? She was all over me! She touched my bicep for crying out loud!
This bicep?
Well it's not flexed right now!

summary:
In this scene, Chandler and Monica are in Chandler's bedroom, where Monica compliments Chandler on how cute he is. Chandler humorously attributes his cuteness to his Swedish grandfather and a grandmother who was a tiny bunny. Monica responds by saying he's even cuter, and Chandler playfully acknowledges the popularity of this opinion.

The conversation then shifts to Chandler's belief that Phoebe was hitting on him at the coffee house. Monica dismisses this idea, stating that Phoebe always saw Chandler as charming but in a "sexless" way. Chandler insists that he didn't misunderstand the situation and that Phoebe was indeed flirting with him, even going so far as to touch his bicep. Monica humorously questions whether it was his bicep that was touched, and Chandler jokingly responds that it wasn't flexed at the time.

The scene ends with a mix of playful banter and Chandler's insistence on his perceived attractiveness.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe and Rachel are there talking about Chandler and Monica.

lines.dialogue: You mean whenever Monica and Chandler where like y'know doing laundry or going grocery shopping or—Oh! All that time Monica spent on the phone with sad Linda from camp!
Uh-huh, doing it. Doing it. Phone doing it.
Oh! Oh, I can't believe it! I mean I think it's great! For him. She might be able to do better.
(entering) Hey guys!
Joey! Come here! Come here!
What? What?
Phoebe just found out about Monica and Chandler.
You mean how they're friends and nothing more? (Glares at Rachel.)
No. Joey, she knows! We were at Ugly Naked Guy's apartment and we saw them doing it through the window. (Joey gasps) Actually, we saw them doing it up against the window.
Okay, so now they know that you know and they don't know that Rachel knows?
Yes, but y'know what? It doesn't matter who knows what. Now, enough of us know that we can just tell them that we know! Then all the lying and the secrets would finally be over!
Or, we could not tell them we know and have a little fun of our own.
Wh-what do you mean?
Well y'know every time that they say that like they're doing laundry we'll just give them a bunch of laundry to do.
Ohhh, I-I would enjoy that!
No-no-no! No-no wait Rach, you know what would even be more fun? Telling them.
Ehhh, no, I wanna do Phoebe's thing.
I can't take any…
No! You don't have to do anything! Just don't tell them that we know!
Noo! I can't take any more secrets! (To Rachel) I've got your secrets. I've got their secrets. I got secrets of my own y'know!
You don't have any secrets!
Oh yeah? Well, you don't know about Hugsy, my bedtime penguin pal. (Joey shies away.)
(To Phoebe) So umm, how-how are we gonna mess with them?
Ugh.
Well, you could use your position y'know as the roommate.
Okay.
And then. I would use y'know the strongest tool at my disposal. My sexuality.
(entering) Hello children!
Hey!
Okay, watch, learn, and don't eat my cookie.
Hey.
Hey! Ooh, wow that jacket looks great on you!
Really?
(feels his arm) Yeah the material feels so soft—hello Mr. Bicep! Have you been working out?
Well, I try to y'know, squeeze things. (Phoebe giggles uncontrollably.) Are you okay?
Well, if you really wanna know, I'm—Oh! I can't tell you this.
Phoebe, it's me. You can tell me anything.
Well actually you're the one person I can't tell this too. And the one person I want to the most.
What's going on?

I think it's just y'know that I haven't been with a guy in so long and how sometimes you're looking for something and you just don’t even see that it's right there in front of you sipping coffee—Oh no, have I said to much? Well it's just something to think about. I know I will.

summary:
In this scene, Phoebe and Rachel are discussing their discovery of Monica and Chandler's secret relationship. They joke about how Monica and Chandler have been using mundane activities like laundry and grocery shopping as cover-ups for their romantic moments. Joey enters and is initially confused, but quickly catches on to the situation. Rachel reveals that they saw Monica and Chandler "doing it" through the window of Ugly Naked Guy's apartment.

The group debates whether to confront Monica and Chandler about their knowledge or to keep it a secret and play along. Phoebe suggests having fun by giving them extra chores whenever they claim to be doing laundry, while Joey insists on telling them the truth to end the secrecy. Rachel sides with Phoebe, wanting to play along.

Joey, frustrated with all the secrets, blurts out a personal secret about his bedtime penguin pal, Hugsy. The conversation shifts back to how they might mess with Monica and Chandler, with Phoebe planning to use her "sexuality" as a tool.

Chandler enters, and Phoebe immediately starts flirting with him, hinting at her knowledge of his relationship with Monica. She plays coy, making Chandler feel both flattered and confused, leaving him wondering what she's hinting at. The scene ends with Phoebe's playful manipulation, leaving Chandler intrigued and the others amused.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is getting some coffee as Joey enters. He's looking a little puffy, but that's probably from the large number of different color sweaters he's wearing.

lines.dialogue: Hey!
Hi! Wow! You look, you look…big.
Thanks! I've been working out. Hey listen, is it obvious that I'm wearing six sweaters?
Uhhh, yeah. But it's not obvious why.

Well look, I’m breaking up with Katie so I had to put on some extra padding. Y'know? I mean, if she hits me when she's happy, can you imagine how hard she's gonna hit me when I tell her I'm taking away the Joey love?
(entering) Hi!
Hey! Hiya!
Hey! Hey, cute jacket!
Oh, thanks! That's so sweet! (She punches Rachel like she punched Joey.)
Oh! Ow! (Joey motions, "You see what I mean?!")
Oh, ow! Did Joey tell you to say that? You guys, (Punches Joey) are too much! (Punches Rachel.)
Whoa! (Laughs) Y'know what Katie? I gotta tell ya I-I-I-I think you are the one who is too much. (She punches Katie back.)
Ohh, Joey has the nicest friends! (She punches Rachel.)
Ohh, and the nicest girlfriend! (She retaliates.)
You're so sweet! (Punches Rachel yet again.)
Ohh, you're so sweet! (She kicks Katie in the shin.)
Oww!!!! Joey, she just kicked me.
Huh.
Well? Aren't you gonna do something?
Uhh….
You'd better do something, or I'm gonna walk out that door right now! Well? Are you gonna?
Nah.

summary:
In this scene, Joey enters Central Perk looking noticeably puffy, wearing multiple sweaters. Rachel notices and comments on his size, to which Joey reveals he's wearing the extra layers to protect himself from Katie, his aggressive girlfriend, whom he plans to break up with. He fears she might physically react when he tells her the news.

Katie then enters, and the playful punching escalates between her, Rachel, and eventually Joey. The scene ends with Joey deciding not to intervene in the playful but escalating fight between Rachel and Katie, showing his reluctance to confront Katie directly about their relationship.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Joey, and Monica are eating breakfast.

lines.dialogue: (entering) Hey!
Hey, Pheebs!
Mornin' Pheebs!
I have to tell you this story. Okay, I was coming over here and this driver…
(interrupting) Was his name Angus? (Monica and Chandler laugh.)
What?
Oh, he was this cab driver we had in London.
Oh. Ha-ha-ha. All right, anyway…
Wait, what that place, that pub he took us too?
Uh, The Wheatsheaf.
Yeah-yeah-yeah, and they had that beer! That uh…
Bodington's!
Bodington's! Woohoo! (And they all high-five each other.)
Ooh! Ahh, Pheebs, was gonna tell a story.
Yeah, so, he had a really funny hat—I don't want to talk about it.
(entering) Hey!
Hey!
Hey, Ross, Bodington's!
Yeah! (They high-five.)
That was good beer.
Ohh…
Y'know, I'd walk back to London for another frosty one of those bad boys.
Y'know, I think they have those at that British pub near the trade center.
Later! (Exits.)
Isn't Rachel supposed to be back by now?
Yeah, but her plane got delayed in Athens. But actually, (Checks watch) she should be here by now.
Oh, so-so you talked to her. Did she, did she sound mad?
No, but she likes me. You abandoned her on a plane to Greece.

Okay, I did not abandon Rachel! Okay? Emily showed up at the airport! I had to go after her! I mean, I-I did what I had to do! She's my wife! Rachel is my wife! Y'know—Emily! Emily, is my wife! Man, what is that?
So you still hadn't heard from Emily?
No, not since I lost her at the airport.
I can't believe she can out run you man!
HEY, SHE'S FAST!! OKAY?!! (Chandler is so shocked at Ross's outburst that he drops his spoon and backs up) Oh! You-you think you can be beat me? Let's go! Outside!!
(entering) Hi!
Hey! (They all go hug her, except for Ross.)
Rach, Rach, I am so sorry. I am so-so sorry.
Oh Ross, come on! You just did what you had to do.
That's it? You're not mad? I mean, it must've been terrible.
Terrible? Hell, I was in Greece! That was a nice hotel! Nice beach, met the nice people. Not to shabby for Rachel. (Goes and puts her luggage away.)
So, what? That's it?
Well, yeah! We're cool. Totally cool.
Oh, thanks. Oh, you're the best. (They hug.)
Oh no, you're the best.

(breaking the hug) Ohh, I gotta go to the flower store! (Runs to the door.) Check it out, no one will tell me where Emily is, so I'm gonna send 72 long-stem, red roses to Emily's parent's house, one for each day that I've known and loved her. That oughta get her talking to me again.
Oh, Ross, when you make out card; be sure to make it out to, EM-I-LY.
Rach, that's great! It's so good that you had a good time in Greece!

What?! I didn't have a good time in Greece! Ross abandoned me! Okay, I couldn't get a plane out, so I had to stay in their honeymoon suite with people coming up to me all the time going, "Oh, Mrs. Geller, why are you crying?" I mean, it was sooo humiliating. I felt like such an idiot! I mean, it's all my fault! And you know why, because I make very bad decisions.
Oh that's not true.
Yes it is! It is true! I went, I went after Ross in stupid London.
London is stupid! Stupid!
Phoebe, you were right. I should've never gone to London, and from now on you make all of my decisions for me.
Oh… No, I did that for someone once and I'm not comfortable having that kind of power and control over someone's life.
I'll do it!
That's fine. So Monica, you are now in control of my love life.
Okay, I gotta go to work.
And uh, Rachel, glad to have you back.
Pheebs! (He goes over and kisses Phoebe, who is also stunned.) Always a pleasure. (And he struts out leaving the girls to stare at each other.)

summary:
In this scene, the group is having breakfast at Monica and Rachel's apartment. Phoebe enters and starts to tell a story about a driver she encountered, but Joey interrupts with a joke about a cab driver named Angus from their trip to London. The group then reminisces about their time in London, particularly about a pub called The Wheatsheaf and a beer called Bodington's, which they all enthusiastically high-five over.

Ross enters and joins in the conversation, mentioning that Rachel should have returned from her trip by now. Monica explains that Rachel's flight was delayed, but she should be back. Ross expresses concern about Rachel being mad at him for leaving her on the plane to Greece to chase after Emily. Monica points out that Rachel might be upset, but Ross defends his actions, emphasizing that Emily is his wife.

Phoebe asks if Ross has heard from Emily, and Ross reveals that he hasn't since losing her at the airport. Chandler jokes about Emily being faster than Ross, leading to a playful outburst from Ross.

Rachel then enters, and the group greets her warmly. Ross apologizes to Rachel, but she brushes it off, saying she had a great time in Greece despite the circumstances. Ross is relieved and even plans to send Emily 72 long-stem red roses to win her back.

However, Rachel later reveals that her time in Greece was actually quite miserable, as she was stuck in the honeymoon suite, feeling humiliated and blaming herself for making bad decisions. She decides to let Monica take control of her love life, much to Monica's delight.

The scene ends with Chandler leaving for work, giving Phoebe a surprise kiss before departing, leaving the girls in shock.

background: Scene: The ride along, they're all waiting outside of the witness's house and still in the car in the same places as before.

lines.dialogue: Okay, y'know, we-we're safe right? I mean nothing bad can go down!
No. But that reminds me, (handing back a clipboard) sign this.
What is it?
Oh it's nothing, it just says that you can't sue the city if you scrap your knee or y'know, get your head blown off.
(deadpan) Oh, hurry up. I want to sign that.
Okay, here he comes. What is he doing? What the hell is he doing?!
What? What? What? What is it?
Is everything okay?
What's going on?
Okay, he sees us. Now don't move. Don't look at him.
Hey, it's okay. It was just a car backfire. (Joey slowly moves off of Ross.) Hey, look at that! You tried to save your buddy. You see that? You see what he did?
(To Ross) You okay man?
Uh-huh. Thank Joey!
Uh, HELLO!!
Hi.

summary: In this scene, the characters Chandler, Ross, Gary, and Joey are waiting outside a witness's house during a ride-along. Chandler expresses concern about their safety, but Gary reassures him by handing out a form to sign, which essentially releases the city from liability in case of injury or death. As they wait, Gary notices the witness approaching and instructs everyone to stay calm and not make eye contact. A loud noise causes Joey to instinctively protect Ross, leading to a brief moment of tension and humor. The scene ends with Chandler trying to regain everyone's attention after being momentarily ignored.

background: Scene: Another hospital room, Joey has now been admitted and his doctor is about to break the bad news to him, Monica, and Chandler.

lines.dialogue: Mr. Tribbiani, I'm afraid you've got kidney stones.
Umm, well, what else could it be?
It's kidney stones.
Or?
Kidney stones!

summary: In this scene, Joey is in a hospital room with his doctor, who is about to deliver some bad news. The doctor informs Joey that he has kidney stones. Joey, in disbelief, tries to suggest other possibilities, but the doctor firmly confirms that it is indeed kidney stones. The scene ends with Joey's uncertainty and the doctor's clear diagnosis.

background: Scene: The smoker's balcony, Rachel, Kim, and Nancy are all puffing away on their cancer sticks.

lines.dialogue: So, we're decided, no on plaid, yes on pink?
Absolutely!
I am so on board! (She throws away her recently lit cigarette.)
Rachel didn't you just light that?
Yeah, I did, but y'know what? I am really, really trying to cut back, y'know? (Laughs) Good luck, Rach.
I've actually been thinking about quitting lately.
Oh sure, every Sunday night I'm telling myself I'm quitting but every Monday morning it's like (Mimics chain smoking.)
Tell me about it!
Well then let's just quit! We'll just quit! Let's all quit!
It does sound appealing.
Oh, I never could do it.
Oh but you could. You can. Absolutely! We can help each other out! We can get--what are those--those patches! We could be like the Patch Sisters!
Oh y'know, we really should quit. Okay, let's quit!
Yes! Great! Give me those cigs! Give it! Give it! (She grabs their cigarettes and lighters and throws them in the trash.)
My late husband gave me that lighter. (Rachel laughs.) I'm not kidding.
Okay then! (She starts rummaging through the trash to find Kim's lighter.)

summary: In this scene, Rachel, Kim, and Nancy are on a smoker's balcony, discussing their preferences for a color scheme (pink over plaid). The conversation shifts to their shared habit of smoking, with Rachel expressing her intention to cut back. Nancy reveals she has been thinking about quitting, and Kim jokes about her failed attempts to quit every Monday. Rachel enthusiastically suggests they all quit together, proposing the idea of "The Patch Sisters" using nicotine patches. The group agrees to quit, and Rachel impulsively throws away their cigarettes and lighters, including Kim's sentimental lighter, which leads to a brief moment of humor as Rachel searches for it in the trash. The scene ends on a light, comedic note, highlighting their shared struggle with smoking and their determination to quit.

background: Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is returning and finds Chandler, Monica, and Rachel are there.

lines.dialogue: (entering) Hey!
Hey! How's it going? Did you make any new friends?
Yeah, yeah, I met this woman. (Starts for his room.)
(stopping him) Hey, whoa-whoa! What's she like?
Uhh, well, she's…really good in bed.
Joey, I thought you were gonna try to be friends first!
(To Rachel) Well look, hey, it's all your fault!
What?! Why?!

Well because you didn't give me advice! No! You gave me a pickup line! As soon as I told her I wanted to y'know, build a foundation and be friends first. I suddenly, through no fault of my own, became irresistible to her! (Pause) And her roommate!
What about the closeness?
Closeness-shmoshness! There was three of us for crying out loud!

summary: In this scene, Joey returns to his and Chandler's apartment and finds Chandler, Monica, and Rachel there. Joey mentions that he met a woman who is "really good in bed." Monica criticizes him for not trying to be friends first, as they had discussed earlier. Joey blames Rachel for giving him a pickup line, which made him irresistible to the woman and her roommate. Monica questions the importance of building closeness, but Joey dismisses it, emphasizing the chaotic situation involving three people. The scene ends with Joey's humorous and exaggerated account of his romantic misadventures.

background: Scene: Ugly Naked Guy's apartment, Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are checking out the place. Luckily, Ugly Naked Guy is nowhere to be seen.

lines.dialogue: Oh my God! I love this apartment! Isn't it perfect?! I can't believe I never realized how great it is!
Well that is because your eye immediately goes to the big naked man.
It's amazing! You better hurry up and fill out an application or I'm gonna beat you to it.
(laughing) Ohh. (Phoebe takes a couple of steps to the door and Ross quickly hurries out.)
Well, I never thought I'd say this, but I'm gonna go use Ugly Naked Guy's bathroom. (Does so.)
(looking out the window) Oh, look! There's Monica and Chandler! (Starts yelling.) Hey! Hey, you guys! Hey! (Chandler and Monica start taking each other's clothes off.) Ohh!! Ohh! Ahh-ahhh!!
What?!
(screaming) Ahhh!! Chandler and Monica!! Chandler and Monica!!
Oh my God!
CHANDLER AND MONICA!!!!
OH MY GOD!!!
OH!! MY EYES!!! MY EYES!!!!
Phoebe!! Phoebe!! It's okay!! It's okay!!
NO! THEY'RE DOING IT!!!
I KNOW!! I KNOW!! I KNOW!
YOU KNOW?!!!
Yes, I know! And Joey knows! But Ross doesn't know so you have to stop screaming!!
(entering) What's going on?
Ohhh!!!
(trying to divert his attention from the window by jumping up and down) HI!! Hi!
What?! What?!
Nothing! Oh God, we're just so excited that you want to get this apartment!
Actually, it looks really good. (Turns towards the window and now Phoebe starts jumping to divert his attention.)
(Screaming incoherently.) Get in here!!! (Motions to join her and Rachel.)

summary:
In this scene, Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are exploring Ugly Naked Guy's apartment, which Ross is considering renting. Ross is enthusiastic about the place, but Rachel points out that the sight of Ugly Naked Guy is usually the first thing people notice. Phoebe playfully threatens to apply for the apartment herself if Ross doesn't act fast.

As Rachel goes to use the bathroom, Phoebe looks out the window and is shocked to see Monica and Chandler engaging in a passionate moment. Phoebe starts screaming, causing Rachel to rush back and join in the shock. They both scream and panic, trying to process what they've just seen.

When Ross enters the room, Rachel and Phoebe desperately try to distract him from looking out the window, fearing he will see Monica and Chandler. They jump around and scream incoherently, creating a chaotic and comedic scene as they attempt to keep Ross in the dark about the situation.

background: Scene: Ross and Emily’s room, Chandler and Monica are still looking for a place to do the deed.

lines.dialogue: You really think this is okay?
Well, Ross and Emily aren’t gonna use it.
Oh, it’s so beautiful. Ohh! Y’know, I-I don’t know if I feel right about this.
Oh Mon-Mon-Mon-Mon-look, this is the honeymoon suite. The room expects sex. The room would be disappointed if it didn’t get sex. All of the other honeymoon suites would think it was a loser.
Okay!
Okay!
(entering) Emily?!
Nope, not under here!
You didn’t find her?
No, I’ve looked everywhere!
Well, you couldn’t have looked everywhere or else you would’ve found her!
Yeah, I think you should keep looking!
Yeah, for about 30 minutes.
Or 45.
Wow, in 45 minutes you can find her twice. (Monica smiles at that.)
No! For all I know, she’s trying to find me but couldn’t because I kept moving around. No, from now on, I’m staying in one place. (He sits down on the bed.) Right here.
Well, it’s getting late.
Yeah, we’re gonna go.
Actually, do you guys mind staying here for a while?
Ugh, y’know, umm we gotta get up early and catch that plane for New York.
Yeah, it’s a very large plane.
(disappointed) That’s cool.
But, we’ll stay here with you.
Thanks guys! (They both sit down on either side of him.) I really appreciate this, y’know, but you don’t have to rub my butt.

summary: In this scene, Chandler and Monica are in Ross and Emily's honeymoon suite, contemplating whether it's appropriate to stay there for some intimate time. Monica is initially hesitant, but Chandler convinces her by joking that the room "expects sex" and would be disappointed otherwise. Just as they agree, Ross enters, looking for Emily, who seems to have disappeared. Ross is worried and decides to stay in one place on the bed, hoping Emily will find him. Monica and Chandler, initially planning to leave, decide to stay with Ross for support, though Ross jokingly points out that they don't need to "rub his butt." The scene ends with the trio sitting together on the bed, highlighting Ross's concern and the supportive dynamic between the friends.

background: Scene: Ross and Rachel's hotel room, Rachel is still trying to get the ink off and Ross is on the phone to the company. Wait a minute, why exactly are they sharing a hotel room? Didn't they like break-up or something? Did I miss a memo? Or maybe, it's just foreshadowing things to come. Who knows? Maybe the answer's at the bottom of the page. Then again, maybe it isn't and it's just one of those things TV writers just don't explain. Anyhoo…

lines.dialogue: (on the phone) Yes, hello. I have a question. Umm, I used your pen to draw on my friend's face. (Listens) A beard and a moustache. (Listens and laughs) Thank you. (Rachel turns around and glares at him.) No, she didn't think so. (Listens) I know it's like (turns and sees Rachel staring at him and quickly changes the subject) anyway, umm well make-up didn't cover it and we've tried everything to get it off and nothing's worked. What-what do we do? (Listens) Yeah. (Listens) Uh-huh. (Listens) Yeah. (Listens) Oh! Okay. (Listens) Okay, thank you! (Rachel gets excited at his tone.) (Hangs up the phone) Yeah, it's not coming off.
What?! What else did he say?
Umm, he said he thought I was funny. So…(Rachel stares at him.) Okay, look-look umm, let's just go downstairs, we'll have some fun, and you will forget all about it.
Ross, no! There is no way I am leaving this room looking like this!
Oh, come on! Rach, it's-it's not that bad.
Ross, I am a human doodle!!

Look, just because some idiot drew on your face doesn't mean you shouldn't have any fun! Okay? And besides, hey-hey-hey no one is even gonna look at you. Okay? This is Vegas! Hello! There are tons of other freaks here! (Rachel turns around and glares at him.) There are tons…of…freaks here. No other. No. Come on! No one will notice, I swear!

summary: In this scene, Ross and Rachel are in a hotel room in Las Vegas. Rachel is trying to remove ink from her face that Ross drew on her, depicting a beard and moustache. Ross is on the phone with the pen company, trying to find a solution, but the representative confirms that the ink won't come off. Rachel is upset and refuses to leave the room looking like that. Ross tries to convince her to go out and have fun, arguing that no one will notice her in a place like Vegas, which is full of "freaks." Rachel remains unconvinced and continues to glare at Ross, clearly frustrated.

background: Scene: The delivery room, everyone except Rachel is there. Phoebe, Monica, and Ross are holding the babies.

lines.dialogue: I think you're my favorite.
Which one do you have?
I don't care.
(entering) Hi. (To Phoebe) Hey, hi! So uh, Frank and Alice wanted me to tell you that they're still outside making phone calls.
But umm, I mean, did you talk to them about, y'know…
Yeah, umm, no honey.
Oh. It was a long shot. Hey, you guys can I just like have a second alone with the babies.
Yeah, sure yeah. Yeah.

So, here you are. It seems like yesterday I was talking to you in that little petri dish. Everyone said labor was the hardest thing I'd ever have to do, but they were wrong this is. Oh, I had the most fun with you guys! I wish I could take you home and see you everyday. Okay, I'll settle for being your favorite Aunt. I know Alice's sister has a pool, but you lived in me. Okay, so we're cool. Yeah, we're gonna be great. Little high fives! (Imitates the high fives.) Ahh! Ahh! Ahh! (One of the babies begins to cry.) Well, if you're gonna cry. (She starts crying.)

summary:
In this scene, Monica, Phoebe, and Ross are in the delivery room, each holding one of the triplets. Monica playfully declares one of the babies as her favorite, but she doesn't specify which one she has. Rachel enters and informs Phoebe that Frank and Alice are still outside making phone calls, and she subtly confirms that they haven't discussed the adoption yet. Phoebe, feeling emotional, asks for a moment alone with the babies.

During her private moment, Phoebe talks to the triplets, reminiscing about their time together in the womb and expressing her deep affection for them. She wishes she could take them home and see them every day, but settles for being their favorite aunt. Phoebe becomes overwhelmed with emotion and starts crying when one of the babies cries, showing her deep connection and love for them.

background: Scene: Ross's building, Joey is knocking on a door again. It's again answered by Ross.

lines.dialogue: Damnit!! Did you move?!
Yes. I lived with you guys for a while and then I found this place. (Joey just stares at him) I'm Ross.
Yes?
(Looking around) Uhh do you happen to have a hot girl in there?
No. I'm all alone.
Yeah. Sorry about that. (He walks away and knocks on the next door which is answered by a little girl.) Oh, hey little girl. Uhh, is-is your mommy, or sister, or babysitter by any chance a hot girl?
Daddy!!
Later! (He runs away down the hall and hides behind a corner to a whole other corridor.) Oh man! (Walks down the hallway in desperation.) Hot girl! Hot girl!!

summary: In this scene, Joey is frantically searching for a "hot girl" in Ross's building. He first knocks on what he thinks is Ross's old apartment door, only to be greeted by Ross himself, who has moved out. Joey awkwardly asks if there's a hot girl inside, but the old man who answers says he's alone. Joey then moves on to the next door, where a little girl answers. He asks if her mom, sister, or babysitter is a hot girl, but she calls for her dad instead. Embarrassed, Joey runs away, hiding in the hallway and desperately muttering, "Hot girl! Hot girl!!" as he continues his search.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is entering. Rachel is there getting some tools to help Ross out.

lines.dialogue: Hey! Joey, would you mind giving me and Ross a hand moving his couch?
