Oh, I'd love too, but I got acting class. But y'know what? I guess I can blow that off, (In a sexy voice) for you.
Thanks!
Uh, hey, Rach let me ask you something. Uh, I was just over there talking to Monica and Chandler, boy they are really tight.
I know.
Yeah that's not such a bad situation they got going over there. I'm thinking of getting me one of those.
What's up Joe?
Well, the reason I think Monica and Chandler are so great…
Yeah?
…is because they were friends first. Y'know? So I asked myself, "Who are my friends?" You and Phoebe, and I saw you first. So…
(laughing) What are you saying?
I'm saying maybe you and I crank it up a notch.
Y'know honey, umm, as uh, as flattered as I am that uh, you saw me first, uhh, I just, I-I don't think we should be cranking anything up.
I'll treat you real nice. (Pulls out a chair for her.)

(laughs and pushes the chair back in) Yeah, well, y'know umm… No honey, listen I think it's a great idea to become friends with someone before you date them, but I think the way you do it is y'know you meet someone, become their friend, build a foundation, then you ask them out on a date. Don't hit on your existing friends!
Won't-won't that take longer?
Yeah. Yeah. Oh, but once you find it, ohh it's so worth the wait.
Yeah. I understand. I understand. (Pause) Man, I wish I saw Phoebe first!

summary: In this scene, Rachel is asking Joey for help moving Ross's couch. Joey initially claims he has an acting class but offers to skip it for Rachel. He then awkwardly tries to flirt with Rachel, suggesting they "crank it up a notch" in their relationship, implying he wants to date her. Rachel gently but firmly shuts down his advances, explaining that it's better to meet someone, become friends, and then date them, rather than hitting on existing friends. Joey reluctantly agrees but jokes that he wishes he had seen Phoebe first. The scene ends with Joey's playful humor and Rachel's clear boundary-setting.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are eating breakfast.

lines.dialogue: All right, I gotta go. I'm taking Ben to the park.
Ohh, give him a kiss for me!
All right, bye!
Bye!
Bye!
Later! (Exits.)
(after he's gone) I am so sorry you got caught in the middle of that. I didn't mean to be so out there. I am furious with him!
Wow umm, calm down.
I'm trying, but man that guy can push my buttons!
Why are so mad at him?
Look, I don't wanna talk about it. Okay?
Well, it just seems that…
You wanna be on my list too? Keep talking! Has anyone seem my list by the way?
Uh, no Pheebs. What's it look like?
Uh, it's a piece of paper and it says, "Ross" on it.
(entering, depressed) Hey. I just got off the phone with Estelle and guess what. (Pause, then very excitedly) I GOT THE LEAD IN A MOVIE!!!!!!
You got the lead in a movie? That's amazing! What's the movie about?!

It's called Shutter Speed, it's really cool! Yeah, umm, I meet this girl in the subway and we fall in love in like a day, right? And then, she disappears… But I find out where she lives and when I get there this like old lady answers the door and I say, "Where's Betsy?" Right? And she says, "Betsy's been dead for 10 years."
Ohh-oh, chilling!
And the best part is, we're filming in the desert outside Vegas! (To Chandler) And you know what that means buddy!
Yeah, I know that means buddy!
Road trip! Yeah, we can rent a car! I just have to be there by Tuesday!
Oh wait, my grandmother's dead.
Well, uh, we can talk about that too Pheebs.
No! No, her cab! She probably won't be using it; you can drive it to Las Vegas.
All right! Thanks Pheebs!
Whoa-whoa-whoa, what are we going to do about my job?
Oh umm, not go.
All right, great, road trip baby! (To Monica) This okay with you?
Chandler! You don't have to ask for my permission. (Quietly) You can go.
Thank you.
Hey Rach, come on! We're gonna be late for the eye doctor appointment!

(entering from her bedroom) All right! Let's get this over with! Ugh! (She walks by the table and notices that no one is looking and accidentally on purpose knocks over the open cereal box.) Ohhh! No! Look what I did! (She starts walking through the mess. {Also, notice the continuity error in this scene. Note the position of the box and dispersal pattern of the cereal before and after the camera cut.}) Oh, I mean, look at this mess! I mean, we're probably gonna have to clean this up! Y'know? We're gonna have to reschedule!

No. If you thought this mess is going to bother me, you are wrong! All right, let's go Blinky! (She ushers Rachel out the door, but before the door fully closes she sticks her head back in.) Chandler!!!! (Chandler agrees to clean up the mess.)

summary:
In this scene, the group is having breakfast at Monica and Rachel's apartment. Ross announces he's taking Ben to the park and leaves after saying goodbye to everyone. Phoebe expresses her anger towards Ross, though she doesn't explain why, and threatens to add Monica to her "list" if she keeps asking questions.

Joey enters excitedly, announcing he got the lead role in a movie called "Shutter Speed," which involves a love story with a mysterious twist. He reveals the film will be shot in the desert near Las Vegas, suggesting a road trip with Chandler. Phoebe offers her grandmother's cab for the trip, and despite Chandler's concern about his job, they decide to go.

Meanwhile, Rachel accidentally knocks over a cereal box, creating a mess. Monica, unfazed, insists they leave for their eye doctor appointment, leaving Chandler to clean up the mess.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is going through the mail as Joey enters.

lines.dialogue: (entering) Hey Rach! Hey, you mind if I read my comic books in here?
Sure! Why?
Oh well, Chandler and Monica are over there and it's kinda hard to concentrate.
What?! She just called and said that she was gonna be working late! She keeps lying to me! That's it! Y'know what? I'm just gonna go over there and confront them right now!

summary: In this scene, Joey enters Monica and Rachel's apartment and asks Rachel if he can read his comic books there because he's having trouble concentrating at Chandler and Monica's place. Rachel, surprised, realizes that Monica lied to her about working late, which upsets her. She decides to confront Monica and Chandler immediately.

background: Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey, Ross, Monica, and now Chandler are still playing catch. The guys are exhausted and sitting around the room. Monica is still standing all pumped up and being hyper-competitive yet again. {Okay! We get it! She's competitive!! Must we see all the time?!}

lines.dialogue: I'm starving!
Come on guys! Suck it up! We're closing in on ten hours! It's gut-check time!
I don't know who made you the boss? All right? We (Ross and him) invented this game!
Please! I made this game what it is.
Not fun anymore?
I'm still hungry!
All right, there's some pizza at my place, we can all eat with one hand right? Are you with me?
I am!
All right! Let's go! (Runs to the door.) Let's go Team Monica! (The guys all stop and stare at her) All right, we can work out the name later.

summary: In this scene, the group is still playing a competitive game at Chandler and Joey's apartment. The guys—Joey, Ross, and Chandler—are exhausted and hungry, while Monica is still full of energy and determined to keep playing. Ross complains about being hungry, but Monica insists they should push through, even suggesting they eat pizza with one hand to continue the game. Joey protests that he and Ross invented the game, not Monica, but she confidently claims credit for making the game what it is. Chandler sarcastically comments that the game isn't fun anymore, but Monica rallies the group to her side, declaring they should eat and keep playing as "Team Monica." The guys reluctantly go along with her enthusiasm, though they seem skeptical about the team name.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler enters to find Monica waiting patiently for him. He closes the door and they start kissing.

lines.dialogue: What took you so long?
I got caught up and work, but I'm quitting tomorrow.
Oh, good.
So, thanks for having me over! Rach. (Goes over, grabs her, and kisses her.) Pheebs. (After a moment while he decides how to kiss her around her belly, grabs her and kisses her.)
(Jumping out of his way) See ya!! (To the girls.) What the hell was that?!
Probably some y'know, European good-bye thing he picked up in London.
That's not European!
Well, it felt French.

summary:
In this scene, Chandler arrives at Monica and Rachel's apartment, and Monica is waiting for him. They start kissing as soon as he enters. Chandler mentions that he was delayed at work but plans to quit the next day, which Monica seems pleased about.

Chandler then proceeds to kiss Rachel and Phoebe, much to Joey's confusion. Joey reacts by jumping out of the way and asking what just happened. Monica suggests it might be a "European good-bye" thing Chandler picked up in London, but Rachel dismisses that idea. Phoebe, however, jokes that it felt French.

The scene ends with the group reacting to Chandler's unusual behavior and trying to make sense of his spontaneous kissing spree.

background: Scene: The delivery room, Ross has returned with another doctor. This one, is well, younger.

lines.dialogue: Okay, Phoebe, this Dr. Oberman. He has no strong feelings about Fonzie or any of the Happy Days gang.
Hi! And you're going into what grade?
Umm, I'm actually a first year resident, but I get that a lot, you see, I-I graduated early…
(interrupting) Uh-huh, me too. Ross, maybe I should've specified that I'd be needing a grown up doctor.
Oh no, I'm fully qualified to…
Shh! Doogie, shh! Doesn't anybody understand that I'm gonna be having babies soon? Huh? Go! Go little boy, go!
Oh cool! You made him cry!

summary: In this scene, Phoebe is in the delivery room, and Ross has brought in a young doctor, Dr. Oberman, to assist. Phoebe, skeptical of Dr. Oberman's age and experience, playfully mocks him, calling him "Doogie" (a reference to the young character from "Doogie Howser, M.D."). She expresses her concern that she needs a more experienced doctor for her impending childbirth. Frank, amused by the situation, comments on how Phoebe has made Dr. Oberman cry. The scene highlights Phoebe's humor and her tendency to be blunt, as well as the awkwardness of the young doctor in a high-pressure situation.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is drilling Joey on the chords as Monica looks on.

lines.dialogue: Tiger! (Joey moves his hand in an attempt to do the chord, in fact he does it with each name.) Dragon! Iceberg!! (He fails.) Joseph, did you even study at all last night?
Yes! Yes, I did.
Then do Iceberg!
(thinks) (quietly) G-sharp.
G-sharp? Have you been studying the real names of the chords? (Joey doesn't answer.) Have you? (He looks away in shame.) Oh my God!
What?! I didn't touch a guitar!
No, but you're questioning my method!
No, I'm not questioning it, I'm saying it's stupid! (Notices Monica standing between them and smiling.) What?! (The camera clicks, taking another picture.)
Thank you. (Leaves.)
Y'know none of my other student thought I was stupid.
Your other student, was you!
Yeah, well, y'know maybe you just need to try a little harder!

(looking in the Yellow Pages) Look, maybe I need to try a real teacher! Right here! Here! Andy Cooper, he teaches guitar and look ooh, there's a nice picture of him with a little kid and THE KID'S GOT A GUITAR!!!!!! (Storms out.)
Fine! You go learn from your qualified instructor! But don't come crying to me when everyone's sick and tired of hearing you play Bad, Bad Leroy Brown!!
(entering, singing) "Baddest man in the whole damn town."
Oh, fine! Take his side! (Storms out.)
(on phone) I can't wait to be with you! I'll sneak over as soon as Ross picks up Ben. I'll just tell Rachel I'm gonna be doing laundry for a couple of hours.
(on phone) Laundry. Huh. Is that my new nickname? (Rachel is absolutely stunned, she opens her mouth in absolute amazement.)
(on phone) Awww, y'know what your nickname is, Mr. Big…
Arghh!! (She quickly hangs up the phone and starts to pace around wondering what to do.)

summary: In this scene, Phoebe is trying to teach Joey guitar chords, but Joey is struggling and becomes frustrated. Phoebe uses whimsical names for the chords (like "Tiger" and "Dragon"), but Joey accuses her method of being "stupid" and decides to look for a "real" guitar teacher. This leads to an argument between them, with Phoebe storming out after warning Joey that his new teacher might not be as patient with his bad playing. Meanwhile, Monica is on the phone with Chandler, making plans to sneak away to be with him, while Rachel overhears and is shocked by their secretive behavior. The scene ends with tension between the friends and Rachel's growing suspicion about Monica and Chandler's relationship.

background: Scene: The Gift Shop, Monica and Chandler are entering.

lines.dialogue: Okay, come on, I can't get married until I get something old, something new, something borrowed, and something blue.
Okay, all right, all right, all right! Okay! (Picks up a blue sweater.) Okay, here's something, here's something blue and new.
You're so efficient. I love you!
Let's go! (Starts to leave.)
No-no-no! We need something old!
Ohh, great, I have condom in my wallet I've had since I was twelve.
That'll work!
I don't think so.
Okay, now we just need something borrowed!
(looks around) Here just…take this. (Hands her the sweater.)
That's stealing!
No, we'll-we'll bring it back! Just put it under your dress.
Ohh. (Rubs her fake stomach.)
Okay, one thing at a time. (They run out to get married.)

summary: In this scene, Monica and Chandler are in a gift shop, and Monica is trying to fulfill the traditional wedding day requirements of "something old, something new, something borrowed, and something blue." Chandler quickly finds a blue sweater that is both new and blue, and Monica is impressed by his efficiency. However, they still need something old and something borrowed. Chandler jokingly suggests a condom he's had since he was twelve, but Monica dismisses that idea. They then decide to "borrow" the blue sweater, with Chandler suggesting they return it later. Monica pretends to hide the sweater under her dress, and they rush off to get married.

background: Scene: The Wedding reception, Ross and Emily are in the bathroom and Emily is yelling at him. Rachel, Chandler, Joey, and Monica are standing outside the doorway.

lines.dialogue: (Yelling from inside the bathroom) You’ve spoiled everything! It’s like a nightmare! My friends and family are out there! How can I face them?! How can you do this to me?!
(To the gang) Hey, no matter what happens with Ross and Emily, we still get cake right?
(exiting the bathroom) That-that-that’s all right, no honey, you take your time sweetie. I’ll be right out here. (She slams the door in his face, to the gang) She’s just fixing her makeup.
I hate you!!
And, I love you!! (He walks into the living room)
Boy, bad time to say the wrong name, huh Ross?
That’s true, thanks dad. (To All) People should be dancing! Huh? Hey, this is a party! Come on! Joey, dance!! (He starts to dance but stops when no one else joins him.)
Yes, Waltham interiors.
(On the phone, in New York) Uh, hello, this is Ross Geller’s personal physician, Dr. Philange.
Who?
Yeah, I’ve discovered that Ross forgot to take his brain medicine, uh, now without it, uh, in the brain of Ross, uh women’s names are interchangeable, through-through no fault of his own.
Oh my God, Phoebe.
No, not Phoebe, Dr. Philange. Oh no! You have it too!
Hello?
Hey.
Hey.
Oh wow, I hope you don’t take this the wrong way but, I know we had plans to meet up tonight and, ugh, I’m just kinda worried about what it might do to our friendship.
I know. How could we have let this happen?
Seven times!
Ugh! Well, y’know, we were away…
In a foreign, romantic country…
I blame London.
Bad London! (Takes a spoon and smacks the turkey.)
So look umm, while we’re st-still in London, I mean, we can keep doing it right?
Well, I don’t see that we have a choice. But, when we’re back home, we don’t do it.
Only here.
Y’know, I saw a wine cellar downstairs…
I’ll meet you there in two minutes.
Okay!
Mon, honey, I gotta ask you something.
(impatiently) Now?
Ross said my name up there, I mean, come on, I just can’t pretend that didn’t happen can I?
Oh, I-I don’t know.
Monica, what should I do?
Just uh, do the right thing. (Uses some breath spray)
What?
Toe the line. Thread the needle. Think outside the box! (Tries to leave, but is stopped by Rachel.)
Whoa, wait, listen, I think I’m just gonna talk to Ross about what he think it meant.
Wait. Rachel, no, he’s married. Married! If you don’t realize that, I can’t help you.
Okay, you’re right. You’re right. You can’t help me.
Jack, is it all our fault? Were we bad parents?
(walking by) Yes.
Oh yeah, well who serves steak when there’s no place to sit, I mean how are you supposed to eat this?
Hey, what’s up? (He has solved the problem of eating the steak, he’s eating it with his hands.)
Where were you? We were supposed to meet in the wine cellar?
Forget it, that’s off.
Why?!
(drunkenly) The next tour of the wine cellar will plan in two in-in minutes…
Joey, what are you doing? You promised Phoebe you wouldn’t eat meat until she has the babies!
Well, I figured we’re in another country, so it doesn’t count.
That’s true.
The man’s got a point.
Oh, hi!
Hi!
Hi. Sorry, things aren’t working out so well.
Oh no! It could be better, but it’s gonna be okay, right?

Oh yeah! Of course, I mean, she’s gonna get over this, y’know? I mean, so you said my name! Y’know you just said it ‘cause you saw me there, if you’d have seen a circus freak, you would’ve said, "I take thee circus freak." Y’know, it didn’t mean anything, it’s just a mistake. It didn’t mean anything. Right?
No! No! Of course it didn’t mean anything! I mean, uh well, I can understand why Emily would think it meant something, y’know, because-because it was you…
Right…
But it absolutely didn’t. (Yelling towards the bathroom) It didn’t!! It didn’t!!
(approaching) Ross, hey, the band’s ready outside for your first dance with Emily, so…
(sarcastic) Oh! Oh-oh, the band’s ready! Well, I-I-we gotta do what the band says—I don’t care about the stupid band!!
You spit on me man! (Wipes his face.)
Look, I’m sorry.
Emily is kinda taking a long time, huh?
(laughs) Y’know when I locked myself in the bathroom at my wedding, it was because I was trying to pop the window out of the frame.
Oh, right!
Get the hell out of there, y’know?
(Bangs on the bathroom door) Emily? Emily? I’m coming in. (He opens the door to reveal that the window is gone, along with Emily.)
Well, look at that, same thing.

summary:
In this scene, the wedding reception of Ross and Emily is in chaos after Ross accidentally says Rachel's name during the wedding vows, leading to Emily locking herself in the bathroom and yelling at him. The rest of the group, including Chandler, Joey, Monica, and Rachel, are outside the bathroom, trying to navigate the awkward situation.

Emily is furious, feeling humiliated in front of her family and friends, while Ross tries to downplay the situation, claiming Emily is just fixing her makeup. Meanwhile, Joey is more concerned about whether they'll still get cake, and Phoebe hilariously calls Emily's mother pretending to be Ross's doctor, blaming his mistake on a lack of brain medicine.

Chandler and Monica have a brief, awkward moment where they discuss their own secret relationship, which they agree to keep only in London. Rachel, feeling conflicted, tries to talk to Monica about what Ross saying her name might mean, but Monica warns her to stay away from Ross, reminding her that he's married.

As the tension builds, Ross tries to rally the guests to dance, but no one joins him. Joey, meanwhile, is eating steak with his hands, and Monica scolds him for breaking his promise to Phoebe about not eating meat.

Rachel confronts Ross, trying to convince herself and him that his saying her name didn't mean anything, but Ross's hesitation suggests otherwise. When Joey informs Ross that the band is ready for their first dance, Ross snaps, showing his frustration.

Finally, Ross opens the bathroom door to find that Emily has escaped through the window, mirroring a similar incident from Rachel's past. The scene ends with Rachel commenting on the similarity, highlighting the chaos and confusion of the wedding reception.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Ross is trying to tell Rachel about Emily's ultimatum again.

lines.dialogue: Hey, so uh, y'know how there's something I wanted to talk to you about?
Oh yeah! (Turns to face him.)

Well, y'know how I'm trying to work things out with Emily. Well, there's this one thing… Okay, (Rachel has her back turned to the camera, and Ross isn't looking at her.) here goes. I made a promise that-(they cut to the other camera and Ross notices something coming out of Rachel's nose)-Oh hey!
What?
You're nose is bleeding!

Oh God. (He hands her some tissues.) No! Oh not again! (Wiping her nose.) This-this happened when my grandfather died. It's ugh! Sorry. (She puts her head back.) Oh, okay, so I'm sorry, what-what were you-what did you want to tell me?
Umm… (Rachel blows her nose.)
Sorry. Sorry.
Okay, I uh, I can't see you anymore.
Yeah, I know. It's ridiculous! I can't see you either.

summary: In this scene, Ross is trying to tell Rachel about Emily's ultimatum, which involves him cutting off contact with Rachel. However, their conversation is interrupted when Rachel suddenly starts bleeding from her nose. Ross points this out, and Rachel is embarrassed, recalling a similar incident that happened when her grandfather died. After Rachel manages to stop the bleeding, Ross attempts to continue his explanation, but the moment is awkward and Rachel misunderstands his statement, thinking he's referring to their inability to see each other due to their respective relationships. The scene ends with a mix of tension and misunderstanding.

background: Scene: The casino, Ross and Rachel are entering.

lines.dialogue: I think the check in is that way. (Points)
Ahh.
Hello! (She makes a face and the kid laughs harder. Finally, his parents drag him off.) Ohh, kids love me.
(sees Ross and Rachel) Hey!
Phoebe! (They hug.)
You guys are here! Yay!
Hi! (Hugs Phoebe)
(sees Rachel's face) What? Did you go to a costume party? Let me guess umm Pancho Vila? (Points at Rachel) and you're Bob Saget. (An old lady has sat down at the slot machine Phoebe was just at.)
Pancho Vila?
Yeah! (Motions to her face, indicating all of Rachel's "make-up.")
What are you talking about Pheebs? (Takes out her compact) I don't… (She gasps when she looks in the mirror and sees her face.) (To Ross) Oh my God, you drew on me?!
Hey, you wet my pants!
Whoa, what kind of party was this?
Ross, I have been walking around like this since the plane! I can—you have so crossed a line. (Heads for the bathroom)
Rach! Wait! The men's room is that way. (Points in the other direction. Rachel hits him with her purse and heads for the ladies room.)
Ugh!
What?
That's like the third time that lady's won on a machine I was playing.
Oooohhh, I'll bet she's one of those people.
M-M-Mole people?
What? No-no, a lurker.
Oh. What's a lurker?
Okay when you're playing a machine and it hasn't paid out, a lurker waits for you to give up and then…
Kills you?
No. They swoop in and steal your jackpot.
Ohhh!
Uh-hmm.
How do you know about this?
My nana used to do it. That's how she paid for all my dance—karate lessons.
Dance karate?
Yes, it's a deadly but beautiful sport. (Does a karate chop, then does a little dance-type sway.)
(returning with her purse covering her face) All right, it won't come off!
What?!
It won't come off!
Oh my God! Rach-Rach, are-are-are you sure?
No, actually I took it off then I drew it back on.
(entering) Hey-hey-hey you made it!
Joey!!
All right! Hey-hey!
Hi!!
Who's your friend? He's hot! (Ross laughs and Rachel smacks him with her purse.)
(To Joey) Thanks man.
Hi. (She hugs Joey.)
Hey listen I uh, talked to Chandler, sorry about the movie.
No, don't be sorry. I don't need it anymore. I found my identical hand twin!
Your what?
My identical hand twin! The person whose hands are exactly like mine! This thing is a gold mine!
What?! That's not gonna make you any money!
Okay. Well, if that's how you feel about it, fine! None of you get to live with me in my great big hand-shaped mansion! Except uh, you Pheebs. You can live in the thumb.

summary:
In this scene, Ross and Rachel arrive at the casino, where they run into Phoebe. Rachel is initially unaware that Ross drew on her face during their flight, which leads to an awkward and humorous exchange. Phoebe teases Rachel about her "make-up," and Rachel is shocked to see her face in the mirror. Ross defends himself by reminding Rachel that she wet his pants earlier. Meanwhile, Phoebe complains about a lady who keeps winning on the slot machines she was playing, and Ross explains the concept of "lurkers" in casinos.

Rachel tries to remove the drawing but fails, leading to more frustration. Joey then enters, excited about finding his "identical hand twin," which he believes will make him rich. The scene ends with Joey fantasizing about a hand-shaped mansion, offering Phoebe a place in the thumb.

background: Scene: Ross's new apartment, he is showing his boss, Dr. Ledbetter his new place and new outlook on life.

lines.dialogue: A new place for a new Ross. I'm gonna have you and all the guys from work over once it's y'know, furnished.
I must say it's nice to see you back on your feet.
Well I am that. And that whole rage thing is definitely behind me.
I wonder if its time for you to rejoin our team at the museum?

Oh Donald that-that would be great. I am totally ready to come back to work. I—What? (He notices something through the window.) No! Wh… What are you doing?!! (Dr. Ledbetter is slowly backing away.) GET OFF MY SISTER!!!!!!!!!!!!!

summary:
In this scene, Ross is proudly showing his boss, Dr. Ledbetter, his new apartment, which he sees as a symbol of his fresh start and improved outlook on life. Ross mentions that he plans to invite his colleagues, including Dr. Ledbetter, over once the place is furnished. Dr. Ledbetter expresses his relief at seeing Ross doing better after his previous struggles. Ross assures him that his anger issues are behind him and that he's ready to return to work at the museum.

However, the mood suddenly shifts when Ross notices something through the window, causing him to panic and scream, "GET OFF MY SISTER!!!!!" Dr. Ledbetter, sensing the sudden change in Ross's demeanor, begins to back away cautiously. The scene ends on this dramatic and tense note, leaving the cause of Ross's outburst and the fate of his sister unclear.

background: Scene: The slot machines, Phoebe is still feeding quarters into the one-armed bandit as the lurker peeks over the top of the machines.

lines.dialogue: Oh well, lost again. (She gets up and slowly moves away. The lurker scurries in and takes her spot, only this time Phoebe set a trap for her and catches her in the act.) That's it! You and me, outside!
I don't want to see you lose a chunk of that pretty blond hair!
Be cool! (They both pretend to have a nice conversation as the guard walks by, but after he leaves they both start fighting again.) Okay lady, your lurking days are over!
What?!

Yeah, from now on everyone you lurk, I'm gonna lurk first! You move on to someone else, I'm gonna be one step ahead of you, every single time! And then I'll be on your ass every hour of every day 'til Monday, because that's when I go home. When do you leave?
Also Monday.
What time? Maybe we can share a cab!

summary:
In this scene, Phoebe is playing a slot machine but loses her money. As she gets up, the lurker quickly takes her place at the machine. However, Phoebe had set a trap and catches the lurker in the act. They confront each other, but when a guard walks by, they pretend to have a friendly conversation. Once the guard is gone, they resume their argument.

Phoebe threatens the lurker, saying she will always be one step ahead of her from now on, following her every move until they both leave on Monday. The lurker reveals she is also leaving on Monday, and Phoebe sarcastically suggests they share a cab. The scene ends with a tense standoff between the two characters.

background: Scene: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, continued from earlier.

lines.dialogue: Uh-oh-okay. Uh-oh-okay. I know what you all are thinking. But Chandler is in Yemen! I'm a young woman! I have needs! I can't wait forever!
Yeah! No that's what I was thinking.
So I'm asking you please, take a moment before you judge me.
Oh, nobody's judging you. (They all turn and look at Ross.)
Oh! Okay! (To Ross) You, Mister Right Place at the Right Time, call me! (Does her famous, or is that infamous, laugh and exits.)
Okay, look, I-I know what you guys are going to say…
You two will have very hairy children.
Okay, I didn't know you would say that.
Ross! Janice?!
All right, hold on! Hold on. Hold on. This is Ross, okay? He's our friend. He obviously went crazy. He obviously lost his mind.
Look, I didn't lose my mind! Okay, Janice and I have a lot in common! We've-we've both been divorced. We-we both have kids.
So are you actually gonna see her again?
Phoebe! Don't put ideas in his head!
I am gonna see her again.
Damnit Phoebe!!

summary: In this scene, Janice, Chandler's ex-girlfriend, explains to Rachel, Phoebe, Joey, and Ross that she has needs and can't wait for Chandler, who is currently in Yemen. She asks them not to judge her and then directs Ross, who was present at the right time, to call her. The group reacts with surprise and disapproval when Ross admits he plans to see Janice again. Joey tries to stop Phoebe from encouraging Ross, but Ross confirms his intention to meet Janice again, leading to Joey's frustration.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, and Rachel are there.

lines.dialogue: So Chandler, have you heard about Monica's secret boyfriend?
Uhh, yeah. She uh, she uh, she uh might've mentioned him.
So Mon, when are we gonna meet this new secret waiter man?
Ohh, he's really shy. I-I don’t think he's up to meeting everyone yet.
Yeah, I don't think he's up to meeting everyone yet.
I don’t care! I wanna meet this guy who's the best sex she ever had!
Really?! That's what you heard? (To Monica) You said that?
I might've said that. (Chandler laughs.) Why is that funny?
Because I'm very happy for him! (To Monica) And you, you lucky dog!
(entering) Hi!
Hey!
Well, Emily's willing to work on the relationship.
Yes!
That's great!
In London!
What?!
She wants me to move to London.
But you live here! (Ross rolls his eyes.) You know that.
What-what-what are you gonna do?
I bet if I talk to Carol and Susan I can convince them to move to London with Ben.
Yeah, I'm sure your ex-wife will be more than happy to move to another country so you can patch things up with your new wife.
It could happen.

summary: In this scene, Rachel brings up Monica's secret boyfriend, who is a waiter and apparently the best sex Monica has ever had. Chandler pretends to know about him but seems amused by the situation. Monica is hesitant to introduce him to everyone, claiming he's shy. Meanwhile, Ross enters and announces that Emily is willing to work on their relationship, but only if he moves to London. Monica and Rachel are shocked, and Ross suggests he might convince Carol and Susan to move to London with Ben, which Monica sarcastically doubts.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.

lines.dialogue: You're right. Yours is worse. You are the king of bad Thanksgivings.
I don't know about that. I've got one that's worse.
Really? Worse than, "More turkey Mr. Chandler?"
Oh, did the little rich boy have a problem with the butler? Yes, mine's worse!

summary: In this scene, Ross, Phoebe, and Chandler are discussing their worst Thanksgiving experiences. Ross acknowledges that Phoebe's Thanksgiving story is worse than his. Phoebe then claims she has an even worse one, which surprises Chandler, who brings up a previous awkward Thanksgiving moment involving a butler. Phoebe confidently asserts that her story is indeed worse, sparking curiosity about what her worst Thanksgiving could be.

background: Scene: The casino bar, Phoebe and Monica are sitting at the bar, while Wayne Newton's signature song Danke Schoen is playing in the background.

lines.dialogue: (to the bartender) Thank you.
Thanks.
I can't believe this! This is like the worst night ever!
Y'know Monica you had a minor setback in your relationship with Chandler. Big deal! It's only Chandler. (Monica turns and stares at her.) I am so sorry.
This is crazy! I mean, it's such a stupid argument. I don't even wanna see Richard again.
So go fix it! Go find Chandler! He's probably up in your room! Tell him that you're sorry and that you love him.
Y'know what? You're right Phoebe. You're right. Thank you! (Gets up to find Chandler.)
Sure! (When Monica gets close to the door.) (Yelling) Yeah! Las Vegas, number one!

summary: In this scene, Monica and Phoebe are at a casino bar, with Wayne Newton's song "Danke Schoen" playing in the background. Monica is upset because of a recent argument with Chandler, feeling it's the worst night ever. Phoebe tries to cheer her up, pointing out that it's just a minor setback and that Monica should go fix things with Chandler. Monica initially dismisses the idea but eventually takes Phoebe's advice, deciding to find Chandler and make up with him. As Monica leaves, Phoebe enthusiastically cheers her on, exclaiming, "Las Vegas, number one!"

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is doing a crossword puzzle.

lines.dialogue: (entering) Hey!
Hi.
I just came over to drop off…nothing. So that weekend kinda sucked, huh?
Yeah, it did.
So, I guess this is over.
What?
Well, y'know, you and me, it had to end sometime.
Why, exactly?
Because of the weekend, we had a fight.
Chandler that's crazy! If you give up every time you'd have a fight with someone you'd never be with anyone longer than—Ohhh! (They both realize something there.)
So, this isn't over?
(laughs) You are so cute! No. No, it was a fight. You deal with it and move on! It's nothing to freak out about.
Really? Okay. Great!
Ohh, welcome to an adult relationship! (She goes to kiss him.)
(stops her) We're in a relationship?
I'm afraid so.
Okay.

summary: In this scene, Monica and Chandler are discussing the aftermath of a recent fight they had over the weekend. Chandler enters Monica's apartment, seemingly to drop off something but ends up bringing up the fight. He suggests that their relationship might be over because of it. Monica, surprised by his reaction, points out that fights are a normal part of any relationship and that giving up after every disagreement would mean never having a long-term relationship. They both realize that their relationship is not over, and Monica reassures Chandler that dealing with fights and moving on is part of being in an adult relationship. Chandler, initially unsure, accepts this and they both acknowledge that they are indeed in a relationship.

background: Scene: In front of Macys, Phoebe is still ringing her bell. A guy puts some change into the bucket.

lines.dialogue: Thank you, Happy Holidays.
Now, that's trash. Young lady, you can't… (The lady ignores her and walks off.) Hey! Stop that young lady, she donated trash!

Hey!! (The bucket starts smoking.) The charity's on fire! Help! (Yet another guy walks by carrying a cup, which Phoebe grabs.) Oh good! Thank you, I need that. (She throws onto the smoldering fire. Suddenly the bucket erupts in flames.) Whoa! What is that?! (She sniffs the cup.) (To the guy.) It's nine o'clock in the morning!

summary:
In this scene, Phoebe is standing in front of Macy's, ringing her bell for charity. A man donates some change, and Phoebe thanks him with a cheerful "Happy Holidays." However, a young woman then donates what appears to be trash, which Phoebe protests, calling out to her to stop. The woman ignores Phoebe and walks away.

Phoebe becomes increasingly frustrated, shouting after the woman that she donated trash. Suddenly, the charity bucket starts smoking, and Phoebe panics, yelling for help as the bucket catches fire. A man walking by with a cup is startled when Phoebe grabs his cup and throws its contents onto the smoldering fire. The bucket then erupts in flames, causing Phoebe to exclaim in surprise.

She sniffs the cup and confronts the man, incredulously asking, "It's nine o'clock in the morning!" implying that he was drinking alcohol at that early hour. The scene ends with the chaos of the burning bucket and Phoebe's exasperation.

background: Scene: The Telethon, Joey's phone rings and he answers it.

lines.dialogue: (in a bored voice) PBS telethon.
(on phone from Central Perk) Hey Joey, I just wanted to let you know that I found a selfless good deed. I just went down to the park and I let a bee sting me.
What?! What good is that gonna do anybody?
Well, it helps the bee look tough in front of his bee friends. The bee is happy and I am definitely not.
Now, y'know the bee probably died after he stung ya.
(Thinks for a moment.) Aw, dammit! (Slams the phone down.)
Back on in 30 seconds people!
Hey, excuse me, would you mind switching with me?
Hey, no way, I'm in the shot man.
Come on man! You've been here all day!
Yeah, I-I'm taking pledges here, eh?
We're on in 3, 2, (points to Gary Collins.)

Welcome back to our fall telethon. Now if you've been enjoying the performance of Cirque Du Soleil, (As he is speaking, Joey and the volunteer getting into a shoving match.) and you'd like to see more of the same kind of programming, it's very simple. All you have to do (Joey is knocked down.) is call in your pledge and at that time tell the operator, one of our volunteers, what kind of programming you'd like to… (Just as the volunteer sits down, Joey pulls him to the ground.)

summary:
In this scene, Joey is participating in a PBS telethon, where he is answering phones in a bored manner. Phoebe calls him from Central Perk, sharing an unusual act of kindness: she allowed a bee to sting her to make the bee look tough in front of its friends. Joey points out that the bee likely died after stinging her, which frustrates Phoebe, causing her to hang up.

Meanwhile, the stage director announces that they are going back on air in 30 seconds. Joey tries to switch places with a PBS volunteer who is taking pledges, but the volunteer refuses, as he is in the shot. As Gary Collins, the host, welcomes the audience back and encourages pledges, Joey and the volunteer get into a shoving match behind the scenes. The chaos escalates, with Joey being knocked down and eventually pulling the volunteer to the ground as well. The scene ends with the ongoing disruption behind the host.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is entering again.

lines.dialogue: Ugh!!
What happened?

I ended up at Ross's place. Oh, I musta missed counted or something. (Looks out the window.) Damn! She's not there anymore. Oh, l-l-look, Ross is doing his 'Watching TV' bit. (We see Ross sitting on the couch and flipping through the channels on his remote.)
No Joey, I think he's just watchin' TV.

summary: In this scene, Joey enters Monica and Rachel's apartment, visibly frustrated. He explains to Monica that he accidentally ended up at Ross's place instead of his own, possibly due to miscounting the floors. Joey looks out the window and notices Ross sitting on the couch, flipping through TV channels. Monica humorously corrects Joey, pointing out that Ross is simply watching TV, not performing a specific "watching TV" routine. The scene ends with Joey's confusion and Monica's light-hearted response.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Phoebe are in the kitchen.

lines.dialogue: I am so proud of Joey, I can't believe he's going to be on Law & Order!
I know. But don't you think that it should be called Order and Law?
No because first they arrest the guy and then they try him.
Don't get me started on that.
I was not flirting.
And on your anniversary, for shame!
What's going on?
Chandler was hitting on the hot delivery girl!
I was not and oh God, shh!
Well I'm sorry but you were! Okay? And besides if anyone should be hitting on her it's the guy who's single, the guy that who-who-who can do something about it.
Sounds like somebody wants to be Mr. Pizza Delivery Girl.
Well…
Is that what this is about? You like Caitlin?
Ross! We broke up two years ago; you've been married since then. I think it's okay that we see other people.
Well, I-I was watching her the other day at the pizza place.
Hm-mmm.
And she's just so sexy and funny and has the cutest little…
Okay, y'know what? We don't need her measurements.
(looking through the pizzas) Okay pepperoni, pepperoni, pepperoni, okay Ross, I know she's pretty and you love her, but is she stupid?! She forgot my vegetarian!
This is perfect! She'll have to come back here with your pizza, and when she does, I'll turn on the Charm-O-Ross. Oh I'm so glad you don't eat meat.
See? Vegetarianism benefits everyone.
(entering, with his grandmother) Hey everybody, look who's here! You remember my grandmother!
Big night!
This is so cool!
So, Joey on Law & Order, you must be very proud!
Chandler, she doesn't understand a word of English.
I'm sorry, I thought you were Joey's other grandmother. (She just stares at him.) I've done it again.
She's my biggest fan. Yeah, she's the only one in the family that's believed in me.
Yeah, I uh weighted like 27 pounds when I was born so…
(entering from the bathroom) Hey! Happy Anniversary!
Happy Anniversary, 10 months! (They kiss.)
So umm, when I was in the shower I was thinking about our first night in London…
Uhh, Joey's grandmother is right there. (Points)
Is that the one that speaks English or the one that doesn't?
The one that doesn't.
That was some hot love you gave me! I'm gonna go get ready.
Hey, why don't you wear those earrings I gave you?
That's a great idea! I was saving them for something special.
Okay.
(runs over to Phoebe) You have got to go home!
But I like it here!
You gotta go home and get the earrings that you borrowed from me okay? Chandler wants me to wear them tonight.
Okay, well I think that they're in my purse. Why don't you go get dressed and I'll look for them.
Great!
Okay! (Walks over to Rachel) Rach, hi, I need those earrings you borrowed.
Oh, umm, okay, yeah, I'll be, yeah I'll be right back. (Goes to her room.)
Wow Pheebs, you speak Italian?
I guess so. (See, the brief possession didn't affect her at all, like we could really tell.)
(She enters and hands Phoebe the earring) Here you go. Thank you!
Wait, Rach! Where's the other one?
Oh what, you-you want both of them?
Rachel Karen Green, where's the other earring?!
Okay, okay, okay, look, just don't freak out, but I kinda lost it. I know it's in the apartment, but I definitely lost it.
Well, what am I going to tell Monica? She wants to wear them tonight!
Tell her to wear her own earrings.
These are her earrings.
Nooo! Nooooo! You lent me Monica's earrings?! I'm not allowed to borrow her stuff!
Why not?
Because I lose her stuff!

summary:
In this scene, Rachel and Phoebe are in the kitchen, celebrating Joey's upcoming role on *Law & Order*. Rachel is proud of Joey, while Phoebe humorously suggests that the show should be called "Order and Law." The conversation shifts when Chandler denies flirting with a delivery girl, leading to Ross accusing him of hitting on her. Ross then reveals his own interest in the delivery girl, Caitlin, which surprises the group.

Meanwhile, Joey enters with his grandmother, who doesn't speak English, and Chandler awkwardly tries to engage her in conversation. Monica enters, celebrating her anniversary with Chandler, and mentions their first night in London. Chandler suggests she wear the earrings he gave her, but it turns out Phoebe borrowed them from Monica, and Rachel has lost one of them. This creates a panic as they try to find the missing earring before Monica needs to wear them.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Monica, Rachel, Chandler and Joey are there looking at pictures from the trip to London.

lines.dialogue: Oh, Rachel, sweetie, look, here's a really cute picture of Joey and you at the reception.
Ohh, he's married! Ross is married. I can't—I still can't believe it. (Rachel grabs the picture from Monica)
Honey, sweetie, by the edges.
I mean, y'know I'm just gonna have to accept it (She grabs the rest of the pictures)…
Ohh. (Monica covers her eyes in horror.)
…I mean it's my fault.
Sweetie! Edges! Fingers! Smudgey! Pictures!
Oh my God! (She licks the top picture and hands them back.)
Okay. That's okay. I-I know that you're very upset right now. I know, I know that wasn't about me.
(To Chandler) I bet it was about her a little.
If you would stop thinking about Ross for one minute you would notice that there are great guys everywhere! I mean, look! Look, Gunther! (Gunther turns to listen in.) I mean, he's nice, he's cute.
Yeah, I guess Gunther is kinda…
(Interrupting) Oh, what about that guy over there? (She points at another guy and Gunther is deflated.) Remember? That is the guy you flirted with at the counter that time.
Oh, I don't know. I don't know.
You're going to talk to him! Y'know what? We made a deal, I make your decisions and I say you're going to talk to him.
All right, you're the boss. I guess I gotta do what you tell me.
Say that to him and you're golden. (She just glares at him.)
(entering) Hey!
Hey!
Hey, Pheebs!
We got out pictures back from London. (Shows her one.) Here's all of us at the Tower of London.
(Grabs the pictures) Oh! Here we all are! Yeah, there's Ross and Joey and you and me. (She picks up a magic marker and draws herself in. Monica can't watch.)
All right, y'know what, we've been talking about London too much haven't we?
No. I'm sorry. It's just 'cause I couldn't be there. 'Cause all I ever get to do now is pregnant stuff, it just bums me out.
Sorry.
What happened?
Well, y'know, a little of this, a little of that. Got myself a date tomorrow night.
See, didn't I tell you?! You're getting over Ross already!
Well…
(To the guy) Get out!

summary: In this scene, the group is gathered at Central Perk, looking at photos from their trip to London. Rachel is still visibly upset about Ross's marriage, which is affecting her mood and behavior. Monica tries to cheer her up by pointing out potential romantic interests, including Gunther and another guy Rachel once flirted with. Monica insists that Rachel should talk to the guy, even making decisions for her, which Rachel reluctantly agrees to. Meanwhile, Phoebe enters and joins the conversation, expressing her disappointment at missing the London trip due to her pregnancy. The scene ends with Rachel revealing she has a date, much to Monica's delight, and Gunther dismissively telling another guy to leave.

background: Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is standing at the window waving at Ross.

lines.dialogue: That's right Ross, I can see you in your new apartment! And you can see me! Same as yesterday, (To Monica) same as the day before.
Is he doing his shark attack bit yet?
Nope. Op, wait! There he goes.

(waving) Very funny Ross! Very life-like and funny. Okay. (Notices that a woman is waving back.) Oh no-no-no, I wasn't waving at you lady. (She just stares at him.) (Joey sees how beautiful she is.) Whoa, maybe I was! Hey, Monica, this totally hot girl in Ross's building is flirting with me.
Get in there man! Flirt back, mix it up!

Yeah, I-I-I'm down with that. (He turns back to the woman.) Okay, here goes. (Thinks.) How (Holds up his hand like an Indian) you (Points at her) a-doin'? (Does a little twisting motion with both hands and ends up pointing at her, he then winks. She smiles and waves again.) (To Monica) It worked! She's waving me over. (Towards the woman.) Okay, I-I-I'll be right over. Let's see, she's on the third floor…
(joining him) Wow! She is pretty, huh?
Tell me about it, huh? (Realizes that she can see Monica.) Oh no-no-no, I'm not with her, she's just Monica! (He pantomimes that out.) Ewwuck! (He pushes Monica away and makes a disgusted face.)

summary:
In this scene, Joey is at Monica and Rachel's apartment, standing by the window and waving at Ross, who is in his new apartment across the way. Joey remarks that Ross has been doing the same thing for days, including his "shark attack" bit. Monica asks if Ross is doing the bit, and Joey confirms that he is, but then notices a beautiful woman in Ross's building waving back at him.

Joey initially tries to clarify that he wasn't waving at her, but when he realizes how attractive she is, he decides to flirt with her instead. Monica encourages him to flirt back, and Joey awkwardly attempts to communicate with her through gestures, eventually getting her to wave him over.

Joey is excited about the prospect of meeting her, but then realizes that the woman might think Monica is his girlfriend. He quickly tries to clarify that Monica is just a friend, pushing her away and making a disgusted face to emphasize the point. The scene ends with Joey planning to go meet the woman, who is on the third floor of Ross's building.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is there waiting for Larry.

lines.dialogue: (entering) Hey, ready for dinner?
Ooh, absolutely!
Great! How about you wanted to go the Italian place down on Bleaker Street right?
Ooh, I love that place! (Thinks about it.) So, no.
How about Mama Lisettie's?
Enh. Sure!
(notices something) I wonder how long that milk (on the counter) has been setting out.

Oh, no-no, this place is totally healthy! That—this milk is mine. I bought this today, 'cause I was thirsty for milk, y'know. (She takes a swig of it, but has to turn away from him as she makes a face to show that it has gone bad.) Okay, let's go!
Hey, buddy! (Flashes his badge.) Are you familiar with Section 11-B of the Health Code that requires all refuse material out the back exit?
But then I'd have to go all the way around the dry cleaner place.
Oh, so you're saying you'd choose convenience over health?!
Okay, stop! Larry, okay, can't you just be Larry and not Larry the health inspector guy? Y'know I mean it was really exciting at first but now it's like, okay, so where are we gonna eat ever?
Well, I suppose I could give him a warning.

Thank you. (To Gunther, who's standing there frozen) Okay, go! Go! Go! (He runs off.) (To Larry) Now, if after dinner you still really need to bust someone, I know a hot dog vendor who picks his nose.

summary: In this scene, Phoebe is waiting at Central Perk for Larry, who arrives and suggests going out to dinner. They discuss various restaurant options, but Phoebe playfully keeps changing her mind. Larry, who is a health inspector, notices some questionable practices at Central Perk, specifically the milk that Phoebe claims to have bought that day but secretly knows is spoiled. He then confronts Gunther about the health code violation regarding refuse disposal, which leads to an awkward exchange. Phoebe steps in, asking Larry to relax and not be "Larry the health inspector guy" all the time. Larry agrees to give Gunther a warning, and Phoebe jokingly suggests they target a less savory offender, like a hot dog vendor, after dinner. The scene ends with a mix of humor and tension as Larry's professional life clashes with his personal life.

background: Scene: Their building's lobby, Danny is checking his mailbox as Rachel enters carrying shopping bags and goes to her mailbox. Danny has shaved his beard and cut his hair, Rachel doesn't recognize him.

lines.dialogue: Hi!
So you like the short hair better.
What? Yeti—I mean Danny?
I had to cut my hair to get rid of the uh, fogger smell.
Oh. Listen, I'm so sorry. I would, I would've never fogged you if y'know if you hadn't looked so…. Y'know.
Absolutely. Some people are just into appearances.
(shocked) What?
That's cool. Cool. (Starts to leave.)
What? Hey! No-no-no! This not cool! You don't even know me!
Come on, you got the shopping bags and the Sack's catalog.
So from that you think you've got me all figured out? Well, you don't! Y'know I-I could have toys for underprivileged kids in here!
Do you?
Well, y'know, if-if kids like to play with Capri pants.
Okay. (Heads for his apartment.)
And stop saying that! I hate that!
Okay!

Fine! I judged you. I made a snap judgement. But you did it too! And you are worse because you are sticking to your stupid snap judgement! You can't even open up your mind for a second to see if you're wrong! What does that say about you?
The pizza-place across the street any good?
What?!
I'm hungry. Wanna get some pizza? You can keep yelling if there's more.
Okay. Okay.
Stop saying that. I hate that.

summary: In this scene, Danny and Rachel encounter each other in their building's lobby. Danny has recently shaved his beard and cut his hair, which Rachel initially fails to recognize. The conversation quickly turns into a heated exchange about snap judgments and appearances. Rachel apologizes for her earlier judgment of Danny, but Danny, feeling judged himself, accuses Rachel of being superficial based on her shopping bags and catalog. Rachel defends herself, arguing that Danny is equally guilty of making snap judgments and refusing to reconsider his views. The tension escalates until Danny abruptly changes the subject, suggesting they get pizza together. Rachel agrees, and the scene ends with a mix of tension and an unexpected shift towards reconciliation.

background: Scene: Another hospital room, Joey has now been admitted and his doctor is about to break the bad news to him, Monica, and Chandler.

lines.dialogue: Mr. Tribbiani, I'm afraid you've got kidney stones.
Umm, well, what else could it be?
It's kidney stones.
Or?
Kidney stones!

summary: In this scene, Joey is in a hospital room with his doctor, who is about to deliver some bad news. The doctor informs Joey that he has kidney stones. Joey, in disbelief, tries to suggest other possibilities, but the doctor firmly confirms that it is indeed kidney stones. The scene ends with Joey's uncertainty and the doctor's clear diagnosis.

background: Scene: Joey's bedroom, time lapse. He's asleep and dreaming. In his dream he's doing the crossword puzzle with…wait for it…Monica!

lines.dialogue: Y'know, I love doing crossword puzzles with you honey!
Aww, me too. Now let's finish this and go to bed.
Okay! There's only one left, three letter word, not dog but…
Cat.
Yes! You are so smart! (Kisses him.) I love you.
I love you too.

summary: In this scene, Joey is asleep in his bedroom and dreaming. In his dream, he is doing a crossword puzzle with "Dream Monica." They are enjoying their time together, with Dream Monica expressing her love for doing puzzles with Joey. The dream concludes with them solving the last clue together—a three-letter word for "cat"—and sharing a loving moment, with Dream Monica kissing Joey and both expressing their love for each other.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Monica, Rachel, Joey, and Chandler are listening to a story being told by Danny and his sister.

lines.dialogue: …so we finally get to the top of the mountain and airhead here (His sister) forgets the camera!
Oh, y'know the same thing happened to me one time.
When did that happen to you?!
Don't you remember when we were jogging in the park and we saw that really pretty bird and wanted to take a picture—I didn't have my camera!
Oh yeah. First off all, chasing the Churo guy isn't jogging.

Oh, this is so good (A piece of cake.) you have got to try it. (She takes some on her finger and feeds it to Danny. Then takes a little more and does it again. Meanwhile, the rest of the gang stares on in shock. Then they pick up a part of it and some filling falls into his lap.)
Oh, damn! I got it on my pants.

Here, I'll get it. (She grabs a napkin and tries to wipe it up. The thing that gets the rest of the gang going is that she's whipping awfully close to his crotch. In fact, she is whipping his crotch. Chandler's about to come out of his chair.)
We'd better take these pants off upstairs or that stain's gonna set.
Yep. (To Rachel) I'm gonna wear these on our date tonight.
Oh, great!
Okay, bye! (To the gang.) Oh my God!!
That was unbelievable!
Okay, see? I told you!
Yeah, wow, sorry Rach.
I don't believe they're brother and sister.
They're brother and sister!!!

summary: In this scene, Danny and his sister Krista are at Central Perk, sharing a story with Monica, Rachel, Joey, and Chandler. Danny complains about Krista forgetting the camera during a mountain trip, and Joey awkwardly tries to relate by mentioning a similar incident involving a bird. Meanwhile, Krista feeds Danny a piece of cake, which accidentally gets some filling on his pants. She then proceeds to wipe it off, getting uncomfortably close to his crotch, much to the shock of the group. Krista suggests they take his pants off upstairs to avoid a stain, and Danny casually mentions he'll wear them on his date with Rachel that night. The group is visibly shocked and disturbed by the interaction, with Chandler exclaiming, "Oh my God!!" and Joey confirming that Danny and Krista are indeed brother and sister. The scene ends with the group expressing disbelief at the awkward and inappropriate behavior between the siblings.

background: Scene: The Craps table, continued from earlier.

lines.dialogue: What did you just say?
You roll another hard eight and we get married here tonight.
Are you serious?!
Yes! I love you! I've never loved anybody as much as I love you.
I've never loved anybody as much as I love you.

Okay, so if an eight comes up, we take it as a sign and we do it! {Whoa! Where have I heard that before? Matthew Perry talking about signs in Las Vegas. I guess it must've been some movie I saw.} What do you say?
Okay!
Okay! Come on! Let's go! All right!
(spots one) Okay! That's a four! And where-where's the other one?
It went under the table.
Nobody move! (To Chandler) Okay, you look that way; I'll look this way!
All right!
Here it is! Here it is!
That could be a four or a five. It's your call.
It's a four.
I think so too.

summary: In this scene, Monica and Chandler are at a craps table in Las Vegas. Chandler proposes a playful bet: if Monica rolls a hard eight (two fours), they will get married that night. Monica agrees, and the tension rises as they wait for the dice to settle. When one die rolls a four and the other goes under the table, they frantically search for it. Chandler eventually finds the die, and they both agree it's a four, resulting in a hard eight. The scene ends with the implication that they will indeed get married that night, following the playful "sign" they set.

background: Scene: The smoker's balcony, Kim and Nancy are cheating and are caught by Rachel.

lines.dialogue: Hey! Hey-hey-hey!!
Uh-oh, busted!
Come on you guys! What are doing?! I thought we were the patch sisters!
Yeah. That didn't work out.
Rachel we tried to quit, but it was too hard!
Well y'know if you, if you started smoking again you could've at least told me! Come on, give me one of those! What are we talking about?
No. No! You're doing great! Don’t you give up! That's why we didn't tell you and we're not gonna drag you down with us.
Oh wait, no-no-no! Drag me down. Drag-drag me down.

Forget it Rachel! We're both so proud of how well you're doing. I'm not gonna let you blow it. In fact, if I catch you with a cigarette, you're fired. So go on, get out of here! Go on, I don't want you breathing this stuff! Go on!
Okay. (Starts to walk away.)
(to Nancy) So, okay! So you'll come with me on the Paris trip.
(hearing that) Oh man!

summary: In this scene, Kim and Nancy are caught smoking on the balcony by their friend Rachel, who is trying to quit smoking as part of their "patch sisters" pact. Rachel is upset that they didn't tell her they started smoking again, but Kim and Nancy insist they didn't want to drag Rachel down with them. Kim even threatens to fire Rachel if she catches her smoking. The scene ends with Kim casually mentioning a Paris trip, which catches Rachel's attention, hinting at some underlying tension or jealousy.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is sitting on couch and Rachel is getting some coffee. Phoebe keeps turning her head from to keep from looking at Rachel.

lines.dialogue: Phoebe? (She turns her head further away.) I'm sorry about the whole lifting out thing. (Moves over next to her.) You gotta come with me!
Come where?
Wherever I go. Come on you and me, we'll-we'll start a new group, we're the best ones.
Okay, but try and get Joey too.
(entering) Pheebs, you mind if I speak to Rachel alone for a sec?
Oh, sure! (She gets up to leave.) Bye Ross! (Whispering behind his back.) Forever.
Hi.
Hi. What are you doing here? Isn't this against the rules?
I talked to Monica, look, I'm the one who made the choice. I'm the one who's making things change, so I should be the one to y'know, step back.
Oh, Ross…

No, no, it's okay. Really. They're plenty of people who just see their sisters at Thanksgiving and just see their college roommates at reunions and just see Joey at Burger King. So is, is that better?
No, it's not better. I still don't get to see you.
Well, what-what would you do? Rach, if you were me, what-what would you do?
Well, for starters I would've said the right name at my wedding!
I can't believe this is happening.
I know.
I am so sorry.
I know that too.
(entering) (He clears his throat to get their attention.) Hey, Rach? Sorry to interrupt but umm, Phoebe wanted me to talk to you about a trip or something.

summary:
In this scene, Rachel apologizes to Phoebe for "lifting out" (likely referring to a previous conflict or misunderstanding). Rachel suggests they start a new group together, emphasizing that they are the best ones for it. Phoebe agrees but wants Joey to join as well. Ross enters and asks to speak to Rachel alone, prompting Phoebe to leave with a playful "bye forever."

Ross explains to Rachel that he talked to Monica and decided to step back from their friendship to respect the new boundaries set by Monica and Chandler's relationship. Rachel expresses her disappointment, saying she still doesn't get to see Ross. Ross asks what Rachel would do if she were in his position, to which Rachel humorously replies by bringing up Ross's infamous wedding mistake.

The scene ends with Joey entering and mentioning that Phoebe wanted him to talk to Rachel about a trip, hinting at future plans or adventures involving the group.

background: Scene: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica and Chandler are returning from dinner, Rachel is already there.

lines.dialogue: I can’t believe this. Do you think that your parents could help pay for it?
I don’t know, my mother spent most of her money on her fourth wedding. She’s saving the rest for her divorce. And any extra cash my father has he saves for his yearly trips to (Pause) Dollywood.
Well what happened at dinner?
My parents spent the money for our wedding!
(gasps) My God! What did you order?!
Wait, but there’s no money! Well this is terrible! You guys are gonna have to get married in like a, rec. center!
Honey, it’s gonna be okay.
No! No it’s not! It’s not gonna be okay! It sucks! No swing band! No lilies!

No, y’know what? It’s gonna be okay. I mean you don’t have to have this rustic Italian feast. Y’know? And-and you don’t need, you don’t need this custom-made, empire waisted, duchess, satin gown; you can wear off the rack. (She starts to cry, as does Monica.)
Look, it really is gonna be okay. The important thing is that we love each other and that we’re gonna get married.
Do you even understand what off the rack means?!
Look, why don’t you just pay for it yourself?
How? I don’t have any money.
Well, I have some.
How much?
Well, close to… (Notices Rachel leaning in to hear and decides to write it on a piece of paper and hand it to Monica as Phoebe averts her eyes.)
Whoa!!! Are you kidding me?!
Well what?! How-how much is it?!
It’s enough for wedding scenario eight.
Ohh! (Whispers.) Really?!
(To Chandler) How great are you, you little saver?! I mean, the-the amount you have is exactly the budget of my dream wedding!
(starting to cry) Ohh, you guys are so made for each other.
Well, you’re not suggesting that we spend all of the money on the wedding?
Ah, yeah!
Well, come on, I’ve been saving this money for six years and I kinda had some of it earmarked for the future, not just for a party.
(reading the slip of paper) Wow! (In a sultry voice) Hello, Mr. Chandler.
This is the most special day of our lives.
No, I realize that honey, but I’m not gonna spend all of the money on one party.

Honey, umm I-I love you, (laughs) but umm, if you call our wedding a party one more time, you may not get invited. Okay? (Laughs) Listen, we could always earn more money, okay? But uh, we’re only gonna get married once.
Look, I understand, but I have to put my foot down. Okay? The answer is no.
You-you’re gonna have to put your foot down?
Yes, I am!
Wow, money and a firm hand. Finally a Chandler I can get on board with.

summary:
In this scene, Monica and Chandler return from dinner to find Rachel and Phoebe at their apartment. Monica reveals that her parents have spent the money they had saved for her wedding, leaving them without funds for the big day. Rachel suggests they might have to settle for a less extravagant wedding, possibly at a rec center, which upsets Monica. Chandler, however, reveals that he has been secretly saving money for years, and the amount he has saved is enough to cover Monica's dream wedding scenario.

Monica is overjoyed, but Chandler is hesitant to spend all his savings on the wedding, as he had planned to use the money for their future. Monica argues that their wedding is a once-in-a-lifetime event and that they can always earn more money later. Chandler, however, stands firm, refusing to spend all his savings on the wedding. The scene ends with a mix of emotions, as Monica and Rachel are thrilled about the possibility of a dream wedding, while Chandler remains resolute in his decision to prioritize their future over a single event.

background: Scene: Phoebe’s birthday, she’s telling everyone what she found out at Ursula’s while sitting in Central Perk.

lines.dialogue: I lost a whole year! I can’t believe it! This is so unfair!
Oh, I don’t know Pheebs. It’ll be okay.
Will it? Will it?! I mean, how would you feel if you found out you were 31?
That’s not gonna happen. No. (Looks up) Because we have a new deal!
Plus, it totally ruined my schedule! I…I haven’t done any of the things I wanted to do by the time I was 31!
Like what?
Like okay I-I-I, I haven’t met any Portuguese people! I, I haven’t had the perfect kiss! And I haven’t been to sniper’s school!
Phoebe, y’know why don’t we just go upstairs and have some birthday cake?
No, I just feel like being by myself for a while. All right? I’ll see you guys later. Thanks. (Gets up and exits.)
Hey. (After she leaves.) Oh, poor Pheebs.
Hey, y’know what you guys? I think I’m gonna go walk her home. (Gets up and runs out.)
Oh man!
What?
He’s gonna eat the cake!

summary: In this scene, Phoebe is upset because she discovered that she lost a whole year of her life due to a mix-up with her twin sister Ursula's records. She expresses her frustration about not having accomplished certain personal goals by the age of 31, such as meeting Portuguese people, having the perfect kiss, and attending sniper school. Despite Joey's attempts to comfort her, Phoebe decides to be alone for a while and leaves Central Perk. After she leaves, Joey decides to walk her home, much to Monica's dismay, who worries that Joey will eat the birthday cake.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are entering. Phoebe and Joey are sitting on the couch.

lines.dialogue: Hey!
Hey-hey.
So are guys doing okay?
Yeah, we talked and Monica made me see that I over reacted a little bit and some things in life are more important.
Yeah baby! (Phoebe and Joey nod.)
I’m really glad you guys are okay but, I just keep thinking what would happen if-if you two (Points to Monica and Joey) actually had hooked up.

summary: In this scene, Monica and Chandler enter Central Perk, where Phoebe and Joey are already sitting on the couch. Joey greets them and asks if they're doing okay. Chandler explains that they had a talk and he realized he overreacted, acknowledging that some things in life are more important. Monica enthusiastically agrees, and Phoebe and Joey nod in approval. However, Phoebe then brings up a hypothetical scenario, wondering what would have happened if Monica and Joey had actually hooked up.

background: Scene: Monica and Chandler's, Rachel, Phoebe, Chandler, and Monica have gathered to hear Ross perform his interpretation of Celebration by Cool and the Gang on the bag pipe.

lines.dialogue: …now remember you have to imagine me in a kilt.
(giggles) (To Ross) I can imagine you in a short plaid skirt and knee socks.
(To Rachel) Do you wanna start telling secrets?
No!
(stands up) Now umm, remember I’m still learning.
One, two, three, four!
You know the song! Sing along!
So?
No!

summary: In this scene, Ross is about to perform his rendition of "Celebration" by Kool & the Gang on the bagpipes for Monica, Chandler, and Rachel. He humorously asks them to imagine him in a kilt, which prompts Rachel to tease him by suggesting he wears a short plaid skirt and knee socks. Ross playfully deflects her teasing and warns them that he's still learning. He then starts playing the bagpipes, encouraging everyone to sing along. However, Monica and Chandler immediately decline, showing their reluctance to participate.

background: Scene: The fire escape, Joey and Ross are still trying to figure out how to get down.

lines.dialogue: Man, I’m starving! What the hell was I thinking at dinner?! "Do you want soup or salad?" Both! Always order both!
(looking in the window behind them) Y’know, y’know I’m lookin’ and I don’t think anyone’s home here. I say we just break the window, crawl through, and-and y’know explain later.
Yeah? Really? No one’s home?

I don’t think so. Hello? (Knocks on the glass, which angers the big, large, angry dog behind the glass and causes them to jump to the other side of the landing.) When you get in there… (Joey nods his disapproval.)

summary: In this scene, Joey and Ross are stuck on a fire escape, trying to figure out how to get down. Joey complains about being hungry and regrets not ordering both soup and salad at dinner. Ross suggests breaking into a nearby apartment by breaking the window, claiming that no one seems to be home. However, when Ross knocks on the window to check, an angry dog appears behind the glass, startling both of them and causing them to jump back. Joey expresses disapproval of Ross's plan, and the scene ends with them still stuck on the fire escape.

background: Scene: The Hotel, Monica’s room, Mr. and Mrs. Bing are staring at each other while Phoebe looks on.

lines.dialogue: So-so you two were married huh? What happened? You just drift apart?
Here comes the bride.
Oh my God Monica!
I wanna wear this everyday.
You look so beautiful.
(starting to cry) I’m so happy for me.
Hello?

summary: In this scene, set in Monica's hotel room, the focus is on the tension between Mr. and Mrs. Bing as they stare at each other. Phoebe, curious and trying to lighten the mood, asks about their past marriage, wondering if they drifted apart. Mrs. Geller, possibly referring to Monica, says, "Here comes the bride," which catches Phoebe's attention. Monica, dressed as a bride, expresses her joy about wearing the dress every day, and Rachel compliments her beauty. Monica becomes emotional, expressing her happiness for herself. The scene ends with Rachel's casual greeting, "Hello?"

background: Scene: Monica and Chandler's, Monica and Chandler are working on the seating chart as Ross enters carrying his tux around.

lines.dialogue: Hey!
You just carry that around?
Yes. I find it to be something of a conversation piece.
Between you and…
Gunther. (To Chandler) Hey-hey! Why don’t we put them on? Y’know get a picture of Batman and James Bond together.
I would but mine doesn’t fit. The pants are a little tight.
A little tight? I could see double-oh and seven in those pants.
Well that stinks. I was looking forward to us wearing our celebrity tuxes together.
Well, does that mean that you’re not going to wearing yours?
What are you kidding? It’s Batman’s tux!!
(standing up) Let me try it on!
Okay, but just the jacket. Double-oh and seven are not gettin’ in there.
(trying on the jacket) Okay. Holy double-vented comfort Batman! (Finds something in the pocket) What’s this?
What?
An invitation for the At First Sight premiere? Oh my God! Val Kilmer didn’t wear this in Batman! He wore it to the premiere of some tooty-fruity love story where he played a blind guy!
Let me see that! (Grabs the invitation and reads it.) Oh man!
The only superpower you have is a slightly heightened sense of smell. (Hands him the jacket and walks away.)
(entering) Hey! Uh, Monica? Chandler? Can I talk to you guys for a second?
All right that’s it, I give up! Whatever you want you can have it! You wanna sing a song? You wanna do a dance? You want your mom stand at the Alter and scream racial slurs? I don’t care!
No! No, I-I just wanna thank you guys for what you did for my parents, that was really sweet. They’re so happy they get to be a part of your special day.
(defeated) Oh.
Well, you’re welcome. And tell them we’re really glad they’re coming.

Okay. I will. Ohh! Check out what they got me to wear for the ceremony! (Runs to his apartment and returns wearing a rather silly hat.) Huh? I wear it like this when I marry you guys, and then this (He tilts it to the side of his head) is for party time.

summary:
In this scene, Ross enters Monica and Chandler's apartment carrying his Batman-themed tuxedo, which he finds to be a great conversation starter. Chandler, who is wearing a James Bond-themed tuxedo, complains that his pants are too tight, leading to some playful banter between the two. Ross reveals that his tuxedo once belonged to Val Kilmer, who wore it to the premiere of "At First Sight," much to Chandler's amusement.

Meanwhile, Monica is frustrated with the seating arrangements for the wedding and is willing to give in to any demands from Joey, who enters the scene. However, Joey surprises everyone by expressing his gratitude for Monica and Chandler's kindness in including his parents in the wedding. He then shows off a silly hat that his parents gave him to wear during the ceremony, which he plans to wear differently for the party. The scene ends with a mix of humor and heartfelt moments as the characters prepare for the wedding.

background: Scene: Phoebe's apartment, Phoebe is getting out linens for Cassie who is in the bathroom.

lines.dialogue: Cassie, are you finding everything okay in there?
Yeah! Thank you so much for letting me stay here.

Oh! No problem! I… (Cassie emerges from the bathroom and we once again visit slow motion Barry White background music land with the sexy hair-flipping thing going on, only this time Phoebe is entranced. For more information on Denise Richards you can visit your local library or look her up on the Internet at her official website at www.deniserichards.com.)
(noticing her) What?
(in her head) Say something! Say anything! Ask her out! She’s not your cousin!

summary: In this scene, Phoebe is in her apartment, helping Cassie by getting linens ready while Cassie is in the bathroom. Phoebe checks if Cassie is doing okay, and Cassie expresses her gratitude for the hospitality. When Cassie emerges from the bathroom, Phoebe is momentarily captivated by Cassie's appearance, leading to a comedic moment of slow-motion and exaggerated reactions, reminiscent of a romantic scene. Phoebe internally panics, struggling with the urge to ask Cassie out, reminding herself that Cassie is not her cousin. The scene ends with Phoebe's internal conflict and Cassie's confusion about Phoebe's reaction.

background: Scene: Joey and Rachel's, Phoebe is giving Joey a massage as Rachel enters.

lines.dialogue: Hi!
Hey.
Hey—Ooh, how’s Hilda? Is she working out?
Ohh, my new assistant is working out, yes.
Was she happy you gave her the job?
Oh, my-my new assistant has very happy that I hired my new assistant.

(on phone) Hello? (Listens) Oh hey! Can you, can you hang on a second? (To Phoebe and Rachel) It’s the producers over at Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E. can you excuse me for a minute? (On phone) Hey, funny you should call. I was just looking over next week’s script. (Listens) Canceled?! (Listens) Like they’re taking it off the air? (Listens) Ohh. (Listens) All right, see you Monday. (Listens) We’re not even shootin’ them anymore?!! (Listens) All right, bye! (Hangs up) They canceled Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E!
Sorry.
I’m sorry Joey.
Why would they do that?! It was a good show right?!

summary: In this scene, Rachel enters Joey and Rachel's apartment where Phoebe is giving Joey a massage. Rachel mentions her new assistant, Hilda, is working out well. Joey asks if Hilda was happy about the job, and Rachel confirms she is. Joey then receives a phone call from the producers of his show, "Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E." He steps aside to take the call and learns that the show has been canceled. Joey is shocked and upset by the news, while Phoebe and Rachel express their sympathy. Joey questions why the show was canceled, believing it was a good show.

background: Scene: Monica and Chandler's, Monica is at the kitchen table and Chandler is in the living room.

lines.dialogue: Do you realize that four weeks from today we’re getting married? Four weeks baby!! Four weeks!!!
Do you realize you get louder each week?
There’s still so much to do. Have you written your vows yet?
I figured I’d buy those. Pat, I’d like to buy a vow. (Laughs)
Sweetie, you know I have no sense of humor when it comes to the wedding.
Right. So uh, have you written yours yet?
No! But I know exactly what I’m going to say.
Do you happen to know what I’m going to say?
(handing him a pad of paper and a pen) Let’s just do it right now. Okay? It won’t be hard. Just say what’s in your heart. (She goes back, sits down, and starts feverishly writing.)
(watching in her) (in his head) Look at her go! She must love me more than I love her! What’s wrong with me? Ooh, don’t open that door.

summary:
In this scene, Monica and Chandler are at their apartment, with Monica in the kitchen and Chandler in the living room. Monica excitedly points out that their wedding is only four weeks away, emphasizing the urgency of getting everything done. Chandler, in his usual playful manner, jokes about buying his vows, which Monica dismisses, reminding him that she takes the wedding very seriously.

When Chandler turns the question back to Monica about her vows, she confidently states that she hasn’t written them yet but knows exactly what she wants to say. Monica then encourages Chandler to write his vows immediately, handing him a pad of paper and a pen. As Monica starts writing feverishly, Chandler watches her and internally reflects on how much more Monica seems to care about the wedding than he does, questioning his own commitment and feeling a bit overwhelmed by the situation.
