The scene highlights the contrast between Monica's intense focus on the wedding preparations and Chandler's more laid-back, humorous approach, while also subtly revealing Chandler's insecurities about his feelings for Monica.

background: Scene: Monica and Chandler’s bedroom, they are both getting undressed.

lines.dialogue: I can’t believe her, y’know it’s just—it’s so typical.
Now Monica, I know you’re upset, but don’t forget. There is going to be a wedding, you are going to throw the bouquet, and then there’s going to be a honeymoon, maybe in Paris.
Paris?
We will take a moonlit walk on the Rue de la (mumbles something).
Keep talking.
Then we will sprinkle rose pedals on the bed and make love. Not just because it’s romantic, but because I can!
I love you!
(in a French accent) Bonjour, monsieur.
Okay, don’t say anything, you might scare it away.
It’s Paris, who knows we’re here!
(opening the door) Hi Pheebs, what’s up? (She enters.)
Okay, you said I could sing at your wedding so, I’m just gonna need a small deposit.
What?!
Y’know, just some good faith money to hold the date.
Pheebs, we’re not giving you a deposit for our wedding!
Oh, I see. (Exits angrily.)

summary:
In this scene, Monica and Chandler are in their bedroom, with Monica expressing frustration about someone (likely a friend or family member) and their typical behavior. Chandler tries to cheer her up by envisioning their future wedding, honeymoon in Paris, and romantic moments together. Monica is amused and charmed by Chandler's romantic fantasy.

However, their intimate moment is interrupted when Phoebe enters, asking for a "deposit" to sing at their wedding as if it were a professional gig. Monica and Chandler are surprised and confused by the request, and Phoebe leaves upset when they refuse. The scene ends with the couple dealing with the awkward interruption and Phoebe's unexpected demand.

background: Scene: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler, Joey, and Ross are watching a basketball game on the couch.

lines.dialogue: (entering) Hey guys! Do you wanna look at the song list for the wedding? (They ignore her.) Guys?
(without turning around) I thought you were gonna be gone all day.
All right? What’s going on?
I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I-I should probably leave you girls alone. (She heads for the bedroom.)
Yeah, laugh all you want but in ten minutes we’re gonna have younger looking skin!
Yeah! (Monica goes in the bedroom.) Y’know, she could use a little…(Whistles that she needs to do what they’re doing.) (Something happens on the game.) Oh nice shot!!! (They all cheer.)

summary: In this scene, Monica enters her apartment while Chandler, Joey, and Ross are engrossed in watching a basketball game. Monica tries to get their attention to discuss the wedding song list, but they ignore her. Chandler comments on her unexpected return, and Monica, feeling dismissed, sarcastically remarks that she should leave them "girls" alone, referring to their focus on the game. She heads to the bedroom. Meanwhile, Ross mentions that they are about to use a skincare product that will make their skin look younger, which Joey supports. The scene ends with the guys cheering enthusiastically at a good play in the basketball game.

background: Scene: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica is setting the table for dinner as Chandler enters.

lines.dialogue: Hey.
Hey! Good, you’re home!
Oh it’s always nicer to here than, "Aw crap! You again!"
Hey baby. (Kisses him.)
Hey.
I made you a surprise.
Oh yeah?
Yeah, tacos! Ever since you told me that story I’ve had such a craving for them.
Did you not understand the story?
(entering) Hey!
Hey! What’s up?
Ross!
Oh, nothin’ much. Just trying to figure out what I’m gonna do for dinner.
Huh.
(notices the table) Hey—Ooh! What’s-what’s that, dinner stuff? You making dinner?
No! (The oven dings.) Shhh!
What you got over there? Tacos?
No! No. They’re umm… They’re just uh…ground beef smileys. (Holding up one of the shells.)
Uhh, those are tacos.
Excuse me Mr. Mexico.
Eh, either way I’ll pass. (Quietly to Chandler) I still can’t eat those. (Monica is getting something out of the fridge and starts laughing.) What’s so funny?!
(trying not to laugh) I’m not laughing.
(To Chandler) You told her!
Nancy Thompson’s getting fired! (Monica slaps him on the shoulder.)
(To Monica) Look, okay-okay I had food poisoning! It’s not like I choose to do it! It’s not like—It’s not like I said, "Umm, what would make this ride more fun?!"
You’re right. I mean I’m sorry. Yeah, I shouldn’t be laughing. I should be laying down papers for you! (Runs off laughing which gets Chandler laughing.)
(To Chandler) How could you tell her?!
I had too okay?! We’re getting married! Married couples can’t keep secrets from one another!
Oh really? Well I-I guess Monica should know about Atlantic City.
Du-ude!
(running up to Ross) What happened in Atlantic City?!
Well, Chandler and I are in a bar…
Did you not hear me say, "Du-ude?!"

And this girl is making eyes at Chandler, okay? So after awhile he-he goes over to her and uh, after a minute or two, I see them kissing. Now, I know what you’re thinking, Chandler’s not the type of guy who just goes to bars and makes out with girls, and you’re right, Chandler’s not the type of guy who just goes to bars and makes out with…girls.
(To Chandler) You kissed a guy?!! Oh my God.
In my defense, it was dark and he was a very pretty guy.
Oh Mon, I laughed so hard…
Ho-ho, so hard we had to throw out your underwear again?
Whatever dude, you kissed a guy.

summary:
In this scene, Monica is preparing a surprise dinner of tacos for Chandler, inspired by a story he once told her. Chandler, however, seems hesitant, hinting that the story might not have been pleasant. Ross enters and notices the tacos, which he refuses to eat due to a past incident involving food poisoning. Monica and Chandler laugh about it, and Ross accuses Chandler of revealing his secret.

Chandler defends himself by saying that married couples shouldn't keep secrets, leading Ross to retaliate by threatening to reveal a secret about Chandler's past in Atlantic City. Monica, intrigued, demands to know, and Ross reveals that Chandler once kissed a guy in a bar. Chandler tries to downplay the incident, but Monica is shocked and amused. The scene ends with Chandler and Ross bantering, and Monica laughing at the revelation.

background: Scene: Monica and Chandler's, Ross and Monica are still going on about the house.

lines.dialogue: I can’t believe we have to say goodbye to the house we grew up in. Man, some-some stranger’s gonna be living in my room.
Well, after 15 years of mom and dad keeping it as a shrine to you, it’s time the velvet ropes came down.
They kept your room for a while.
Oh please! Dad turned my room into a gym 20 minutes after I moved out! I gotta say, a tanning bed and a stack of Victoria’s Secret catalogues, not a gym!
Come on, you know they love you.
As much as they love you?
I was their first born! They thought she was barren! It’s not my fault.
(entering) Hey.
Hey.
Hey!
Ugh, I hate this year!
What’s wrong with this year?
Well okay, it’s already February and I’ve only given two massages and they were both the worst tippers in the world!
That was me and Ross.
Oh that’s right!
Hey, y’know if you want to pick up some extra cash? Some friends of mine made good money doing telemarketing.
Oh that’s a great idea. You’re really good on the phone.
Yeah and yeah, and it would probably be better than the last telephone job I had. Y’know, I probably wouldn’t have to say spank as much. (Monica and Ross are shocked.)
What?
Oh yeah, like you never called!

summary: In this scene, Ross and Monica are reminiscing about their childhood home, which their parents are selling. Ross is upset about a stranger moving into his old room, while Monica playfully teases him about their parents' favoritism, pointing out that her room was turned into a gym shortly after she moved out. Phoebe enters and complains about her bad luck this year, revealing that she gave massages to Ross and Monica, who were terrible tippers. Ross suggests she try telemarketing for extra cash, and Phoebe mentions a previous job where she had to say "spank" a lot, which shocks Ross and Monica. The scene ends with a lighthearted moment of banter between the friends.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is there as Joey enters.

lines.dialogue: Pheebs!
Hey!
Listen, you know how uh, when you’re wearing pants and you lean forward I check out your underwear?
Yeah!
Well, when Jake did it I saw that…he was wearing women’s underwear!
I know. They were mine.
Oh. (Laughs.) No! No wait, that’s weird!
No, it’s not! We were just goofing around and I dared him to try them on.
That’s weird!
I’m wearing his briefs right now.
That’s…kinda hot.
I think so too. And that little flap? Great for holding my lipstick.
Yeah, I wouldn’t know about that.
And! Y’know what Jake says? That women’s underwear is actually more comfortable. And he loves the way the silk feels against his skin.
Yeah well next thing you know, he’ll be telling you that your high heels are good for his posture!
There is nothing wrong with Jake! Okay? He is all man! I’m thinking even more than you.
Oh yeah, he looked like a real lumberjack in those pink laceys.
I’m just saying that only a man completely secure with his masculinity could walk around in women’s underwear! I don’t think you could ever do that.
Hey! I am secure with my masculinity.
Okay whatever.
You’ve seen my huge stack of porn right? (Phoebe nods.)

summary: In this scene, Joey and Phoebe are at Central Perk. Joey is surprised to learn that Jake, Phoebe's boyfriend, was wearing women's underwear, which he discovered when Jake leaned forward. Phoebe explains that the underwear was hers and that they were just goofing around, daring each other to try on each other's clothes. Joey initially finds it weird, but Phoebe defends Jake, saying that only a man secure with his masculinity would do such a thing. Joey tries to assert his own masculinity by mentioning his collection of porn, but Phoebe dismisses his attempt. The scene ends with a playful banter about masculinity and comfort.

background: Scene: Chandler’s Hotel Room, Ross is getting Chandler ready.

lines.dialogue: There you go. You put on a tuxedo! Now that wasn’t so scary, was it?
No.
I’m telling you, just a little bit at a time.
Yeah okay. Well, what’s the next little bit?
Getting married. (Chandler panics.) Okay. Okay. You can, you can do that too! Just like you’ve done everything else!
Yeah. You’re right. Hey I-I can do that.
Yeah.
Okay, excuse me for a minute. (Starts to leave)
Wh—Hey—Whoa-whoa, where, where you going?!
Ross, I am not gonna run away again! I just want to get a little fresh air.
Okay.
Okay.
Oh fresh air!
(To Rachel) Wait! Maybe, maybe you’re overreacting! You do that y’know.

Well Phoebe, we gotta do something! (They turn the corner.) Well, y’know. I mean there’s no way Joey’s gonna make it in time. So I’m gonna through the hotel and see if there’s any other weddings going on.
Okay. Oh but don’t tell them Monica’s pregnant because, they frown on that.
Okay.
Okay.

summary: In this scene, Ross is helping Chandler get ready for his wedding, encouraging him to take things one step at a time. Chandler, who is feeling nervous, agrees but asks for a moment to get some fresh air. Meanwhile, Phoebe and Rachel are discussing the situation, with Rachel deciding to check other weddings at the hotel in case Joey, who is supposed to be the best man, doesn't make it in time. Phoebe warns Rachel not to mention Monica's pregnancy to other wedding parties, as it might not be well-received.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Monica and Joey are there. Joey is reading a newspaper.

lines.dialogue: Awww! Mel Torme died.
Joey, that paper’s like a year old!
Aw! Does that mean the Sam Goody’s sale is over?!
(entering) Hey.
Hey.
Hey.
So I finally heard back from Aunt Sheryl and apparently it wasn’t a mistake. Ahh, there’s-there’s limited seating in the hall.
Limited seating?! (Screechingly) I am just one tiny person!
Well yeah, but she doesn’t know that. I mean, the last time she saw you-you would’ve turned one of those little wedding chairs into kindling.
(disgusted) Limited seating! Oh, that is such a lame excuse! That’s not the reason she’s not inviting me!

Oh what’s the big deal?! I wasn’t even invited to the ceremony, just the reception. And-and y’know what? If it makes you feel any better, Joan and I will just make an appearance and then, and then we’ll-we’ll leave early as a sign of protest.
Joan?
Yeah, Joan Tedeski my date. She’s an assistant professor in the Linguistics department. Tall, very beautiful, and despite what some people say, not broad backed!
Wait a minute, you got Ross Gellar and guest?! I wasn’t invited and you got "and guest?!"
Uh-uh, excuse me, I do have to interrupt on Ross’s behalf. I-I think the rule applies here y’know, since she has a chance to get on broad back…
(interrupting) Not broad backed!
Wait a minute, y’know, you’re bringing me!
What? I can’t cancel on Joan!
Why not?!
Bec—Did you not hear me?! She’s an assistant professor in the Linguistics department, okay? They’re wild! Why do you want to come anyway?
Because! She’s my cousin. I mean, we grew up together! We’re family y’know? Well that’s important to me.
Okay, all right, I’ll take you. I’ll go call Joan. (Does so.)
Aww that’s nice. Family should be there, huh? This is her wedding, happiest day of her life.
(laughs) We’ll see.

summary: In this scene, Joey is reading an old newspaper and reacts to the news of Mel Torme's death, not realizing the paper is outdated. Monica and Joey are then joined by Ross, who informs them that he received a response from Aunt Sheryl regarding an invitation to a family event. The event has limited seating, which upsets Monica, as she wasn't invited. Ross reveals he was only invited to the reception and is bringing a date, Joan, which further frustrates Monica. After some back-and-forth, Ross agrees to take Monica instead of Joan, emphasizing the importance of family. Joey comments on the significance of family being present at such events, while Monica remains skeptical.

background: Scene: Carol and Susan’s, Rachel is talking with Ben.

lines.dialogue: So now what have we agreed?
No more pranks.
And-and what else?
That you and daddy were not on a break.
Very good.
Rachel! What are you doing here?
I’m just visiting my good friend Carol.
Your good friend?
Yeah!
What’s her last name?
Carol…Lesbian?
Nice. And by the way that uh, that line down my face?
What line?
Wh-wh-what line? The line that prompted a student in my last class of the day to say uh, (In a college frat boy voice) "Dude, don’t you ever was your face?"
All right, I’m sorry. I’m sorry I didn’t tell you but you were so mad already!
Of course I was mad! I told you I-I hate this stuff! Okay? It-it’s not funny!
(entering from the kitchen) Hey Ross!
Hi.
What’s not funny?
Practical jokes.
Oh I…I think they’re funny.
You have a line down your face.
What? (Goes and checks.)
Okay, maybe they are not funny to you…
(yelling from the bathroom) Oh my God!
Or Carol! But they’re funny to kids and who is it hurting?!
Uh, y’know what? I’ll tell you who it hurts! It hurts the kid who has all his clothes stolen in gym class so he has to go to the principal’s office wearing nothing but a catcher’s mitt!
That was you?! We heard about you in Junior High! Did you really just shake your fist in the air and shout, "I will be revenged?!"
I will be! Listen, I don’t want you teaching my son that stuff anymore. Okay?

Fine. Fine, but I’ll have you know that once I taught him that stuff he called me Fun Aunt Rachel. And I loved being Fun Aunt Rachel but I’ll go back to being Boring and Uncomfortable Aunt Rachel if that’s what you want!
No that’s not what I want. Uh, I’m glad you guys were bonding but I…
Look he doesn’t have any brothers or sisters, somebody’s gonna have to teach him this stuff! And I haven’t taught him anything that a normal 6-year-old doesn’t know anyway!
(yelling from off camera) Crap!!
I gotta go! (Runs out.)

summary:
In this scene, Rachel is at Carol and Susan’s house, where she is discussing with Ben (Ross and Carol’s son) the consequences of their previous pranks. They agree to stop playing pranks and to clarify that Ross and Rachel were never officially "on a break." Ross arrives unexpectedly and is surprised to see Rachel there, questioning her presence. Rachel jokingly refers to Carol as "Carol Lesbian," which Ross sarcastically approves of.

Ross then brings up a prank Rachel played on him, which left a visible line on his face, causing embarrassment at his workplace. Rachel apologizes, explaining that she didn’t tell him because he was already angry. Ross expresses his frustration with practical jokes, stating that they’re not funny and can be harmful.

Carol enters the scene, unaware of the situation, and defends practical jokes, finding them amusing. Ross points out the line on her face, which prompts her to check it in the bathroom. Rachel argues that pranks are harmless and are even necessary for teaching kids life lessons, especially since Ben doesn’t have any siblings.

Ross, however, insists that Rachel stop teaching Ben such pranks, fearing the impact on his son. Rachel reluctantly agrees but expresses her disappointment at losing her role as "Fun Aunt Rachel." Ross clarifies that he appreciates their bonding but wants to ensure Ben isn’t negatively influenced.

The scene ends with Ben yelling in frustration from off-camera, prompting Rachel to rush out to help him.

background: Scene: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica is trying out different cookie recipes. Ross and Phoebe are the tasting group.

lines.dialogue: Okay, here’s batch 22. Ohh, maybe these’ll taste a little like your grandmother’s. This has a little bit of orange peel, but no nutmeg.
Let’s give it a shot.
Okay. Man, I have not made this many cookies since I was in the ninth grade.
Oh, what was that for? Like a bake sale?
No, just a Friday night.
Ohh, these are pretty good.
Yeah, but not as good as batch 17.
Which one was that?
The ones we had right after you almost threw up.
Oh yeah! Batch 17 was good. I did not like batch 16. (Burps a little bit.) I’m okay.
Are there anymore from the good batch? ‘Cause we could just work off of those.

Yeah, ooh yeah, I think there is one from batch 17 left, uh… (Grabs a cookie and takes a big bite out of it and doesn’t like it.) It’s batch 16! 16 people! Get out of the way! (Gets up and runs for the bathroom.)

summary: In this scene, Monica is experimenting with different cookie recipes, trying to perfect one that tastes like Phoebe's grandmother's cookies. Ross and Phoebe are her taste testers. Monica presents batch 22, which includes orange peel but no nutmeg. Ross and Phoebe sample the cookies, with Ross finding them pretty good, but Phoebe prefers batch 17, which they had previously tasted. Monica reminds them that batch 17 was the one they liked right after Ross almost threw up from batch 16. Phoebe suggests sticking to batch 17, but when Ross grabs what he thinks is a batch 17 cookie, he realizes it's actually from batch 16, leading him to rush to the bathroom.

background: Scene: The Roof, continued from earlier.

lines.dialogue: Okay, we’ve been out here for two hours and we haven’t seen any stupid comets. Can we go now? I mean, Chandler’s getting chilly. (She walks over to where Chandler is bundled up in a big coat and shivering.)
(with a quivering voice) No, I’m not!
Then why are you wearing Monica’s jacket?
Because it’s flattering! (Shivers harder) Come on Monica! Come on Monica! (He goes inside.)
Yeah actually, I think we’re gonna take off too. We rented a movie.
Oh! I won’t say, ‘no’ to a movie!
Uh Pheebs, we just actually kinda wanted to be alone.
Shh! Get me out of here.
Oh. (They leave, leaving just Joey and Ross.)
(whispering) Ross!
What?
Come here, check this out!
What? Is it the comet? (Runs over to where Joey’s standing.)
No! No-no. Look, there’s a bug stuck in tar right here. (Bends down to get a closer look.)
Joey come—I can’t believe—I bring you here to see the Bapstein-King comet, one of nature’s most spectacular phenomenon, and all you care about are bugs stuck in tar and-and some woman!
(standing up) Y’know, there’s two women dude.
Show me where?
Right-right up here. (Starts looking at them through a piece of pipe.)
(noticing the pipe and looking at the door) Joey where’s the pipe that was holding the door open?
(annoyed) I don’t know! (Goes back to looking through the pipe.) (Pause) Yeah, I do.
Joey!
What?! All right—Hey! Don’t look at me! You’re the one who wanted to come up and look for some stupid Burger King comet!
It’s called the Bapstein-King comet, okay? (Joey starts to groan.) Hey! Hey! Bapstein was a very well respected astronomer!
(covering his ears and yelling) Oh no! No! No! (He starts banging on the door.)

summary: In this scene, the group is on the roof waiting to see a comet, but after two hours, they are growing impatient and cold. Chandler is particularly chilly and tries to hide it, wearing Monica's jacket. Rachel and Phoebe leave to watch a movie, leaving Joey and Ross on the roof. Joey is more interested in a bug stuck in tar than the comet, which frustrates Ross, who is passionate about astronomy. Joey then distracts Ross by pointing out two women, and Ross notices the pipe that was holding the door open is missing. Joey denies knowing where it is, and Ross gets annoyed, pointing out the comet's proper name, the Bapstein-King comet. The scene ends with Joey covering his ears and yelling, showing his disinterest in the comet.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe and Monica are there as Joey is entering excitedly.

lines.dialogue: Hey! You guys! You’re not gonna believe this! I just got off the phone with my agent…
Oh my God! (Joey looks at her.) I’m sorry, too soon. You go.
Okay. I got nominated for my part on Days of Our Lives!
Joey!
Good for you!
Congratulations! Wow! I can’t believe you’re nominated for an Emmy!
No-no.
Oh Soap Opera Digest award!
No! I’m up for a Soapie!
Honey? Is that something you’re making up?
No, no, no! It’s real! And it has been since 1998. (Rachel returns from the bathroom.) Hey Rach! Rach! I’m up for a Soapie!
(gasps) Oh my God! Oh my God!! That is like the third most prestigious soap opera award there is!
Thank you! Well, I guess now I know who I’m taking to the awards. (Points to Rachel.)
Oh, stop that! Don’t kid about that! (Gasps) Will all the stars be there?
Many are scheduled to appear.
Oh my God! Oh my God! I can’t go! I’m gonna be too nervous!
(to Joey) Okay, I’ll go!
No!! You are getting married! This is all I have.

summary: In this scene, Joey excitedly enters Central Perk to share the news that he has been nominated for a "Soapie," a soap opera award, for his role on *Days of Our Lives*. Phoebe and Monica congratulate him, with Monica initially mistaking the nomination for something more prestigious. Rachel, upon hearing the news, is thrilled and considers it a major opportunity, even jokingly suggesting she might accompany Joey to the awards. Monica offers to go instead, but Rachel insists it's her moment, as she is getting married and this is her only chance to attend such an event. The scene ends with Rachel expressing both excitement and nervousness about the possibility of going.

background: Scene: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica is making candy like mad as Ross enters.

lines.dialogue: Hey, there’s uh, some people outside, askin’ about candy.
Well, they’re just gonna have to wait aren’t they? I’ve only got two hands!!
Need some help?
No! You don’t know the system! There’ll be nobody messing with the system!
By the way, the week before your wedding you may not see a lot of me. (She glares at him and he quickly makes his way to Phoebe’s room.)

summary: In this scene, Monica is frantically making candy in her apartment, likely for an event or sale, as Ross enters and mentions that people are outside asking for candy. Monica, clearly stressed and focused on her task, insists that they'll have to wait because she only has two hands. When Ross offers to help, Monica refuses, emphasizing that he doesn’t understand her "system" and that no one should interfere with it. Ross then awkwardly mentions that he might not be around much the week before Monica's wedding, which seems to annoy her, prompting him to quickly retreat to Phoebe's room. The scene highlights Monica's obsessive dedication to her candy-making and Ross's attempt to navigate the tension.

background: Scene: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is filing her nails as Ross and Ben enter.

lines.dialogue: Hi.
Hi! Hi Ben!
Hi.
Hi, we have a little bathroom emergency.
Oh, yeah go ahead.
Uh, before we do uh, are any of Joey’s special romance magazines in there?
No. No.
(to Ben) Okay! All clear!
(running to the bathroom) Thanks Phoebe!
Ben, its Rachel! (He closes the door.) But whatever.
(to Ben) Everything okay in there?
Don’t talk to me now!
Awww, just like his daddy.
Hey listen can you do me a big favor? The dean’s office just called and said there was an urgent meeting. Can you watch Ben for like an hour?
What-what about Monica?
Oh, she isn’t home.
(nervous) So it would just be, me alone?
Well, Ben would be there.
Huh umm…
What’s the matter?
Well that—y’know it’s just uh, I’ve never done that before. Me and him alone.
Rach, he’s not an ex-con.
Okay. Okay. Okay. Uh, what do I, what do I do with him?
I don’t know! Just-just talk to him-entertain him and keep him alive.
Okay.
Okay. (Ben enters) Ben? Come here. All right, I’m gonna leave you here with Aunt Rachel for about an hour. Okay? Are you gonna be okay?
Yeah I think so.
(To Rachel) I wasn’t talking to you.
I’ll be okay.
Okay, I’ll see you soon buddy. (He hugs and kisses him.) Be back in an hour.
Bye dad.
Bye. (Ross exits.) Ahhh… (Silence) So this is fun, huh?
Not really.
Okay. Uh, want something-want something to drink?
Okay.
Uh great! How do you feel about Diet Coke?
I’m not allowed to have soda.
Okay. Well that’s pretty much all that we have—Oh! Oh! Have you ever had a virgin margarita? (Holds up a bottle of margarita mix.)
What’s a virgin?
Water it is.

summary:
In this scene, Ross and his son Ben come to Joey and Rachel's apartment because they have a "bathroom emergency." Ross is concerned about Joey's inappropriate magazines being in the bathroom, but Rachel assures him they aren't. Ben mistakenly calls Rachel "Phoebe," which she corrects, but she brushes it off.

Ross then asks Rachel to watch Ben for an hour while he attends an urgent meeting. Rachel is nervous about being alone with Ben, as she's never done that before, but Ross reassures her that Ben is just a regular kid. Rachel is unsure about how to entertain Ben but agrees to try.

Ross leaves, and Rachel awkwardly tries to make conversation with Ben, offering him drinks. Ben is not very enthusiastic, and Rachel struggles to find something he can have since he's not allowed soda. She ends up offering him water, which Ben accepts. The scene ends with Rachel trying to make the best of the situation while Ben remains indifferent.

background: Scene: Rachel’s outer office, she’s returning with two coffee cups in hand to find Tag sitting there.

lines.dialogue: Hi! I got you some coffee. To, uh… (She looks for a place to set it on his messy desk and he clears a spot for her to set it down.) …fair enough. So! Do you got anything for me?
Still no luck.
Oh my God! Did you check your entire desk! Did you check all the drawers!
Do you want me to check again?

Well yeah, I wish that you would. (He opens the top drawer.) Well, no it’s not in there! (Closes it.) How about that drawer? (She points to the bottom one and he opens it. She doesn’t see the folder she planted and bends over to check.)
Well, it’s not out here. Is there any chance it could be in your office?
(thinks) Y’know, I don’t-I don’t know. Let me, let me check. (As she heads for her office, she stops glances over her should at Tag, looks into her office, and finds the folder on her desk.)
(smirking) Any luck?
Can I see you in my office for a minute?

(entering) Yeah? (She holds up the folder) You found them!! (Rachel is not amused, because she’s still going to try to blame him for her mistake like every ‘good’ boss.) Y’know what? I’m not even going to gloat. I’m just really relived this whole thing is over.
You put these on my desk!
I did not!
Oh really? So you’re saying they just slid out of your bottom drawer, crawled across the floor, then jumped on to my desk?! (I think Dogbert should have a line here.)
How did you know they were in my bottom drawer?
(pause as she realizes her lame attempt to shift the blame has failed) I am so hot for you right now.

summary:
In this scene, Rachel returns to her outer office with coffee for herself and Tag. She asks Tag if he has found the missing documents, but he informs her that he hasn’t. Rachel becomes frustrated and insists that he check his desk drawers again. As Tag checks the drawers, Rachel subtly points out the bottom drawer, where she had planted the folder earlier. When Tag suggests that the folder might be in her office, Rachel goes to check and finds it on her desk.

Tag, realizing that Rachel had planted the folder, confronts her, and Rachel tries to shift the blame onto him. However, her attempt to deflect blame backfires when Tag questions how she knew the folder was in his bottom drawer. Realizing her mistake, Rachel awkwardly shifts the conversation by playfully admitting that she is attracted to Tag. The scene ends with a mix of tension and humor as Rachel’s attempt to manipulate the situation fails.

background: Scene: The restaurant, continued from earlier.

lines.dialogue: How can you not remember us kissing?!
I don’t know. I don’t remember a lot of things that never happened.
Wh… Come on! Remember? We were on the sleeping porch! We couldn’t stop giggling? And our coconuts kept knockin’ together?
Oh, somewhere Joey’s head is exploding.
Yeah—but come on—Listen, I’m sorry I don’t want to make you uncomfortable, but I told Phoebe that it happened and she doesn’t believe me.
I’m sorry Ray-ray. I mean if I thought it happened I would say it. Maybe I passed out and you did stuff to me while I was sleeping.
No!!
Rachel, it’s okay. You don’t have to do this. I believe you. All right? Okay, if-if you say that you kissed Melissa, then you kissed Melissa.
Thank you Phoebe.
She didn’t.
I know.

summary: In this scene, Rachel is trying to convince Melissa that they once kissed, but Melissa insists she doesn’t remember anything like that happening. Rachel is frustrated and embarrassed, especially since she had already told Phoebe about the supposed kiss, and Phoebe doesn’t believe her. Phoebe tries to comfort Rachel by pretending to believe her, but Melissa bluntly states that the kiss never happened. The scene ends with an awkward tension between the three characters.

background: Scene: Joey and Rachel's, Joey is entering, Rachel and Phoebe are already there.

lines.dialogue: Hey! What’s going on?
Phoebe is gonna be Monica’s maid of honor!
Hey! Well I hope it goes better than the last time you did it for that girl downstairs, remember? (Phoebe glares at him.)
(shocked) You have been maid of honor before?!!
See? This is exactly why you shouldn’t lie!
All right that’s it! I am maid of honor!
Na-uh, I am!
How come you are?!
Because I cared enough to lie!
Hey-hey-hey-hey, I can help you decide who should do it! Yeah, we could have like uh, like an audition and see how you’d handle maid of honor type situations.
What are you talking about?
Like when I want a job, I go to an audition and if I’m the best of the people they see, they give me the part.
Okay, so after this audition, who decides who gets it?
Oh uh, me and Ross can be the judges.
(To Rachel) Well, it’s better than us deciding.
Oh, come on! This is crazy! Can’t we just flip a coin?!
No! Coins hate me!
Okay. Okay fine, y’know what? We will let Ross and Joey decide. (Ross enters.) (In a sexy voice.) Hiiiii, Ross! Sweetie.
Hey there, you handsome thing. (Rachel and Phoebe exit.)
Wow, this cologne really is every bit as good as Georgio.
Hi.
Just uh, brought back your videos.
Uh hey look uh Ross, look I think we need to talk about before.
No! No we don’t!
Yes we do! Now look, that was the best nap I ever had!!
I… I don’t know what you are talking about.
Come on! Admit it! That was the best nap you ever had!
I’ve had better.
Okay! When?!
All right! All right! It was the best nap ever!
Uh-huh!
I’ve said it! Okay?! But it’s over Joey!
I want to do it again.
We can’t do it again.
Why not?
Because it’s weird!
Fine! Do you want something to drink?
Sure, what do you got?
Warm milk and Excedrin P.M. (Ross just leaves.)

summary: In this scene, Joey enters Rachel and Phoebe's apartment, where they are discussing Phoebe being chosen as Monica's maid of honor. Joey brings up Phoebe's past experience as a maid of honor, which Rachel is shocked to learn about. The two argue over who should be the maid of honor, leading Joey to suggest an "audition" to decide, with him and Ross as judges. Phoebe reluctantly agrees, and Rachel and Phoebe leave to prepare. Ross then enters, and Joey tries to convince him to admit that their previous shared nap was the best nap ever, which Ross eventually does, though he insists it was a one-time thing. Joey playfully suggests they do it again, but Ross refuses, calling it weird. The scene ends with Joey offering Ross a strange drink combination, which Ross declines by leaving.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Joey and Phoebe are on the couch as a man enters.

lines.dialogue: Hey guys!
Hey!
Hey sweetie!
Ready to go?
Yeah! Sure! Ooh, I left my purse up at Monica’s. I’ll be right back. (She goes to get it.)
(stopping her) Wait a minute!
What? (He leans in to kiss her.) Oh. (They kiss and Phoebe pauses.) Ooh. (Pause) Whoa! That one kept going. (Exits.)
So! You and Phoebe huh? How long have you been going out?
Over a month.
Wow! Maybe uh, maybe you and I ought to get to know each other a little better.
Sure, I’d like that.
So uh, what’s your name?
(laughs) Its Jake.
Joey. (They shake hands.) Hey Jake, do you like the Knicks?
Yeah, big fan.
Me too! There’s a game on Tuesday do you wanna go?
Yeah that would be great! Let me make sure I’m not doing anything Tuesday. (He bends over to open his bag, when he does so his pants slide down his butt revealing a pink lace secret.)

summary:
In this scene, Joey and Phoebe are at Central Perk when a man (later identified as Jake) enters. Phoebe and Jake are clearly in a relationship, as they exchange a kiss before Phoebe leaves to get her purse. Joey, curious about Jake, starts a conversation, asking how long they’ve been dating. Jake reveals it’s been over a month.

Joey then tries to bond with Jake by suggesting they get to know each other better, starting with a casual conversation about their shared interest in the Knicks. They agree to go to a game together on Tuesday. As Jake bends over to check his schedule, his pants accidentally slide down, revealing a pink lace thong. The scene ends with this unexpected and humorous moment.

background: Scene: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, everyone is there having breakfast and Joey enters carrying a loaf of bread.

lines.dialogue: Hey!
Hi!
Who wants French toast?
Oh, I’ll have some!
Good, me too. (Tosses him the loaf.) Eggs and milk are in the fridge. Thanks.
(entering from her room) Oww!
What’s the matter honey?
I don’t know, my hand feels weird. I guess it’s because, I’m engaged! (Shows off the ring.) How long before it starts getting annoying?
It starts?
Yeah, so let’s get started on the wedding plans!
Okay! (Runs off.)
(incredulous) Already?!
Yeah, we got a lot to do! We gotta think about the flowers, the caterers, the music…
Oh, I got some thoughts on that.
Oh wait Chandler, too many cooks…
Take from me, as the groom all you have to do is show up and try to say the right name.
(returning) Okay! (Sets down a huge 3" 3-ring binder on the table.)
What in God’s name is that?!
Oh my God, the wedding book?! I haven’t seen that since the forth grade!
This baby has got everything. Take y’know, locations for instance. (She opens up the binder to the locations chapter.) First, organized alphabetically, then geographically, then by square footage.
That is so smart! (To Chandler, under her breath) Break it off. Break it off now.

summary: In this scene, the group is having breakfast at Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's apartment. Joey enters with a loaf of bread and offers to make French toast, which Ross eagerly accepts. Monica then enters, showing off her engagement ring and asking how long it will take for the excitement to wear off. Rachel jumps in, suggesting they start planning the wedding immediately. Monica enthusiastically agrees and runs off, returning with a massive wedding planning binder, which she proudly explains is meticulously organized. Chandler is overwhelmed by the intensity of Monica's planning, while Phoebe jokingly advises him to break off the engagement. The scene highlights the excitement and chaos surrounding the wedding planning process.

background: Scene: A Bridal Shop, Phoebe and Rachel are waiting for Monica who is trying on her wedding dress.

lines.dialogue: (wearing a veil) Am I crazy or does this totally go?!
Oh my God! You look so beautiful!
(To Rachel) Thank you Rachel but, look at Monica!
This is it. Yeah, this is the one. I can’t believe I found it!
Wow you look so beautiful! If I knew you, I’d cry.
Well I’m Monica Geller, ball like a baby.
I’m Megan Bailey.
Have you found your dress yet?
Oh no, these dresses are all so amazing but there is no way I could afford one.

No, I can’t afford this either. No. I-I-I’m, I’m just to figure out which one I want then I’m gonna get it at Kleinman’s, this discount place in Brooklyn, day after tomorrow they are having a huge sale.
Oh, thanks for the tip.
Yeah! So-so when are you getting married?
Oh I’m not, I just like to try these on.
I do the same thing.
I’m just kidding. I’m getting married July 25th.
I’m just kidding too. (Laughs) I’m getting married in December. (Turns away not happy with herself.)
(To Monica) So when are you getting married?
Oh May 15th.
Oooh it’s getting close!
Yeah!
So uh, who’s your photographer?
Jeffery.
We met with him. Did he show you the photos of the nude wedding he did?
The best man? Wow!
I know! I almost called off my wedding. Oh, who’s your band?!
Oh, my fiancee wants the Swing Kings.
Oh, you’re so lucky. My fiancee wants the heavy metal band Carcass.
Ooh, is that spelled with a ‘C’ or a ‘K’? Oh my God! It doesn’t matter; they’re both great!
Oh y’know what? Y’know what? Now that you know what you want you should go to Kleinman’s and get it half off. This place is so overpriced.
I own this store.
So, does this (The dress) come in another color or… (The store owner walks away.)

summary:
In this scene, Phoebe, Rachel, and Monica are at a bridal shop. Phoebe is trying on a veil and asks if it looks good, to which Rachel enthusiastically agrees. Monica then reveals that she has found her dream wedding dress, though she admits she can't afford it and plans to buy it at a discount store during a sale. 

Megan, another customer, joins the conversation and shares her own wedding plans, including her concerns about her photographer and her fiancé's choice of a heavy metal band for the wedding. The conversation is light-hearted and filled with humor, with Rachel and Megan playfully joking about their own wedding plans. 

The scene ends with Rachel awkwardly trying to justify the high prices of the dresses to the store owner, who promptly walks away.

background: Scene: A Portrait Studio, Chandler and Monica are still trying to get the picture taken.

lines.dialogue: I know. Let’s try a look…of far off…wonderment. Okay, we’ll-we’ll gaze into our future and we’ll think about our marriage and the days to come. (Chandler is still not getting it.) Chandler! What is the matter with your face?! I mean this picture is supposed to say "Geller and Bing to be married," not "Local woman saves drowning moron!" (The photographer laughs.) Hey! Don’t laugh at him! He’s my drowning moron!
Aww! (Smiles.)
That’s it! Take it! Take it! Take it!

summary: In this scene, Monica and Chandler are at a portrait studio trying to get a photo taken for their upcoming wedding. Monica suggests they adopt a look of "far off wonderment," imagining their future together. However, Chandler struggles to maintain the right expression, leading Monica to jokingly complain that his face makes them look like "Local woman saves drowning moron." The photographer laughs, but Monica defends Chandler, affectionately calling him "her drowning moron." Chandler finally smiles, and Monica excitedly tells the photographer to take the picture.

background: Scene: Joey and Rachel's, Joey and Ross are napping together again and both wake up at the same time.

lines.dialogue: Great nap.
It really was.
(reacting first by jumping up) Dude! What the hell are you doing?! God! (Heads for his room leaving Ross.)
(slowly stands up and says quietly) Excuse me. (Exits.)

summary: In this scene, Joey and Ross are napping together at Joey and Rachel's apartment. Both wake up simultaneously and share a brief moment of agreement about how great the nap was. However, Joey suddenly reacts with shock and annoyance, jumping up and yelling at Ross, asking what he's doing there. Ross, taken aback, slowly stands up and quietly says "Excuse me" before leaving the room. Joey also exits, heading to his room, leaving the situation unresolved.

background: Scene: N.Y.U’s University Library, Ross is entering with Chandler.

lines.dialogue: …Come on! Why are we here?!
Okay, okay take a guess.
The hot chicks?

Okay, okay, I was typing names into the library computer earlier, y’know-y’know for fun, and I typed mine in and guess what came up? My doctoral dissertation! It’s here! Yeah, it’s right-it’s right down here! In the biggest library in the university! (They start heading that way, towards a secluded section behind the racks.)
Wow that’s actually pretty cool.
(stopping quickly) Oh umm, there’s also a book here by a woman named Wendy Bagina. (They both laugh, but stop when the hear moaning coming from the next aisle.) What is that?
Sounds like two people are really enjoying the Dewey decimal system.
(as they are moving past Ross) I’m so sorry!
Sorry!
You didn’t bring me here to do that, did you?

summary: In this scene, Ross and Chandler are at the N.Y.U. University Library. Ross is excited because he discovered that his doctoral dissertation is stored in the library's archives. As they walk through the library, they stumble upon a couple engaging in a private moment in a secluded section. The couple apologizes as they pass by, and Chandler jokingly suggests that Ross brought him there for that purpose. The scene ends with a mix of awkwardness and humor.

background: Scene: Ross’s classroom, he has just finished his lecture and the students are filing out.

lines.dialogue: Uh Mr. Morse, can I speak to you for a moment?
(walking up) That was a great lecture today. Did you get a little hair cut?
Uh-hmm, yeah-yeah do you like it? Do-do you looove it? I just want you to know that I’m changing your grade back.
What?! Why?
‘Cause I know what you’re trying to pull here. Okay? It’s not gonna work.
I’m not trying to pull anything. Look I love you dude.

Y’know what? I-I’m not even gonna talk about this. Okay? This little thing is over. I know you have a girlfriend! Okay—(Ned looks shocked)—Yeah! And I know about the other professors! How do you think that makes me feel Ned?! You used me! You don’t love me and you never did! (Ross turns around to make a grand exit but runs into two colleagues.) Ah Professor Winston, Professor Fredrickson, I’ll be right with you. (To Ned) Don’t make this worse and I’ll give you a C. (To the professors) Shall we? (They leave.)

summary: In this scene, Ross, a professor, confronts Morse, one of his students, in his classroom after a lecture. Ross accuses Morse of trying to manipulate him by complimenting his haircut and expressing affection, implying that Morse is attempting to influence his grade. Ross reveals that he knows Morse has a girlfriend and has been involved with other professors, accusing Morse of using him. Ross then threatens to give Morse a C if he doesn't stop making the situation worse. The scene ends with Ross leaving with two colleagues, leaving Morse visibly shocked and upset.

background: Scene: The Airport Ticket Counter, Monica and Chandler are standing in line behind another couple kissing who are next in line to be served.

lines.dialogue: Next?
They’re kissing let’s just go around them.
Oh honey, leave them alone, they’re in love.
I’m in love too! But in an orderly fashion.
Next?
(to the couple) Hi! Can you do that and walk? ‘Cause she said, "Next."
Sorry. We didn’t hear you; we’re on our honeymoon.
Oh, let me see what I can do. (Checks the computer) There are some first class seats available.
(To Chandler) Did you hear that?! They bumped them up to first class because they are on their honeymoon! Come on! Let’s act like we’re on our honeymoon.
We are on our honeymoon.
Grab my ass!
Next?
Hi, sorry. I almost didn’t hear you, because y’know I’m just so in love with my new husband. We’re on our honeymoon.
Congratulations. Okay, Mr. Bing you’ll be in 25J and Mrs. Bing you’ll be in 25K.
Oh no, you see we’re on our honeymoon. So umm, can you do your little thing and bump us up to first class?
I’m sorry, all our first class seats are taken. That couple got the last two.
You see, if we’d gone around them like I said, we—She would’ve given us those tickets. Damnit!
25J and K, any chance those aren’t together?

summary:
In this scene, Monica and Chandler are at the airport ticket counter, waiting in line behind a couple who are deeply engaged in kissing. Monica, frustrated by the delay, suggests going around the couple, but Chandler defends their love. When the ticket agent calls for the next person, Monica interrupts the couple, pointing out that it's their turn. The woman explains they are on their honeymoon, and the agent offers to upgrade them to first class.

Seeing this, Monica urges Chandler to pretend they are also on their honeymoon to get the same treatment. Chandler reluctantly agrees, and Monica playfully suggests he "grab her ass" to sell the act. When they reach the counter, Monica acts overly affectionate, claiming they are on their honeymoon. However, the agent informs them that all first-class seats are taken, and the couple in front got the last ones. Monica laments that if they had gone around the couple earlier, they might have gotten the first-class seats. Chandler, ever the optimist, asks if there's any chance their seats (25J and K) aren't together, hinting at his usual humor.

background: Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there.

lines.dialogue: Oh, Ross, Mon, is it okay if I bring someone to your parent’s anniversary party?
Yeah.
Sure. Yeah.
So, who’s the guy?
Well, his name is Parker and I met him at the drycleaners.
Oooh, did he put a little starch in your bloomers? (Sits up) Who said that?
Yeah, he’s really great though. He has this incredible zest for life, and he treats me like a queen, except at night when he treats me like the naughty girl I am.
(To Ross) Oh, by the way. Would it be okay if I gave the toast to mom and dad this year?
Uh, yeah, you sure you want to after what happened at their 20th?
Yeah, I’d really like to.
Okay, hopefully this time mom won’t boo you.
Yes! Every year Ross makes the toast, and it’s always really moving, and always makes them cry. Well this year I’m going to make them cry.
And you wonder why Ross is their favorite?
No! Really! Any time Ross makes a toast everyone cries, and hugs him, and pats him on the back and they all come up to me and say, "God, your brother." Know what they’ll say this year? "God, you"
Well I can promise you, at least one person will be crying. (Points to himself) I’m an actor, and any actor worth himself can cry on cue. (snaps fingers)
Really you can do that?
Are you kidding me? Watch! (Makes funny faces trying to cry) Well I can’t do it with you guys watching me!

summary: In this scene, Phoebe asks Ross and Monica if she can bring her new boyfriend, Parker, to their parents' anniversary party. She describes him as having a zest for life and treating her well. Meanwhile, Monica asks Ross if she can give the toast at the party instead of him, expressing her desire to make their parents cry with her speech, unlike Ross who always moves everyone to tears. Chandler teases Monica about Ross being their parents' favorite. Joey, trying to impress Monica, claims he can cry on cue as an actor, but fails when he attempts to demonstrate in front of everyone.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Monica and Chandler are on the couch as Phoebe enters with Monica’s soul mate.

lines.dialogue: Oh! Hi!
Hi!
Umm, Chandler, Monica, this is Don.
Oh, hello. (Shakes Chandler’s hand.) Hello. (Shakes Monica’s hand.)
(mouths to Chandler) Soul mate.
(mouths to Phoebe) What?
(cough talks) Soul mate.
So, what have you guys been doing?
Well, we just had a terrible lunch today at Reattica. What is with all the sun-dried tomatoes at that place?
I know! What is this, 1985?!
That’s exactly what I said. Phoebe, isn’t that strange.
Not really.
What’s wrong with sun-dried tomatoes? (Everyone stares at him.) On a barbecue chicken pizza? (Still there’s staring.) No?
So Don, what-what other restaurants do you like?
Well, Octavio, 27&7—Oh! And there’s this great little place, Alessandro’s.
Oh my God! That’s my restaurant, I’m the chef there.
You’re kidding me!
No!
Your food is fantastic! Wow, I really want to talk to you about your menu, once I get some coffees first. Um, anyone want any?
Oh, I’d like a latte. Oh y’know what? If you’re gonna talk about me, I’m gonna go with you.
What are you doing?!
Nothing! I swear to God I didn’t know you guys would be here! And the good news is you didn’t believe in soul mates. So…
I believe in tall, handsome strangers who hit on my wife!
They’re just talking, and y’know what? Just because I think they’re soul mates doesn’t mean anything’s gonna happen.
(returning) Phoebe, good work.
Yeah?
Yeah! Oh he’s great, I love him. (Walks away and Chandler glares at Phoebe.)
Don’t worry, we’ll find you someone else.

summary:
In this scene, Phoebe introduces Monica to Don, whom she believes is Monica's soul mate. The group is at Central Perk, and Chandler is initially skeptical about the whole "soul mate" concept. Don and Monica bond over their shared dislike for sun-dried tomatoes and discover they have more in common, including a mutual appreciation for Monica's cooking at Alessandro's, where she works as a chef.

As Don and Monica head to get coffee together, Chandler expresses his concern to Phoebe, who reassures him that nothing will happen between them. Monica, however, seems genuinely impressed with Don, leaving Chandler feeling uneasy. Phoebe tries to comfort Chandler by suggesting they'll find him someone else, but the scene ends with Chandler clearly worried about the potential for Monica and Don to become more than just friends.

background: Scene: Room 816, Phoebe is making her move on Cliff.

lines.dialogue: Okay I’ve got one for you, if you had too which one would you rather eat, a seeing eye dog or a talking gorilla?
I’d have to say…the talking gorilla, because at least I can explain to him that you’re making me eat him.
Somebody went to college. Wow. (Cliff gets uncomfortable) What is it? I’m sorry. (She moves her arm, which was resting on the same pillow his leg is.)
No, I’m sorry. It’s just my foot itches like crazy.
Oh, I’ll get it. (She gets up and grabs a spoon.)
Wow! I usually get to know a girl a little better before I let her spoon me.
Relax, it’s not like we’re forking.

summary: In this scene, Phoebe and Cliff are engaging in playful banter. Phoebe starts with a quirky hypothetical question about choosing between eating a seeing eye dog or a talking gorilla. Cliff responds with humor, choosing the talking gorilla and adding a clever explanation. Phoebe playfully teases him about his college education, which makes Cliff slightly uncomfortable. He then excuses himself by saying his foot itches, and Phoebe, misunderstanding, offers to help by grabbing a spoon. Cliff jokes about getting to know a girl better before letting her "spoon" him, to which Phoebe cheekily replies, "Relax, it's not like we're forking." The scene ends with lighthearted humor and a flirtatious undertone.

background: Scene: Another Waiting Room, Phoebe and Joey are trying to find out where the guy with the broken leg is.

lines.dialogue: (to the nurse) Excuse me? Could you help me with something? The patient I’m looking for has a broken leg and is in a wheelchair. And umm, he’s like early to mid-thirties, very attractive.
I think I know who you’re talking about.
Oh yay! Great! Okay, what room number is he in?
I’m sorry, that information is restricted to hospital staff…
(walks up) Uh, she’s with me. (Introduces himself) Dr. Drake Remoray.
Dr. Drake who?
Remoray. It’s Portuguese. We need that information; I’m a doctor.
A doctor at this hospital?
Damnit woman we’re losing precious time! Now do you want this man’s blood on your head?
Hands.
Hands! It is absolutely essential that you tell me what room the man my assistant described is staying in. He’s a patient of mine, I’ve been treating him for years!
He’s in room 816.
816, thank you!
Thank you. (Starts to exit.)
And what is his name?
(coming back for Joey) No! (Grabs Joey and drags him away.)

summary: In this scene, Phoebe and Joey are in a hospital waiting room trying to find out the room number of a man with a broken leg who is in a wheelchair. Phoebe initially approaches the nurse and describes the man, mentioning his age and attractiveness, but the nurse refuses to give out the information due to hospital policy. Joey then steps in, pretending to be a doctor named Dr. Drake Remoray, to try and get the information. He uses a dramatic and slightly threatening approach, claiming that they are losing precious time and that the nurse will be responsible if something happens to the patient. The nurse eventually gives in and provides the room number, 816. Joey then asks for the patient's name, but Phoebe quickly intervenes and drags Joey away before the nurse can respond.

background: Scene: A Restaurant, Joey is on his hot date and they’re not speaking right now.

lines.dialogue: Hey. Are you all right? You seem a little distracted.
No-no! I’m fine. It’s just… Hey, can I ask you something? Have you ever looked at someone that you’ve known for a while and then suddenly…suddenly see them a different way?
You mean like from behind?
Yeah. Yeah, that…that’s exactly it. You’re right. Yeah.
Ew, y’know what? One time I saw this guy from behind and he seemed like a totally normal guy and then he turned around and it was Stephan Baldwin!
(deadpan) Ooh! Yeah. So yeah, so you know exactly what I’m talking about.
Totally! Wow! (Pause) Would you excuse me for a sec?
Oh yeah, sure. (She gets up, walks towards the bathroom, and Joey watches her go.) Ehhh.

summary: In this scene, Joey is on a date at a restaurant, and the conversation starts with his date noticing that he seems distracted. Joey then asks her if she has ever looked at someone they know and suddenly seen them in a different way, which she interprets as a comment about seeing someone from behind. They share a light-hearted moment discussing an awkward encounter she had with Stephan Baldwin. The date then excuses herself to go to the bathroom, and Joey watches her leave, ending the scene on a slightly awkward note.

background: Scene: Ross’s Building, they are approaching the apartment of the woman who died. Ross knocks on the door and a woman answers it.

lines.dialogue: Yes?
Hi. I’m Ross Geller. I live in the building.
And I’m Rachel, an admirer of the building.
I-I heard about Mrs. Verhoeven passing away and I’m so sorry for your loss.
She didn’t pass.
What?
My mother’s still alive.
Oh, thank God!
It looked like we were gonna lose her this morning, but she’s a tough old bird.
Ahh.
Are you close with her?
Of course! Uh yeah, she and I would talk all the time in-in (Rachel pokes her head in and starts to look around) the laundry room. (Pushes Rachel out of the way.)
You speak Dutch? (In Dutch) Zeer vereerd een vriend van mijn moeder te ontmoeten. (Translation
Y’know I would it’s just painful.
So she’s really not dead.
No, she’s hanging in there.
Hmm. Do you think—Could you tell me if she’s hanging in, in a one bedroom or a two?

summary: In this scene, Ross and Rachel approach the apartment of Mrs. Verhoeven, who they had mistakenly heard had passed away. Ross introduces himself and expresses his condolences, but Mrs. Verhoeven's daughter reveals that her mother is actually still alive, much to Ross's relief. The daughter explains that her mother had a close call but is still hanging on. Rachel, seemingly more interested in the apartment's layout, casually asks if it's a one-bedroom or two-bedroom, which catches the daughter off guard. The scene ends with a mix of relief, awkwardness, and Rachel's characteristic curiosity about real estate.

background: Scene: Ross's Apartment, a locksmith has finished changing the locks on Ross’s door.

lines.dialogue: Okay, and oh I’m gonna need a bunch of extra keys. Apparently I give them away for no reason at all.
(entering) Hey Ross, what’s going on? You changing the lock?
No. That guy is.
I don’t understand. You-you give me a key to your apartment and then you change the lock.
Good luck buddy. (Exits.)
Umm, I-I thought we were moving forward and now you’re-you’re sending me all these mixed signals. What are you trying to tell me?
I’m trying to tell you I made you a mix tape.
What?
I love you!
Ohh! (Hugs him.) And I love spending time with you. (Ross isn’t happy.)

summary: In this scene, Ross has just had the locks on his apartment changed, and Mona enters, confused about the situation. Ross awkwardly jokes about giving away keys "for no reason," which Mona interprets as a mixed signal in their relationship. The locksmith exits, leaving the two to address the tension. Ross then awkwardly tries to lighten the mood by saying he made Mona a mix tape, and when Mona responds positively, Ross seems less than thrilled. The scene ends with Mona expressing her affection, but Ross's reaction suggests there's more going on beneath the surface.

background: Scene: The Hospital, Ross and Rachel, who’s in a wheelchair, are arriving in the waiting room for the maternity ward.

lines.dialogue: All right! (Checking his watch) Yes!! From home to the hospital in under seven minutes! We did it!!
(deadpan) Yes, the hard part is truly over.
No, but come on, we’re off to a great start aren’t we? I knew I’d get you here fast, but this has got to be some kind of a record!
Oh you made it!
Hi! (Ross is stunned.)
How are you doing?
Wait a minute! How-how the hell did you beat us here?
We took a cab. Did you guys walk?
N… No! We took a cab too, but I did test runs!
Hi!
Hey! You made it!
Okay is there…some kind of magic tunnel to this hospital?!
Ross, you stay here and talk, I’m gonna go have a baby.
Okay. Okay. (To the nurse behind the desk.) Umm hi, this is Rachel Green. I’m Ross Geller. We-we called from the car.
Right! We have a semi-private labor room waiting for you. So in just a minute…
(interrupting her) Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! I’m sorry, semi-private? We (Laughs), we asked for a private room.
Yes, I see that here. Unfortunately we can’t guarantee a private room and currently they’re all unavailable.
Man, if only you’d gotten here sooner. (Ross turns and glares at him.)
I’m sorry. Semi-private rooms are all we have.
Okay. Just give us a second. Ross! (They walk away from the desk.)
Yeah?
Give her some money.
I really think they’re out of rooms.
They’re not!! Ross, they’re just saving them for the important people!! Okay?! What-what if I was the president?!

Well then we’d be in a lot of trouble, you don’t know where any countries are. (Rachel glares at him.) Okay. (He goes over to the desk followed by Rachel.) Uh, say would you umm… Would you mind checking again to see if any umm, private rooms may have (Handing her some money) opened up?
This is a hospital.

(standing up) Okay. Y’know what? I’d have to say I really don’t care for your tone. And this is not the only hospital in this city and we have no problem to—Whoa! (She starts a contraction) Oh gosh! Whoa!
What-what?
Ow! Ow! Contraction. (Sits back down.) Ow-ow! Ow-ow! (Starts breathing heavily.)
Would you like to see a semi-private room?
Yeah, it couldn’t hurt to look.

summary: In this scene, Ross and Rachel arrive at the hospital for the birth of their baby, with Ross proudly boasting about their speedy arrival. However, they are surprised to find their friends already there, who had arrived earlier by cab. Rachel is frustrated when they are told there are no private rooms available, believing that the hospital is reserving them for "important people." Ross reluctantly tries to bribe the nurse for a private room, but Rachel's contraction interrupts the conversation. Ultimately, Rachel agrees to see the semi-private room, despite her initial objections.

background: Scene: Central Perk, Ross is entering and Mona from the wedding recognizes him.

lines.dialogue: Ross?
Yeah?
Hey it’s Mona! From the wedding.
Oh hi!
Hi!
Wow! Uh…how are you?
I’m good except umm, you still owe me a dance.
Oh that’s right. Well uh, would you be interested in seeing a Ukrainian film?
(laughs then stops) Oh you’re serious. Sure!
Great! Well umm…
I think I might need one more cup of coffee.
Sure! Uh, let me get it for ya.
Okay.

summary: In this scene, Ross enters Central Perk and is recognized by Mona, whom he met at a wedding. Mona playfully reminds Ross that he still owes her a dance. Ross, seizing the opportunity, invites her to see a Ukrainian film. Mona, initially amused, agrees, and Ross offers to buy her another cup of coffee before they go. The scene ends with a light, friendly interaction between the two.

background: Scene: The Vending Machines, Phoebe is buying a soda and Joey is shaking the candy machine.

lines.dialogue: Come on you stupid machine! Come on!
Oh, it ate your money?
(looking at her) No.
All right, I’ll see you downstairs then.
All right.
All right.
Hey I got one! I got one!

summary: In this scene, Phoebe is purchasing a soda from a vending machine, while Joey is attempting to get a candy from another machine by shaking it. Joey is frustrated with the machine, exclaiming, "Come on you stupid machine!" Phoebe asks if the machine ate his money, but Joey replies, "No." They exchange casual goodbyes, with Phoebe planning to leave. Just as she is about to go, Joey triumphantly announces, "Hey, I got one!" indicating that he finally managed to get a candy from the machine.

background: Scene: A Street, Phoebe is walking down it and passes Ursula.

lines.dialogue: Ursula! (Ursula turns, smiles, and continues walking.) Wait! Err-err, it’s me! Phoebe!
Oh, I thought there was a mirror there. Okay, bye-bye. (Starts to walk again.)
Wait a second! So, what’s new with you?
Umm, nothing. I mean, I’m getting married next week.
What?!
Yeah! Yeah, it’s gonna be a small ceremony. Just family. (Phoebe looks at her.) His.
Huh. Okay. Well, I’m really happy for you. (Starts to walk away.)
Wait! If umm, if you want to come, I guess that’d be okay.
Really?
Sure! Why not? You could be my sister for the day.
Yeah. Okay. Umm, y’know, my friends are having a Halloween party tonight at my old apartment so, you could come. Maybe I could meet the guy you’re marrying.
Huh. Well, I’m supposed to be working at the restaurant tonight. I’m supposed to be working right now, so who cares.
By the way, it’s a costume party.
Oh! Okay, so that’s why you’re… (Motions to what she’s wearing.)
(looks down) No. But thanks. (Walks away.)

summary: In this scene, Phoebe encounters her twin sister Ursula on the street. Phoebe initially tries to get Ursula's attention, but Ursula dismisses her, mistaking her for a reflection. When Phoebe finally gets Ursula to stop, she learns that Ursula is getting married next week, a detail that surprises Phoebe. Ursula invites Phoebe to the wedding, suggesting she could "be her sister for the day." Phoebe, in turn, invites Ursula to a Halloween party at her old apartment, where she could potentially meet Ursula's fiancé. Ursula, who is supposed to be working, seems indifferent to her job and agrees to come to the party. The scene ends with Phoebe walking away, slightly confused by Ursula's casual attitude.

background: Scene: Mona’s Apartment, she and her date are making out as Ross flips through a magazine while lying behind the couch and sees something that he likes. Meanwhile, Mona’s date takes off Ross’s shirt and Mona throws it on the floor. While they start making out again, Ross tries to pull the rug the shirt is on over to him, but while he does that he moves the coffee table and it bumps into the couch.

lines.dialogue: (seeing Ross) Oh my God! Ross!!!
Hello!!
Ross, what are you doing?!
Not touching myself if that makes anyone less uncomfortable.

summary: In this scene, Mona and her date are passionately making out in Mona's apartment. Unbeknownst to them, Ross is lying behind the couch, flipping through a magazine. When Mona’s date takes off Ross’s shirt and Mona throws it on the floor, Ross tries to pull the rug (with the shirt on it) toward him. In the process, he accidentally moves the coffee table, causing it to bump into the couch. Mona notices Ross and is shocked, exclaiming, "Oh my God! Ross!!!" Ross nonchalantly responds with a greeting, and when Mona asks what he’s doing there, he quips, "Not touching myself if that makes anyone less uncomfortable." The scene ends with Mona’s surprise and Ross’s awkward presence.

background: Scene: Ross and…Rachel’s…I guess I have to call it that now. Rachel is reading on the couch as Ross enters.

lines.dialogue: Well, I’m, uh, going to pick up Mona. What have you got going tonight?
Oh, I’ve got big Valentine’s plans! I’ve got my Chinese food on the way, and the rest of your saltwater taffy!
Y’know, it’s interesting! Most people think that’s made with seawater, when in fact—
Ross, we actually watched the documentary together.
Ooh! My Chinese food! Let me get my cash! (runs to her room to get her money)
(opening the door to see Mona standing there) Mona? What are—hi! What are you doing here? I’m, um, supposed to pick you up!
Change of plans, I made you a special Valentine’s dinner! Surprise!
(he makes some really weird noise hear that sounds kind of like…)Ayyyayyyy!
(entering) Oh, hey, Mona!
Hi! Hi. Hi, Rachel! (to Ross) What’s she doing here?
I have no idea!
I’ll be watching TV if anybody needs me. (exits to her room)
Seriously, what is she doing?
Uh…lately, she just likes hanging out here.
Why?
I think she’s lonely.
Okay, but it’s Valentine’s Day!
I know.
Can’t we just ask her to go?
No, no. She’s way to emotional. And by emotional I mean crazy.
I’m not here! That’s just my Chinese food!
Oh, my God! She has food delivered here?
Mm-hmm. She’s—she’s emotional, but, but ballsy.
You know what I’m going to do? I’m going to get in my sweats, and eat this in bed! (exits)
And you thought she was going to be in our way! So, why don’t you, uh, open the champagne, and I’ll be right back. I’ve got a surprise for you.
You got another ex-wife back there?
(fakes a laugh) Please start drinking! (exits)
(entering) I’m just going to grab the phone.
Oh, Rachel! Wait! Hey, I hope you don’t take this the wrong way, but, but, um… what are you doing?
Oh, I’m sorry! Do you need the phone?
No, no. Listen, Ross is too nice to say anything, but this is his apartment, and, and, we gotta have some boundaries, so why don’t you go back to your place and give us some privacy?
(as Ross enters with a present) But, but, Mona, I live here.
(handing Mona the present) Happy Valentine’s Day! …Or something to remember me by.

summary:
In this scene, Ross is preparing to pick up his girlfriend, Mona, for Valentine's Day. Rachel, who lives with Ross, is casually planning to spend the evening eating Chinese food and watching TV. When Mona unexpectedly arrives with a Valentine's dinner, the situation becomes awkward as Rachel is still present in the apartment. Mona questions why Rachel is there, and Ross explains that Rachel has been feeling lonely and has been spending a lot of time at the apartment.

Mona suggests that Rachel should leave to give them privacy, but Rachel reveals that she actually lives there. The tension is lightened slightly when Ross presents Mona with a Valentine's gift, but the scene ends with an unresolved tension between the three characters, particularly Mona's discomfort with Rachel's presence.

background: Scene: Joey and Rachel's, Joey and Rachel are still discussing Bobby and Dina’s situation.

lines.dialogue: Joey, just because they’re not getting married doesn’t mean this is going to be a disaster. Maybe they have a plan!
Oh? Oh! Okay! Okay! Let’s hear their plan! Now, what’s the future look like for Dina and Bobby?
Well…I really have high hopes for my band.
(to Dina) You were right. He is funny.
Hey, now wait a minute! I get when you told people at first that you wanted to be an actor they laughed at you! Now come on Bobby, why don’t you tell us a little bit about your band?
Well it’s just me and my pal Rooster, the band’s name is Numb Nuts.
(To Dina) Really? (Nods her head at Bobby.)
Dina, if you’re having a baby you should be married! Even if it is to Bobby! (Bobby gets happy.) Dude, that’s not a compliment!
No Joey! I knew you wouldn’t be supportive!
So whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! What are you gonna do? You’re gonna have the baby and-and raise it by yourself…without a husband?! You can’t be a single mother alone! You’re gonna ruin your life!
Oh excuse me! Am I ruining my life?
No! No! No! It’s different for you. You’re so strong and together. You’re not some dumb kid who doesn’t know what she’s doing.
Excuse me?
One pregnant woman at a time, please! I just want you to be okay.
So forcing her to marry Bobby is gonna make that happen?
Maybe! (To Bobby) Well! Well…so-so uh, what kind of music does Numb Nuts—Oh forget it! I can’t!
Joey, I am scared to death about this. But I really think I can do it, I’m just gonna need some help. And Bobby’s gonna be here the whole time.
You bet I am! (To Joey) And to answer your earlier question, we’re straight-up gangster rap. (Joey shakes his head as if he’s about to lose it.)
Look, Rachel’s told me how much easier you’ve made all this on her. Why can’t you do that for me?
Because! ‘Cause… ‘Cause you’re my baby sister!
And you’re my big brother! I mean, you’re my favorite guy in the whole world. I’m not even scared to tell mom and dad. I was scared of telling you.
Well I’d be scared of them, but all right.
Joey, I can’t stand the thought of having this baby with you mad at me. I want him to have his uncle. Is my baby gonna have his Uncle Joey?
Of course he’s gonna have his Uncle Joey!
We’re gonna be all right. I mean, even if we’re not married this baby is gonna be so loved. Not just by us.
That’s right! By his uncle too!
And by you.
Okay Bobby, why don’t we just come over here and let them have a little moment. (Drags Bobby away from Joey and Dina.)
Come here! (Hugs Dina and Bobby looks to hug Rachel.)
No! Seriously! What’s wrong with you?!

summary:
In this scene, Joey and Rachel are discussing Dina and Bobby's situation. Dina is pregnant, and they are not planning to get married. Joey is strongly against the idea of Dina raising the baby without being married, while Rachel tries to support Dina and Bobby's decision.

Joey initially mocks Bobby's aspirations for his band, Numb Nuts, but Rachel defends Bobby, reminding Joey of how people doubted his acting career. Joey then expresses his concern for Dina, suggesting that she should marry Bobby for the sake of the baby. Dina, however, insists that she can handle the situation with Bobby's support and asks Joey to be supportive as well.

Dina emotionally appeals to Joey, reminding him of their sibling bond and her desire for her baby to have a loving family, including Uncle Joey. Joey eventually softens and agrees to support Dina, promising to be there for her and the baby. The scene ends with Joey hugging Dina, while Rachel playfully rebukes Bobby for trying to hug her.

background: Scene: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is getting ready for her date and Joey is reading a magazine.

lines.dialogue: Hey, what do you think is a better excuse for why I’m not drinking on this date tonight. "Umm, I’m a recovering alcoholic. I’m a Mormon," or "I got so hammered last night I’m still a little drunk?"
(entering with a pizza and beer) Hey!
Hi!
Hey!
So, what do you want to do tonight? There’s a Ukrainian film at the Angelica that’s supposed to be very powerful. Interested?
No. No. But I’ll go see a normal person movie with ya.
Rach? You wanna come?
Oh no, I can’t. I got a date.
A date?
Yeah. Why? Is that weird for you?
Why no, it’s the opposite of weird. It’s-it’s uh, regular. It’s-it’s uh, it’s mundane. It’s actually uh, a little dull.
It’s no Ukrainian film.
Yeah—Ooh! Earrings! (Goes into her room.)
A date?! She’s-she’s got a date?! With who?
I set her up with this actor on my show.
You set her up?!
No
Joey what-what were you thinking?!
Well, I was thinking that it’d probably be okay because Ross hasn’t gone out with Rachel in five years!
Joey, I’m not worried about her! I’m worried about my baby! Whoever she dates my baby dates! Now-now where is this (makes the quote-marks sign) actor taking them?
Hey! I’m an (does the quote-marks thing as well) actor too! I’m not sure. I think they’re taking the ferry out to some Italian place on Staten Island.
A ferry? My baby is going on a ferry? Do you have any idea how dangerous those are?!
Are we talking about one of those big boats that carry cars that go like five miles an hour?
Why don’t they just jump out of an airplane?! Huh?! That-that’s a fun date! Or burn each other with matches?! That’s fun too! Whew!!
Hey Joey.
Hey Kash. Uh hey-hey this is Ross. Ross, this is Kash.
Hey.
Hi. I-I hear you’re going on a ferry tonight.
Yeah.
A bit of a daredevil are we?
(entering from her room) Hey guys do you think this is too slutty—Hi Kash!
Hey Rachel! You ready to go?
Yeah! All right, I’ll see you guys later.
Okay. Have a great time you guys.
Thank you.
Thank you.
Yes it is too slutty! (Joey slams the door before Rachel could hear the entire sentence.)

summary: In this scene, Rachel is preparing for a date set up by Joey with an actor from his show. She asks Joey and Ross for advice on an excuse for not drinking on her date, suggesting various humorous options. Ross enters with pizza and beer, and invites Joey and Rachel to a Ukrainian film, but Rachel declines as she has a date. Ross reacts with surprise and mild jealousy to the news of Rachel's date, expressing concern for her safety and the potential impact on his baby (presumably referring to their daughter, Emma). Joey reassures Ross, but Ross remains anxious about the ferry ride to Staten Island. Kash, Rachel's date, arrives, and after a brief interaction, Rachel and Kash leave for their date. Ross, in a moment of frustration, mutters that Rachel's outfit is too "slutty," but Joey quickly shuts the door to prevent Rachel from hearing.

background: Scene: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler’s bachelor party has begun, what there is of it, with only Joey (wearing a gold paper top hat) and Chandler (wearing what appears to be a Burger King paper crown) enjoying a nice product placement of Budweisers on ice.

lines.dialogue: So you uh, nervous about getting married?
What are you doing?
Look, look let’s pretend it’s a real bachelor party. Okay? Y’know? Before your wedding. Come on, it’ll be fun.
Okay. I can’t believe tomorrow’s the big day.
How does it feel knowing you’re never gonna be with another woman again huh? Knowing you’re gonna have to wake up to the same face everyday until you finally have the sweet release of death.
You’re right, this is more fun.
That’s her! Okay, come on! (They go over and open the door.)
Hi!
Hi. (Joey blows on a noisemaker.)
So which one of you lucky boys is Chandler?
Uh, that-that’s-that’s me!
That’s me.
Joey Tribbiani, a big fan.
So is that a bedroom? (Points to the guestroom.)
Yeah, yeah right over there.
All right, whenever you’re ready. (She goes into the bedroom.)
That was weird.
Why-why would she go in the bedroom?
I’m waiting.
So she’s a…
Yeah, that’s one naked hooker!

summary:
In this scene, Joey and Chandler are at Chandler's bachelor party, which is a rather subdued affair with just the two of them drinking Budweisers. Joey tries to liven things up by pretending it's a real bachelor party and asks Chandler if he's nervous about getting married. Chandler playfully responds, and Joey continues to tease him about the idea of being with only one woman for the rest of his life.

Suddenly, a stripper arrives at the door, and Joey and Chandler awkwardly try to figure out what to do. Joey initially pretends to be Chandler, but Chandler corrects him. The stripper asks which one of them is Chandler and then heads to the bedroom, leaving the two friends confused and unsure of how to proceed. Joey hilariously concludes that the stripper is a "naked hooker," adding to the absurdity of the situation.

background: Scene: Ross's Apartment, continued from earlier.

lines.dialogue: (closes her magazine) Can I get you some water?
I’m good. I’m good.
Ross, there is no pressure on you. Okay? I mean you can as involved as you want. (Ross nods.)
Yeah, I need uh… I’m just—I don’t know—I don’t understand, umm, how this happened? We-we used a condom.
I know. I know, but y’know condoms only work like 97% of the time.
What? What? What?!! Well they should put that on the box!!!
They do!
No they don’t!!! (He runs to the bedroom to check and returns with his box of condoms.) Well they should put it in huge black letters!!!!
Okay Ross come on let’s just forget about the condoms.
Oh well I may as well have!
Listen, y’know what? I was really freaked out too when I found out…
Freaked out? Hey no, I’m not freaked out! I’m indignant! As a consumer!
Y’know what? Let’s, let’s talk later.
No! No! I want to talk now! Okay? I—In fact, (picks up the phone) I am going to talk to the president of the condom company!
Okay, y’know maybe I should come back… (Starts to leave.)
(grabs her) Shh! Shh! Shh!
(stops) Okay.
(on phone) Yeah I’ll press 1! (Presses one which allows Rachel to escape.)

summary:
In this scene, Rachel and Ross are discussing the unexpected pregnancy, which has left Ross feeling confused and frustrated. Ross is fixated on the fact that they used a condom, which he believed was supposed to prevent pregnancy. Rachel tries to reassure him that condoms are not 100% effective, but Ross is outraged and insists that this information should be more prominently displayed on the packaging.

As the conversation escalates, Ross becomes more agitated, even suggesting that he will call the president of the condom company to complain. Rachel, feeling overwhelmed, tries to leave, but Ross stops her. In a moment of comic relief, Ross pretends to call the company, allowing Rachel to quietly slip away while he is distracted.
