The scene highlights Ross's initial reaction to the news and his struggle to process the situation, while Rachel attempts to keep the conversation calm and supportive.

background: Scene: Chandler’s Office, his boss Doug is entering Monica is there as well.

lines.dialogue: Bing! Ho! And the Bing-ette!
Honey, you remember my boss Doug right?
Yes, hi.
Hi. So good news, the divorce is final. I signed the papers this A.M.
I didn’t know you and Carol were getting divorced, I’m sorry.
Sorry? Finally chewed my leg out of that bear trap. Hey, congratulations to you guys though!
No leg chewing for us sir.
Oh well, give it time. So the divorce, the marriage, we’ve got a lot to celebrate. How about we all go out to dinner tomorrow night?
I can’t think of anything we’re doing. (Quietly) Why can’t I think of anything we’re doing?
Tomorrow night it is then, I should be out of court by six. They keep throwing these sexual harassment cases at me and I keep knocking them out of the park!

Okay, I’ll see you tomorrow! (Doug exits.) Just so you know, we’re not seeing him tomorrow. (Chandler wonders why.) I-I cannot spend another evening with that man. Do you remember how he behaved at our wedding?
No.
That’s because he wasn’t invited because of the way he behaved at our engagement party.
Oh yeah. Boy, urine cuts right through an ice sculpture doesn’t it?

summary: In this scene, Chandler introduces Monica to his boss, Doug, in his office. Doug announces that his divorce is final and seems to be in high spirits about it, comparing his marriage to a "bear trap." He then suggests that they all go out to dinner to celebrate his divorce and their relationship. Monica, however, is clearly uncomfortable with the idea, recalling Doug's inappropriate behavior at their engagement party and wedding, which included urinating on an ice sculpture. Chandler seems oblivious to Doug's past antics, but Monica makes it clear that she has no intention of spending another evening with him.

background: Scene: Monica and Chandler's, Brenda is wiping the coffee table and Chandler is trying to look at her bra and leans over on the coffee table to get a good look.

lines.dialogue: (noticing him) What are you doing?
I’m leaning. This is where I lean.
Okay. (Goes over and fluffs up the pillows on the couch.
Brenda a bee!
What?
Yes! It’s flown into your blouse and you’d better undo your buttons lest it sting you!
I think I know what’s going on here.
You do?
Look, I know it must be hard that your wife is a lesbian, but it’s wrong. You’re married.
I totally understand. (They both laugh.) Can I just see your bra?

summary: In this scene, Chandler is trying to sneak a peek at Brenda's bra while she is cleaning the coffee table. When Brenda catches him, he awkwardly tries to cover up by pretending to lean on the table. Later, he makes up a ridiculous excuse about a bee flying into her blouse to try and see her bra again. Brenda, realizing what Chandler is doing, confronts him, thinking he is acting out due to his wife Monica being a lesbian. Despite the serious topic, they both laugh, and Chandler cheekily asks if he can just see her bra. The scene ends with a mix of awkwardness and humor.

background: Scene: The Midfield Day School, it’s after school and Ben is taking a drink of water as Phoebe enters.

lines.dialogue: Oh, there you are Ben!
Aunt Phoebe, what are you doing here?

Well, I heard you’re having a problem with one of the boys in your class. And so I thought I would just come down here and sit you both down, have a little talk and make it all okay. Now umm, the boy’s name is Sting’s son.
Jack? I hate him! He’s a jerk.
Now Ben, sometimes people may seem like jerks on the outside, but they have famous fathers.
I have to go. My friend Doug is waiting for me over there. (Goes over to Doug.)
Him you’re friends with. (Starts looking at the children trying to find Jack and a teacher notices her.)
Excuse me. Can, can I help you with something?
Yes! Yes you can, I’m looking for Jack’s parents.
Are you with one of the students?
Uh-huh, I’m with Ben.
Are you one of Ben’s mothers?
I am one of Ben’s mothers. I’m a lesbian. It was, it was difficult coming out to my parents.
Well hi, I’m Jenny Boone. I’m the new teacher here.
Oh.
I’ve only met your partner Carol.
Ah! Okay so that would make me Susan.
Right. Are you looking for Jack’s parents to discuss the problems he’s having with Ben? (Phoebe nods ‘Yes.’) Yeah. Because I really do think the parents should sit down and have a conversation.
Yeah! Let’s do that!! That-that sounds good. We should sit down and talk, just me, my lover Carol, and the Stings. Umm, how-how will I get in touch with them?
Oh, their number is on the contact sheet.
Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Umm, could-could I get a copy of that? ‘Cause Carol threw it out, she lost ours. She’s such a scatterbrain, but man what a hot piece of ass.

summary:
In this scene, Phoebe arrives at Midfield Day School to address a conflict between Ben and another student, Jack, who is the son of a famous person. Ben expresses his dislike for Jack, but Phoebe tries to reason with him, suggesting that Jack might not be as bad as he seems because of his famous father. Ben dismisses the conversation and goes to meet his friend Doug.

Phoebe, now on a mission to find Jack's parents, is approached by a teacher, Jenny Boone, who initially mistakes Phoebe for one of Ben's mothers. Phoebe goes along with the misunderstanding, identifying herself as Susan, Ben's other mother (Carol being her partner). The teacher suggests that a meeting between the parents could resolve the issue, and Phoebe enthusiastically agrees. She asks for Jack's parents' contact information, explaining that her partner Carol lost their copy. The scene ends with Phoebe's quirky and somewhat chaotic approach to resolving the situation.

background: Scene: Joey’s Audition, Joey is being shown in.

lines.dialogue: Hey Joey, hi! I’m Ray; I’m the producer of the show.
(announcer voice) It’s a pleasure to meet you Ray.
And this is Duncan (points to the cameraman) and Erin, they’re gonna help us out with the audition. So uh, let’s get the camera rolling.
(announcer voice) Rightie-O Ray!
Whenever you’re ready.
(to the camera) Hello, I’m Joey Tribbiani! Let’s play Bamboozled! Erin, you get the first question! In hockey, who is known as The Great One?
Wayne Gretzky.
Correct! Now, would you like to pick a Wicked Wango card or spin the Wheel of Mayhem?
Uh Joey, didn’t your agents give you the revised rules? We’ve eliminated all of that. No wheel, no cards.
What—Why?!
Uh well, the game was too complicated and research showed people didn’t follow it.

Well what’s complicated? You spin the Wheel of Mayhem to go up the Ladder of Chance. You go past the Mud Hut through the Rainbow Ring to get to the Golden Monkey; you yank his tail and boom! You’re in Paradise Pond!
Yeah all that’s gone. It’s basically just a simple question and answer game now.
Well what’s fun about that? You expect me to be the host of a boring game that’s just people standing around answering questions?
Well, there’ll be women in bikinis holding up the scores.
(announcer voice to the camera) Let’s play Bamboozled!

summary:
In this scene, Joey is attending an audition for a game show called "Bamboozled." The producer, Ray, introduces himself and explains that the audition will be filmed with the help of Duncan (the cameraman) and Erin. Joey begins his audition by enthusiastically introducing himself and starting the game with a question for Erin. However, Ray interrupts to inform Joey that the game's rules have been drastically simplified due to research showing that the original format was too complicated for viewers.

Joey is visibly disappointed and confused, as he had memorized and was excited about the elaborate, colorful, and seemingly fun game mechanics involving a Wheel of Mayhem, Wicked Wango cards, and various themed stages like the Rainbow Ring and Paradise Pond. Ray explains that the new format is just a straightforward question-and-answer game, which Joey finds boring and unappealing. Ray tries to salvage the situation by mentioning that there will be women in bikinis holding up the scores, which Joey immediately responds to by enthusiastically re-introducing the game to the camera.

The scene highlights Joey's passion for the original game format and his struggle to adapt to the new, simplified version, as well as his immediate attraction to the idea of women in bikinis, which seems to reignite his enthusiasm for the role.

background: Scene: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is eating pizza as Joey returns from the Knicks game.

lines.dialogue: Hey!
Hey!
How was the game?
Oh, okay. I…I ate way too much.
Oh.
Ooh. (Notices the pizza, grabs a slice, and takes a bite.) So umm, I was talkin’ to Ross and he said you were looking for a new place.
Oh yeah! Hopefully across the street if certain Dutch people would just let go.
I was kinda hoping you’d stay.
Oh but Joey, I have to go. There’s no room for a baby here.

No room? It’s a baby. It’s like this big. (Holds his hands about a foot apart.) Y’know, I mean you-you could you could put it over here. (A desk.) Or-or-or we could put it right here. (The chair.) Aw, it’s cute, right? Or-or we could put it over here. (By the bathroom door.) You wouldn’t even notice it. Where’s the baby? (Mumbles that it’s over in the corner.)

Honey, it’s not just a matter of where you put it. I mean a baby changes everything. They cry all the time. I mean imagine bringing home some girl and trying to score when there’s a screaming baby around.
I could use a challenge! It’s getting pretty easy.
Honey, it’s so sweet that you want me to stay, but I-I can’t do that to you. I mean it would disrupt your entire life.
I love living with you so much. I just wish things didn’t have to change.
I know.
Y’know I blame Ross for this.
I do too a little bit.
I’m gonna miss you, you’re the hottest roommate I ever had.

summary: In this scene, Rachel and Joey are discussing Rachel's plans to move out due to her pregnancy. Joey returns from a Knicks game and, after noticing Rachel eating pizza, casually brings up her search for a new place. Rachel mentions her hope to move across the street, hinting at her frustration with the current situation. Joey expresses his desire for Rachel to stay, even suggesting creative ways to fit a baby into their current living space. Rachel explains that having a baby would disrupt their lives significantly, but Joey playfully brushes off the concerns, even joking about how it might add a challenge to his dating life. Despite his lightheartedness, Joey admits he loves living with Rachel and wishes things didn't have to change. The scene ends with Joey blaming Ross for the situation and expressing his fondness for Rachel as his roommate.

background: Scene: Ross and Rachel's, Ross is helping Rachel study for when the baby comes.

lines.dialogue: (closing a book) Okay! I’m ready.
You sure?
Yes, I’ve done my studying and I really know my stuff.
All right then. (Gets up, in an announcer’s voice) Rachel Green! Let’s play Bamboozled! (Reading from a note card.) How do you test the temperature of the baby’s bath water?
Uh, put your elbow in it.
Excellent! How do you put a baby down for a nap?
Full, dry, on its back, and no loose covers.
That’s correct! This is an audio question, what do you do when the baby makes this sound? (Makes a sound like someone is choking a cat.)
Check if it’s wet, check if it’s hungry, burp it!
Excellent! Excellent, now-now do you want another question or a Wicked Wango card?
A card! A card! I pick a card!
Oh, I’m sorry you’ve been Bamboozled! You’re gonna be a terrible mother! (Rachel stares at him agape.) I’ve lost sight of why we’re doing this! (Rachel gets up and walks away.)

summary: In this scene, Ross is helping Rachel prepare for motherhood by quizzing her on baby care basics. Rachel confidently answers all the questions, showing she has studied well. However, Ross, in a playful but misguided attempt to add humor, ends the session by joking that Rachel will be a terrible mother. This comment catches Rachel off guard, and she walks away, upset by his insensitivity. Ross realizes his mistake and acknowledges that he lost sight of the serious purpose behind their study session.

background: Scene: Monica and Chandler's, Joey and Chandler are still working on the door.

lines.dialogue: There has got to be a way!
Easy there Captain Kirk. Oh, do you have a bobby pin?
Yeah. (Checks his hair.) Oh no wait, I’m not an nine-year-old girl.
Then why do you throw like one?
Maybe Monica has a bobby pin.
Sure. "Monica."
So, how’s the hideously inappropriate crush on Rachel coming?

Uh, really good. Really good. Yeah, I should be ready to kill myself any day now. (Chandler returns with a bobby pin and hands it to Joey.) Wow, you sure found that quick. (He tries the pin in the lock.) I just—I wish I didn’t feel this way about Rachel anymore, y’know? I wish things could go back to normal. I mean, I love living with her and God, helping out with the baby is just amazing, but now I think…I think Ross feels left out. Y’know? When I had to take Rachel to the hospital, the doctor thought I was the father. God… You should’ve seen the look on Ross’s face. (Pause) By the way, I have no idea what I’m doing here. For all I know I’m just locking it more. Oh hey, did you try opening it with a credit card?
That’s a good idea.
Yeah.
Okay. (They switch places and Chandler gets out a credit card.) So uh, Ross is kinda bummed huh?
Oh, I just…I feel terrible.

Well, it’s not your fault. What are you gonna do? Not take her to the hospital? Y’know? You’re doing nothing wrong. (Pause) Except for harboring an all consuming love for the woman whose carrying his baby. (He loses his card behind the door.) Richard? If-if you’re in there, could you pass me my credit card?

summary:
In this scene, Joey and Chandler are trying to fix the door at Monica and Chandler's apartment. Joey asks Chandler for a bobby pin to try and unlock the door, but Chandler initially jokes about not having one since he's not a nine-year-old girl. Joey then makes a playful jab about Chandler's throwing skills.

Chandler distracts Joey by bringing up Joey's crush on Rachel, which Joey admits is causing him internal conflict and making him feel guilty, especially since it affects his relationship with Ross. Joey expresses his wish for things to go back to normal and for his feelings for Rachel to disappear.

Chandler reassures Joey that he's not doing anything wrong by helping Rachel and the baby, but he also points out the obvious issue of Joey's feelings for Ross's ex-wife. The conversation shifts back to the door, and Chandler suggests trying to open it with a credit card, which they attempt, but Chandler ends up losing the card behind the door.

background: Scene: Ross's Apartment, there’s a knock on the door and he opens it to Mona.

lines.dialogue: Hi!
Hey!
Hey, I went by the photo shop, take a look, here is a mockup of our card. What do you think?
Huh. Wow, this is great.
Now, do you think it should say, "Love Ross and Mona?"
Well, we-we haven’t said that to each other yet, but I guess its okay to say it to other people.
How many did you want? I’m getting a hundred.
A hundred?! Well, I-I guess I’ll take a—Mona, uh…I-I’m not sure about the whole uh, card thing.
Really? Why not?
Sending out a holiday card, together, I mean I just don’t know if we’re really quite there yet.
Oh y’know, I didn’t think of it that way. You’re right. You’re right. So, can I ask you a question?
Yeah.
Where are we?
Huh.
Y’know, like where are we? Where is this relationship going?
Hmm…
I mean I love spending time with you, y’know I just—I hope we’re moving forward. I mean, we should probably talk about that. Don’t you think?
Let’s do the card!
What?
The card! I think we’re there!
Okay. I—But I think we should still have this conversation.
Really?! I mean, even with the card?

summary: In this scene, Ross and Mona are discussing the idea of sending out a holiday card together. Mona shows Ross a mockup of the card, which features the phrase "Love Ross and Mona." Ross is initially hesitant, expressing uncertainty about whether they are ready to take such a step in their relationship. Mona, sensing his hesitation, uses the opportunity to ask Ross where they stand in their relationship and where it is heading. She expresses her desire to move forward and have a serious conversation about their future. Ross, in an attempt to avoid the conversation, suddenly agrees to the holiday card, but Mona insists that they still need to have the deeper discussion.

background: Scene: The Waiting Room, Ross is explaining to the gang what happened with his mother.

lines.dialogue: …she came and dragged me out of the labor room to ask me why I’m not with Rachel.
Yeah. (Pause) Why aren’t you with Rachel?
Are you kidding? Look, we’re not gonna be together just because we’re having a baby. Okay?
But y’know what? It just seems that you two belong together.
Okay, stop it! I can’t deal with this right now. I have to go have a baby.
Right. And with who again? (Ross exits.)
God. He’s crazy! Why doesn’t he want to be with Rachel?
I know!

I mean seriously, she’s like the perfect woman. I mean I know she turned me down, but if she hadn’t and wanted to be with me, I would take her in my arms and… (Realizes everyone is staring.) I haven’t bummed you guys out like this in a while have I?

summary: In the waiting room, Ross is explaining to Phoebe and Joey how his mother dragged him out of the labor room to question why he isn't with Rachel. Phoebe asks Ross directly why he isn't with Rachel, suggesting that they seem like a perfect match. Ross insists that they won't be together just because they're having a baby and leaves to attend to the birth. Joey expresses disbelief and frustration, wondering why Ross doesn't want to be with Rachel, calling her the perfect woman. He then awkwardly shifts the conversation, realizing he might have brought up an uncomfortable topic.

background: Scene: Sting’s Apartment, Phoebe has come to talk about Jack and is waiting for Sting’s wife, Trudie Styler, to enter.

lines.dialogue: Wow! This place is incredible! (Gasps) Sting’s pen…that he gave to Phoebe. (Puts the pen in her purse and goes over to a floor-to-ceiling bookcase) Come on! Secret passageway! (Starts pulling books at random as Trudie enters.)
Hi! (By the way, it’s actually her.)
Hi!
I’m Trudie.
Uh-huh.
You must be Ben’s mum.
Why else would I be here?
Do sit down.
Uh-huh. (They go and sit down.)
I gather Jack and Ben haven’t been getting along lately.
Yeah.
I’m told there are two sides to this story, but all I’ve heard is that Ben’s a bit of a poo-poo head.
Umm, I’m sorry. Won’t-won’t Jack’s father be joining us?
Oh I’m sorry, Jack’s father is not available.
Uh-hmm. Okay. Well then, could we reschedule? For say, Friday night perhaps at 8 o’clock?
Oh no, I know that wouldn’t work. My husband’s in concert.
Concert. Yeah. That does put us in…quite a pickle. Because you see I’m very busy before and after the concert, and he’s obviously busy during.
So, I guess you and I should talk about Jack and Ben right now.
Unless! Unless umm, okay I-I would be willing to go to the concert, umm, all the while thinking about the children of course.
Are you here for tickets?
Oh, thank you. Four would be great.
I’m not giving concert tickets to someone who’d use their son like this!
Oh good! Then you’re in luck! Ben’s not my son!
(stands up) Look, I’ve just pressed a button, triggering a silent alarm. Any minute now, the police will be here!
The Police? Here? A reunion?! (She gets out her camera.)

summary:
In this scene, Phoebe visits Sting’s apartment to discuss the conflict between Jack and Ben. She admires the luxurious surroundings and even takes a pen that Sting gave her. When Trudie Styler enters, Phoebe initially assumes she is someone else. Trudie, however, quickly identifies herself and brings up the issue between Jack and Ben, noting that she’s only heard one side of the story—that Ben is a "poo-poo head."

Phoebe, trying to avoid discussing the issue directly, asks about Sting’s availability, hoping to reschedule. When Trudie explains that Sting is unavailable due to a concert, Phoebe cleverly suggests attending the concert herself, implying she could discuss the matter there. Trudie sees through Phoebe’s ruse and accuses her of using her son (Ben) for concert tickets. Phoebe then reveals that Ben isn’t her son, leading Trudie to press a silent alarm, summoning the police. The scene ends with Phoebe pulling out a camera, possibly to document the unexpected turn of events.

background: Scene: Hotel's reception

lines.dialogue: Here's your copy of the bill, we hope you enjoyed your stay.
Oh we did, and you still have all your lamps.
Oh, I didn't factor in the room tax.
Oh dude, don't worry about it, I found an unattended maid's car. We're way ahead of the game.
Oh my god.
What?
There's something new in the bowl.
Look, we have enough, just walk away.
No, but I want... I want the pinecones!
There's a forest right outside.
It's not the same.
Ok, go quick!
(to the receptionist) Thank you for a delightful stay.
Oh, my maple candy!

summary: In this scene, Chandler, Ross, and the receptionist are at the hotel's reception. The receptionist hands them their bill, and Chandler jokes about still having all their lamps. Ross then reveals that they have extra money because he found an unattended maid's cart. The conversation takes a strange turn when Ross becomes fixated on something new in the hotel room's bowl, specifically pinecones, which he wants to take with him. Chandler tries to convince him to leave it behind, but Ross insists. The scene ends with Ross thanking the receptionist and suddenly remembering his maple candy.

background: Scene: Central Perk

lines.dialogue: (entering) Hey! I'm all packed and ready to go!
Oh, that's right! (to Emma) Daddy and uncle Joey are going on a trip today. We're going to a conference in Barbados, right?
Mmh-mmh.
(to Emma) Can you say Barbados?
Barbados!

Ok, I gotta say. I mean, it means so much to me that you guys are coming all the way over there to hear me do my speech! UH! And I've a surprise, uh... I had to pull some strings but I was able to get everyone passes to the entire conference! That's right! (he gives them their passes) This babies will get you into all the paleontology lectures and seminars.
Do you have anything that would... get us out of them?
Yeah Ross, I mean... we're excited to hear the speech but the rest of the time we're gonna wanna do, you know, "island's stuff".
I think David would probably wanna hear a few lectures.
Oh, right, because he's a scientist!
No, no, because, you know, he's been in Minsk for 8 years and if he gets too much direct sunlight, he'll die.
Ok, we gotta go, yeah? So, we'll see you guys tomorrow.
All right, let's do it! 5 hour flight with Charlie, have a couple of drinks, get under that blanket and do what comes naturally.
It's a blanket Joe, not a cloak of invisibility!

summary: In this scene, the group is at Central Perk. Joey is excited because he and Ross are about to leave for a conference in Barbados. Ross is thrilled that his friends are coming to support him and has managed to get them all passes to the entire conference, which includes various paleontology lectures and seminars. However, Rachel and Chandler express their desire to avoid the lectures and enjoy the island instead. Phoebe mentions that her boyfriend, David, might be interested in the lectures due to his long time in Minsk making him sensitive to sunlight. The scene ends with Ross and Joey preparing for their flight, with Joey jokingly suggesting they use the airplane blanket for more than just warmth, leading to a playful exchange between the two.

background: Scene: Phoebe's apartment: Phoebe, Monica and Mike sitting on the couch

lines.dialogue: Alright you two, I'm gonna go to the bathroom. Now I don't want anything going on while I'm gone. Here's a few things you can discuss
I've missed you so much! No, I'm not gonna ask you to get back together because I know we want different things, but just to be with you one more night.
I know, I want that too, but IS that going to make it too hard?

It can't be any harder than this... I mean, If I had known the last time I saw you would be the last time, I... I would have stopped to memorize your face, the way you move, everything about you. If I had known the last time I kissed you would have been the last time... I never would have stopped.
(running back into the room) Kiss him, you fool!!
What?
Didn't you hear that speech? If you don't kiss him then I will!
Oh, I missed you so much! (she kisses Mike)
(he bounds into the house) I knew you'd be here!
Oh, crap!
Who is this?
My friend Manny. I asked him to keep me away from you.
Hi, that's what I'm doing for Phoebe!
Well, you are not doing a very good job!
Excuse me?
What's with the kissing?
Hey, at least I knew where my guy was.
Oh yeah yeah, thank God you were here to oversee all the kissing!
You didn't hear the speech!
I've heard the speech
Hey, it was very moving! You're just heartless!
You're weak!
You're... weird!
Your pants are undone!
Oh (realizes her pants are undone and zips them up)!
(looking at the sofa) Where did they go?
Damn it!
Oh we blew it. I blame myself.
And I blame you too.

summary:
In this scene, Phoebe, Monica, and Mike are sitting on the couch in Phoebe's apartment. Monica leaves briefly to go to the bathroom, warning the others not to do anything while she's gone. During her absence, Mike confesses his deep feelings for Phoebe, expressing how much he misses her and wishes they could spend one more night together, even though they both know they want different things. Phoebe is moved by his words and considers whether it would be too difficult to reconnect in that way.

Monica returns unexpectedly and, upon hearing Mike's heartfelt speech, urges Phoebe to kiss him, even offering to do it herself if Phoebe doesn't. Phoebe, overwhelmed by the moment, kisses Mike.

At that moment, a strange man named Manny bursts into the apartment, claiming he knew they'd be there. Mike explains that Manny is his friend, who was supposed to help keep him away from Phoebe. Monica and Manny then engage in a heated argument, with Monica defending her role in the situation and Manny accusing her of not doing a good job of keeping Phoebe and Mike apart. The argument escalates, with both Monica and Manny blaming each other for the situation.

The scene ends with Monica realizing her pants are undone and Manny expressing frustration over the failed attempt to keep Phoebe and Mike apart.

background: Scene: Mike's apartment. His phone rings and he picks up

lines.dialogue: Hello?
Ok, Mike, enough is enough, now you love Phoebe and she loves you, so you need to get over your whole "I never want to get married" thing and step up!
Who is this?
This is Monica! I'm Phoebe's friend. Listen, Phoebe is back with David and he's going to propose to her, and she is going to say "yes" but I know she really wants to be with you!
(sounds shocked and sits down) He... he's gonna propose?
I... I'm sorry, did you say something? I can't hear through all this damned hair! (Tries to move her huge hair away from the phone, in vain)
Look, if Phoebe wants to marry David, she should, I'm not gonna stand in the way of that and neither should you.

You don't tell me what to do! I tell you what to do! Just call her. She's at the Paradise Hotel in Barbados. And while I've got you, you've got curly hair. What do you do in humidity? (Mike hangs up the phone) Damnit!
(sarcastically) Well, I hope you're happy!
(pretending not to sense the tone) Oooh! I hope you're happy too, honey!
Phoebe is going to say "Yes" to David. See, that's what happens when you meddle in people's lives!
Phoebe is going to say "yes"? That's, that's great!
No it's not, b'cause she's still in love with Mike!
And there's not chance that will work?
No, I called him. It's not gonna happen.
(pointing at her) Oooooooh! Meddler! Meddler!

Well, if you hadn't meddled to start with, I wouldn't have had to go in there and meddle myself. Now, no matter how much we meddle, we will never be able to un-meddle the thing that you meddled up - in the first place!
This vacation sucks!!

summary:
In this scene, Monica calls Mike to urge him to act on his feelings for Phoebe, who is currently with another man, David, who plans to propose. Monica, concerned that Phoebe truly loves Mike, tries to convince him to step up and fight for her. However, Mike, still holding onto his belief that he never wants to get married, tells Monica that if Phoebe wants to marry David, he won't stand in the way. Monica, frustrated, accuses Mike of not taking action and hangs up on him.

Back at Monica and Chandler's place, Monica vents her frustration to Chandler, blaming their meddling for the current situation. Chandler, trying to lighten the mood, playfully accuses Monica of meddling, but Monica insists that their initial meddling has created a situation that can't be undone. The scene ends with both of them feeling the weight of their actions and Chandler declaring that their vacation is ruined.

background: Scene: the hotel game room. There is a ping pong table in the middle of the room. Monica, Phoebe, Chandler and Mike walk in

lines.dialogue: C'mon guys, it'll be fun!
All right, all right... I'll play if we don't keep score!
But then how do we know who wins?
Nobody wins!
So, we're just four losers... SUPER!
I'm not playing with you.
Yeah, I'm out.
I'll play ya!
(smiling) OK!
Mike, you don't know, you don't know what you're doing!
She gets crazy! This scar (points to his forehead) is from Pictionary!
(disbelieving) I think I will be all right! (to Monica) You wanna volley a bit for a serve?
Sure! Got to!
Aww!
Oh, by the way... I'm awesome!!
(nearly whispering) Oh dear God, there's two of them!
You're ready to play?
Hell, yeah!
(to Phoebe) Did you know this about him?
No idea! I though he was soft like you!
Wanna make it more interesting?
How much were you thinking?
Ten bucks a game?
Make it fifty!
I'll make it a hundred!
(nearly shouting) One thousand...
(interrupting her) OK!
To see who goes first, you got a quarter?
(going through her pockets) No... (to Chandler and Phoebe) Either of you girls got a quarter?
Honey, try to focus the trash talk on him!
(picks up a coin from her bra) Monica, you call it.
Heads! No, Tails! He-he-heads!
Tails!
(angry) Ow, what are the chances!
Ha! My point!
Oh, no! I don't think so! You know, according to standard table tennis rules if at any time a player uses his non racket bearing hand to touch the playing surface he or she forfeits the point.
(smiling proudly) He was a lawyer!

summary:
In the hotel game room, Monica enthusiastically tries to convince Phoebe, Chandler, and Mike to play ping pong with her. Phoebe agrees to play but insists they don't keep score, which Monica reluctantly accepts, calling them all "losers." Chandler declines to play, and Phoebe backs out as well. Mike, however, steps up to play with Monica.

As they prepare to play, Chandler warns Mike about Monica's competitive nature, even showing a scar from a past Pictionary game. Mike confidently asserts that he can handle it, and the two start playing. The game quickly escalates into a high-stakes bet, with Monica and Mike raising the stakes from ten dollars to a thousand dollars.

Chandler and Phoebe watch in amusement as the game becomes more intense. Monica and Mike flip a coin to decide who serves first, with Monica losing the toss. The game continues, and Mike uses a technicality from table tennis rules to win a point, much to Monica's frustration. Phoebe proudly reveals that Mike was a lawyer, adding to the humor of the scene.

background: Scene: Doctor Connelly's office

lines.dialogue: (looking at the picture of the female reproductive system) Wow! Fortunately she has a very pretty face!
Oh, I so can't believe this! My uterus is an inhospitable environment? I was trying so hard to be a good hostess!
Oh, I can't believe my sperm have low motility because, let me tell you, when I was growing up they sure seem to be in a hurry to get places!!
(entering) Hi there.
Hi.
Hi.
I'm sorry there wasn't better news from your test last week but I wanted to talk to you about your options.
Ok.
Above all, even though your chances of conceiving through natural means aren't great, you never know! So, keep having sex on a regular basis.
Oh, DAMN IT!
Don't worry, after a while he'll tune it out.
Ok, given your situation, the options with the greatest chances for success would be surrogacy, or insemination using a sperm donor.
(long pause) Ok.
And, of course, if you feel that neither of those is right for you, you can always adopt.
Is that a hint? Because we love you Doctor Connelly but we don't think we'd want you to be our child! (Dr. Connelly glares at him) Wow, talking about an inhospitable environment!

summary: In this scene, Chandler and Monica are in Doctor Connelly's office discussing the results of their fertility tests. The doctor informs them that Monica's uterus is not ideal for conceiving, and Chandler's sperm have low motility, which reduces their chances of having a baby naturally. Despite this, the doctor encourages them to keep trying. The doctor then presents alternative options, such as surrogacy, insemination with a sperm donor, or adoption. Chandler makes a lighthearted but inappropriate joke about the doctor adopting them, which earns him a glare. The scene ends with the couple considering their options.

background: Scene: hall of the romantic inn in Vermont

lines.dialogue: Hi, Chandler Bing, I have a reservation.
Welcome to the Chestnut Inn Mr. Bing, so where are you joining from?
New York.
(in a strange voice and eating candies) The big apple!
I'm sorry, he's a little bit wound up, we had to stop at every maple candy stand on the way here.
Yeah, I ate all my gifts for everybody.
I am sorry Mr. Bing, there's no record of your reservation in the computer.
Well, that's impossible, can you check again, please?
(high pitched voice) Check again please!
I'm sorry, it's not here.
Not there.

Let me get this straight. I called yesterday trying to cancel my reservation and I was told it was not refundable, then we drove six hours all the way up here and now you tell me that we don't have a reservation?
I don't know what to say.
(mumbling) She doesn't know what to say!
Just give us the cheapest room you have.
Unfortunatly the only thing we have available is our deluxe suite, the rate is six hundred dollars.
That's insane!
Totally insane. Dude, let's drive home, we'll hit all the maple candy stores on the way back and if... if they're closed maybe we'll tap a tree and make some ourselves.
Does that room have a closet I can lock him in? (pause) We'll take it.
Great.
(aside, to Ross) What! ? They are totally ripping us off!

Dude, don't worry 'bout it! I know how we can make your money back! This is a nice hotel, you know, plenty of amenities, we just load up on those! Like those apples. Instead of taking one, I'm... I take six!
Great, at a hundred dollars an apple, we're there!
C'mon, you get the idea, ow-ow-ow we'll make our money back in no time!
Dude, you're shaking!
I think it's the sugar, could you hold the apple?

summary: In this scene, Chandler and Ross arrive at the Chestnut Inn in Vermont, where Chandler has a reservation. However, the receptionist informs them that there is no record of their reservation. Despite this, they decide to take the only available room, the deluxe suite, which costs $600. Ross, who has been eating too many maple candies, is overly excited and suggests they can "make their money back" by taking advantage of the hotel's amenities. Chandler is frustrated by the situation but reluctantly agrees to take the room. Ross, now visibly affected by the sugar rush, struggles to stay composed.

background: Scene: Central Perk. Joey and Charlie on the couch. Rachel enters

lines.dialogue: Hi! Ok, you're ready to go pick up Phoebe and go shopping?
Oh, yeah! Let's do it!
(to Charlie) Alright, have a good time. (they kiss)
Not gonna find any clothes in there!
(entering) Hey, you guys!
Hi.
Guess who's up for keynote speaker at the National Paleontology Conference?
Umh... Kurts Baley?
Yeah, right! What was last time he met a submission deadline for an abstract (he and Charlie laugh, then Joey starts laughing too without any reason) Well, why are you laughing?
Just... seeing what it'd be like to be a paleontologist... it's fun, yeah!
So you're up for keynote speaker! Who's making the decisions?
Professor Sherman, yeah. I've a meeting with him today.
He's a pretty tough guy to impress.
Yeah, well... I think I know how to dazzle him.
Oh... you're not gonna do a magic trick, are ya?
Tsz... NO! (he goes to sit down, dropping a multicoloured silk streamer off his sleeve).
(entering) Hey guys!
Wait a minute, you guys. Oh, I wanna ask you something. I-I I may get to speak at this paleontology convention and if I do, I'd love for you guys to come and hear me.
I think I can safely say that we all have family issues, work stuff and/or are sick.
It's in Barbados.
But you come first!
I'm there!
We'll see you, guys! (she goes)
Bye.
Bye, see ya. (she goes)
(sitting down on the couch) Ok.
All right, so. How did it go at the fertility clinic?
Not as much fun as last time. Apparently you only get porn if you're giving a sperm sample.
So-so what did the doctor say?
Well... there's surrogacy, but Monica has dreamt her whole life of carrying a child, she has felt that watching a surrogate would be... too hard for her.
So you're ruling out surrogacy?
Yeah.
So, I don't have to learn what that means?
Aside from adoption the only other choice is insemination, so... we're talking about sperm donors.
Enough said, I'm there for you man. Where is she, upstairs?
(stopping Joey) ah-ha!
How do you feel about all this?
I wish there was an easier way for us to have a child but I don't think there is one.
Come on Ross, be a good guy. Step up and do it!
(puzzled) What?
(looking astonished) What? NO! I am not going to give them Ben!

summary:
In this scene, Rachel, Joey, Charlie, Ross, and Chandler are at Central Perk. Rachel and Charlie are about to go shopping, while Joey and Charlie share a kiss before they leave. Ross enters and announces that he might be the keynote speaker at the National Paleontology Conference, which could take place in Barbados. Everyone is initially hesitant to attend, but when Ross mentions the location, Chandler quickly changes his mind, and Rachel enthusiastically agrees to go.

Meanwhile, Chandler reveals that he and Monica are considering sperm donation as an option for having a child, as surrogacy is too emotionally difficult for Monica. Joey, in his usual clueless manner, offers to help without fully understanding the situation. Ross, misunderstanding Joey, thinks Joey is suggesting he give up his son Ben as a solution, which Ross firmly rejects.

background: Scene: Back in New York, Monica and Chandler in Central Perk on the couch

lines.dialogue: Wow! That Mike thing was interesting! I don't know what's gonna happen with Phoebe and David.
(smiling cheekily) I do! Want a hint? huh? "I do" (Monica looks confused, so Chandler repeats) "I do".
Ok, I'm sensing that this is some kind of word play, because you are pink with barely controlled glee.
David is going to propose to Phoebe.
What? (looks very shocked) Why?
Be-cause, we were talking about ways that he could beat Mike and I told him that Phoebe wanted to get married.
Chandler, we have talked about this. You are not supposed to give people advice! Now couldn't you just have made some sort of inappropriate joke?
I did! A penis one! Look, just so I know, what was so wrong about what I said?

They've only been going out for a few weeks and Phoebe is completely hung up on Mike! She'll say "No", David's heart will be broken, it will be too hard for them to recover from and then Phoebe will end up alone again.
Man, that's some bad advice!

summary:
In this scene, Monica and Chandler are at Central Perk, discussing the recent developments involving Phoebe, Mike, and David. Monica expresses her curiosity about what might happen between Phoebe and David, given the complicated situation with Mike. Chandler, with a mischievous grin, hints that he knows something big is about to happen, specifically that David is going to propose to Phoebe.

Monica is shocked and confused, wondering why Chandler would know such a thing. Chandler reveals that he gave David advice on how to win Phoebe over, suggesting that David propose to her since Phoebe has expressed a desire to get married. Monica is frustrated with Chandler for meddling in other people's relationships and giving advice, especially since Phoebe is still hung up on Mike.

Monica worries that Phoebe will reject David's proposal, leading to heartbreak and a difficult recovery for both of them, potentially leaving Phoebe alone again. Chandler, realizing the gravity of his advice, acknowledges that it might have been bad advice, but he defends himself by saying he also made an inappropriate joke about it. The scene ends with Monica's concern about the potential fallout from Chandler's meddling.

background: Scene: Shop, Phoebe and Rachel are talking in front of the dressing room

lines.dialogue: Oh, God, do you think she heard? It would be so bad if she heard!
Well, maybe she didn't hear! Ok I'm gonna go into that dressing room, you stay in here and I'll talk and see if you can hear me.
Ok, great!
Oh, thank God I can't hear a word that you're saying!
(sticks her head out) I didn't say anything yet!
(sticks her head out too) Well, get back in there and talk!
(goes back in) I'm Rachel. It's so annoying when I put Emma on the phone to talk with my friends.
(comes out again) What!?
(comes out too) Well, some things are just hard to say to your face.
Ok well, I heard that! Which means that she heard it too!
Ooh! We have a problem.
Oh! What are we gonna do?
Just be honest with her.
Oh my God!
And it is annoying when parents put their baby on the phone...
(yelling at the stranger) Alright! Enough out of you!

summary: In this scene, Phoebe and Rachel are in a shop, worried that a stranger in the dressing room might have overheard Rachel's private conversation. Phoebe suggests testing whether the stranger can hear them by talking inside the dressing room while Rachel stays outside. Rachel initially thinks she can't hear Phoebe, but Phoebe reveals she hasn't started talking yet. When Phoebe finally speaks, she mockingly repeats Rachel's annoyance about putting her baby, Emma, on the phone during calls. Rachel panics, realizing the stranger probably heard it too. The stranger then chimes in, agreeing that it is annoying, prompting Rachel to snap at her to mind her own business.

background: Scene: Monica's apartment, where Phoebe's bachelorette party is taking place.

lines.dialogue: (to Rachel) Thank you so much for this.
Oh, d'you like it?
Oh my God, it's all so elegant! When's the dirty stuff starting?
What?
You know, the strippers, and the guys dancing, and you know, pee-pee's flying about.
Pheebs, I... there isn't gonna be any flying about! We actually thought we were a little too mature for stuff like that.
Oh, ok. I see what you're doing, that's fine. This is all there is, just tea, uh, ok. (she drinks her tea) Hmmmm... raunchy!
Seriously Pheebs, it's not gonna be that kind of a party.

Really? So this is... this is my big send off in the married life? Rachel this is the only bachelorette party I'm ever gonna have! I've got a big wad of $1s in my purse! Really? I mean, really? It's just tea?
Nooo! Phoebe, of course there is more! I mean, I'll just go and talk to Monica and get an ETA on the pee-pee's!

summary: In this scene, Phoebe is at her bachelorette party at Monica's apartment, hosted by Rachel. Phoebe expresses her gratitude for the party but is clearly expecting a more wild and risqué celebration, mentioning strippers and "pee-pee's flying about." Rachel, however, explains that they thought they were too mature for that kind of party and that it would be more elegant. Phoebe, disappointed, sarcastically comments on the "raunchiness" of the tea they are drinking. Rachel reassures Phoebe that there is more to the party, teasingly agreeing to check on the "pee-pee's," implying that there might be a surprise element to the celebration after all.

background: Scene: At Pyramid. Joey is with the woman now.

lines.dialogue: Ok Henrietta, you've picked Jack and Jill went up the hill.
(To Henrietta) My friend Rachel has a kid. I totally know nursery rhymes! (makes a thumbs up sign)

Joey describe these things associated with the United States congress. (Joey goes form looking very confident to looking very shocked the instant the word congress is said) Give me 20 seconds on the clock please. Ready? Go!
Oh, .. uh... uh... pass. (Next word
Uvula!
Oh, then pass. (Next word

O-kay... Henrietta, you didn't get all the points you needed, so that means Gene, you are going to the winners circle to try for ten thousand dollars! (Gene is clapping his hands looking very happy and so is Joey) And you're gonna be going there with Joey Tribbiani (Both of their smiles fade away instantly)

summary:
In this scene, Joey is participating in a game show with Henrietta and Donny as the host. Henrietta has just completed a round by naming the nursery rhyme "Jack and Jill went up the hill." Joey, trying to show off his knowledge, mentions that he knows nursery rhymes because his friend Rachel has a kid. 

The next round involves describing things associated with the United States Congress. When Donny mentions "congress," Joey suddenly becomes nervous and unable to answer, opting to pass instead. Henrietta then answers with "uvula," but it's not enough to secure the points needed.

As a result, Gene is sent to the winners' circle to try for ten thousand dollars, accompanied by Joey. Both Gene and Joey initially react with excitement, but their smiles quickly fade when they realize they will be competing together.

background: Scene: The gate at the airport. The passengers are standing in line, and they're about to board the plane again.

lines.dialogue: Ma'am, I assure you, the plane is fine.
And you fixed the Philange?
Yes, the Philange is fixed. As a matter of fact, we put a whole lot of extra Philanges onboard, just in case.
Where is she?
I don't see her.
Rachel! Rachel Green!
There she is!
Rachel! Rachel!
Wow, excuse me, sir, do you have a boarding pass?
No, no, I just have to talk to someone.
I'm sorry, you cannot go any further without a boarding pass.
No, no, no, but...
(screaming) RACHEL!!
Oh my God... What.. What are you guys doing here?
Okay, you're on.
What? What? Ross, you're scaring me. What's going on?
Okay, the thing is..
Yeah?
Don't go.
What?
Please, please stay with me. I am so in love with you. Please, don't go.
Oh my God.
I know, I know. I shouldn't have waited 'till now to say it, but I'm.. That was stupid, okay? I'm sorry, but I'm telling you now. I love you. Do not get on this plane.
Miss? Are you boarding the plane?
Hey, hey. I know you love me. I know you do.
Miss?
I - I have to get on the plane.
No, you don't.
Yes, I do.
No, you don't.
They're waiting for me, Ross. I can't do this right now, I'm sorry. I'm sorry.
Rachel?
I'm so sorry.
I really thought she'd stay.
I'm sorry.

summary: In this scene, Ross and Phoebe are at the airport gate, trying to stop Rachel from boarding a plane. The gate attendant assures the passengers that the plane is fine and that the "Philange" issue has been fixed. Ross is visibly distressed and calls out for Rachel, who eventually appears. He confesses his love for her and pleads with her not to leave, but Rachel insists that she has to board the plane as people are waiting for her. Despite Ross's heartfelt plea, Rachel apologizes and boards the plane, leaving Ross disappointed and Phoebe comforting him.

background: Scene: Mr. Zellner's office. There is a knock on the door.

lines.dialogue: Who is it?
(enters) It's me. Ron. (Mr. Zellner looks annoyed) Look, I um, I now Rachel turned you down but I think there is a way you might be able to get her to come back.
This may surprise you, but re-hiring fired employees, is not my main job.
Just hear me out. How would you feel about offering her a raise? (looks hopeful)
(obviously amused) Not good, Ron.
Perhaps I can persuade you. What if you can give your son this (Takes a huge egg out of his back) genuine pterodactyl egg (whispers) replica.
(Takes a long look at the egg while he considers it) Wow, that's pretty cool (Takes the egg from Ross)
Huh? So? We have a deal?
Okay, you got it.
Yes! yes!
This is gonna make me very popular.
Oh, (grins) Believe me, the ladies, they love it!
(looks at Ross, for a long moment, confused) I meant with my son.
Good, 'cause the ladies, not so much. (shakes his head, give him a thumbs up and leaves)

summary: In the scene, Ross enters Mr. Zellner's office to convince him to rehire Rachel, who had previously been turned down for a job. Mr. Zellner is initially uninterested in rehiring fired employees, but Ross suggests offering Rachel a raise. When Mr. Zellner dismisses the idea, Ross pulls out a replica pterodactyl egg, which he claims will be a great gift for Mr. Zellner's son. Impressed by the egg, Mr. Zellner agrees to the deal. Ross is thrilled and leaves, mistakenly thinking Mr. Zellner was referring to the egg being popular with "the ladies," while Mr. Zellner clarifies he meant it for his son. The scene ends with Ross giving a thumbs up and leaving, satisfied with the outcome.

background: Scene: Monica's apartment. Somebody knocks the door

lines.dialogue: Hi, I am Laura, I am here for your adoption interview.
Hi, I am Monica and this is Chandler. Please come in.
Thank you!
Would you like something to drink?
Oh, water would be fine.
Ok. Great. I am so glad that you are here. We're really excited about getting this process started.
Oh, because we love kids. Love ‘em to death.Well, not actually to death, that's just a figure of speech - we love kids the appropriate amount... as allowed by law.
Your place is just lovely.
Ah, thank you. This building does have a wholesome family feel to it.
You know, I... I feel like I've been here before. Are any other couples in the building adopting?
Is that that couple on the first floor? Because we should get a baby before them. Yeah! That guy tried to sell me drugs. (Laura looks shocked)
But other than that... wholesome, wholesome building.
Oh...
What?
I just realized why I remember this place.
Really? What is it?
Oh, it's nothing. I went on a date with a guy who lived in this building and it didn't end very well.
Ohh... that wouldn't by any chance be... Joey Tribbiani?
Yes!
Of course it was!
Yeah, we had a really great night and in the morning he promised he would call me and he didn't.
RAT BASTARD!
So you're not friends with him?
OH GOD NO! Nope, no, no, no. No! No, no. Nope! No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no. NO! (finally Monica concludes) No!
Well, I'm sorry I brought it up. So, are either one of you planning on staying at home with your child... (someone knocks on the door)
(form the other side of the door) Hellooo? Anybody in there order a celebrity? (He starts to enter the apartment and Chandler runs to the door and shuts it back in his face) OW!
What was that?
Oh, it's just some crazy guy who roams the halls here. He's great with kids though.

summary: In this scene, Monica and Chandler are preparing for an adoption interview with Laura, who arrives at their apartment. Monica and Chandler are eager to start the adoption process and express their enthusiasm for having a child. During the conversation, Laura mentions that she feels like she's been to the apartment before, leading to an awkward revelation that she once dated Joey, who failed to call her after their date. Monica and Chandler vehemently deny any friendship with Joey, despite his constant presence in their lives. The tension escalates when Joey unexpectedly knocks on the door, claiming to be a "celebrity," but Chandler quickly shuts the door in his face. Laura is left puzzled, while Chandler dismisses Joey as a harmless, albeit annoying, neighbor.

background: Scene: A restaurant. Joey is on his date with Phoebe抯 friend, Sarah. They are sitting opposite each other on a table for two. Their waiter approaches with two plates.

lines.dialogue: A garden salad for the lady (sets the plate down)
Oh, that looks great! Good ordering!
Seafood platter for the gentleman and extra fries. Enjoy!
Mmmh, those fries look delicious.
oh, I didn't know you liked French fries. Help yourself! What's mine is yours. (Sarah reaches over and takes a few fries)
(looks over at Joey's platter) Oh wow, are those stuffed clams?
Uuuh.. yes, they are my stuffed clams.
How about those fries though, huh? (Holds the plate between Sarah抯 fingers and his plate, thus blocking her from reaching his)
They are delicious (takes a few from the plate, puts one in her mouth and places the rest on her plate, then starts to reach over to Joey's platter again)
(Spotting her movements takes her hand into his own) You are beautiful, you know that?
Oh, that is so sweet..
Oh (grinning, trying to hold in his impatience with her) okay.. (she takes her hand back)
(Visibly annoyed) NOW look what you did!!
What? what is the matter with you?
I don't like it when people take food off of my plate, okay?
But you just said "What's mine is yours"?
WELL, I DIDN'T MEAN IT!
Fine, I'm sorry, I didn't think it was that big a deal.

I'm sorry, I'm overreacting. Okay, It's just when it comes to food, I have certain rules, okay, I mean (bends down and with his plate and his hands, scrapes the dropped dinner back onto the plate and puts it back on the table) There are things you do..and you know, things.. (takes something from the plate and blows it a little) that you don't do (He takes a bite from it).

summary:
In this scene, Joey and Sarah are on a date at a restaurant. The waiter serves them their meals: a garden salad for Sarah and a seafood platter with extra fries for Joey. Initially, Joey is generous and offers Sarah some of his fries, which she happily accepts. However, when Sarah shows interest in Joey's stuffed clams, Joey becomes visibly uncomfortable and tries to block her from taking any more food from his plate.

Joey's frustration escalates when Sarah continues to reach for his food, leading him to take her hand and compliment her to distract her. When she persists, Joey finally explodes, expressing his strong dislike for people taking food off his plate. Sarah is confused and upset, pointing out that Joey had previously said "What's mine is yours." Joey then admits he didn't mean it and explains that he has "certain rules" when it comes to food, even going so far as to scrape dropped food back onto his plate and eat it.

The scene highlights Joey's quirky and possessive attitude towards his food, creating an awkward and tense moment on their date.

background: Scene: Central Perk. Phoebe, Monica and Chandler on their couch.

lines.dialogue: Hey Mon? Was it weird changing your name to Geller-Bing?
No, no. It felt nice to acknowledge this. (pats Chandler on his leg)
Where did you go to do it?
Uhm the... the ministry... of names... bureau...
YOU NEVER DID IT!
I'm sorry. It's just the idea of being an official Bing.
Hey! I will have you know that... aah, who am I kidding. Let's call the kid Geller and let Bing die with me.
(walks to the couch with coffee for Phoebe) Here you go.
Thanks! Honey, would you want me to take your name?
Oh, it's just... It's up to you. It's your name. You've got to live with it.
All right, let's see, call me Mrs. Hannigan.
(pretending to call her.) Mrs. Hannigan?
(loudly and crossly) What? Can't you see I'm in the middle of something? (smiling) Ooh, I like it.
(enters) Hey guys.
Hey Joe! We've got a couple of things we've got to check out at the new house. You want to come with us?
No, thank you.
All right. I know you're not happy about us moving, but you're the only one who hasn't seen the house.
Yeah, come with us. You'll see how close it is to the city.
But no, it's not close. You said it was in escrow? I couldn't even find it on the map.
Joey, please come. It would mean so much to us.
You know what? You are my friends, I wanna be supportive, I will come with you. SHOTGUN!
Damn it.
See you guys later.
Okay!
(to Joey) I'll pick you up at eleven. So glad you're coming.
Good for you. That was really mature.
What? No, the only reason I'm going to their stupid new house, is so I can point out everything that's wrong with it, so they don't move. I'm gonna make them stay here.
You're a strange kind of grown-up.
Joey, you can't make someone do something they don't want to do. Believe me, there's something I've been trying to get Mike to do in bed and there's... he's just...
Woo-wo-hey-hey-hey... Can we not talk about that right now?
All right, prude... Look, Monica and Chandler really love this house. You are not gonna talk them into staying here.
Hey, hey... I can convince people to do anything, you know. I bet I can even get Mike to do that "thing". What is it?
I AM NOT GONNA HELP YOU DO THAT! Goodbye! (he leaves)

summary:
In this scene, the friends are gathered at Central Perk. Phoebe asks Monica if she found it strange to change her name to Geller-Bing after marrying Chandler, but Monica admits she never actually did it. Chandler playfully jokes about their future child taking the Geller name instead of Bing. Mike arrives with coffee for Phoebe and they briefly discuss the idea of Phoebe taking his last name, with Phoebe humorously suggesting "Mrs. Hannigan."

Joey enters and Chandler and Monica invite him to see their new house, which Joey initially refuses to do, feeling upset about their move. However, after some persuasion, Joey agrees to go, but secretly plans to criticize the house to convince them not to move. Phoebe and Mike call him out on his plan, with Phoebe humorously comparing it to her failed attempts to get Mike to do something in bed. The scene ends with Joey leaving, determined to sabotage the move.

background: Scene: Phoebe is at Central Perk. Mike enters.

lines.dialogue: Hey (He kisses Phoebe)
Welcome back!
Ah! I missed you
Oh, me too!
So, what's new?
Well, I'm no longer Phoebe Buffay.
That's great! You changed you name?
Yes I did! Meet
(afraid) You're kidding right?
Nope.
You really did that?
Yep.
Yeah, but you can't do that.
Why? It's fun, it's different, no-one else has a name like it.
(looks at her astonished) Alright, then I'm gonna change my name.
Great, okay, what are you gonna change it to?
Crap Bag.
(not amused) Mike Crap Bag?
No, no Mike, just Crap Bag. First name Crap, last name Bag.
You're not serious, right?
Yeah, I'm serious. (sarcastic) It's fun, it's different and no-one else has a name like that!
Uhu, uhu, well, then, great. If you love it, I love it.
I do love it, and I love your name. I love Princess Consuela.
And I love Crap.

summary: In this scene, Phoebe is at Central Perk when Mike enters and greets her with a kiss. They exchange pleasantries, and Phoebe reveals that she has changed her last name to "Buffay" and now goes by "Princess Consuela." Mike is initially surprised but then decides to play along by joking that he will change his name to "Crap Bag." Phoebe is not amused by his joke, but they both end the conversation with lighthearted banter, expressing their love for each other's new names. The scene is filled with humor and playful teasing between the couple.

background: Scene: Monica and Chandler's apartment. Monica and Erica enter, Chandler is in the kitchen.

lines.dialogue: Hey! How was lunch?

(To Chandler) We had a good time. By the way, I wanted to ask you something. It would really mean a lot to me, if the baby was a boy, that you name him after my father, Jiminy Billy Bob (Monica smiles at Chandler and he looks shocked and scared, getting no support from his wife)
(struggling) Oh, really?
No! (To Monica) You we're right, that was fun! I'm gonna go finish packing.
O-okay. (steps closer to Monica and speaks softly) So, is she gonna take the test?
Nope, she doesn't have to, I found out who the father is.
Oh God. It's shovely-Joe, isn't it?
(smiling) No it's not.
How do you know?
Well, it turns out that Erica didn't pay much attention in Sex Ed class, because the thing she did with that prison guy... it'd be pretty hard to make a baby that way.
Oh God! What was it? The thing that we hardly ever do or the thing we never do?
The thing we never do.
(nods in appreciation) Shovely Joe!

summary: In this scene, Monica and Erica return from lunch to Monica and Chandler's apartment. Erica playfully teases Chandler about naming the baby after her father, "Jiminy Billy Bob," which catches Chandler off guard. After Erica leaves to finish packing, Chandler asks Monica if Erica is going to take a paternity test. Monica reveals that she already knows who the father is and explains that Erica's lack of knowledge from Sex Ed class makes it impossible for the baby to be the prison guy's (Shovely Joe). The method Erica used would prevent conception, and Monica confirms it was the "thing we never do." Chandler, relieved, sarcastically concludes that the father must be Shovely Joe.

background: Scene: Joey抯 apartment. Everybody except Monica and Chandler is there.

lines.dialogue: I just can抰 see Chandler cheating!
I抦 telling you guys, we followed them out to a house in Westchester, the went in for like forty-five minutes and then they came out looking pretty happy!
Chandler? Forty-five minutes? Well, something is not right. I just can抰 believe he would do this to Monica!
I know, and with the baby coming?
So, should we tell her?
I don抰 know. Phoebe, if one of us saw Mike with another woman would you want us to tell you?
Why? Who抎 you seen him with?
No one, I抦 just saying if... (Phoebe starts pinching him in his neck)
TELL ME WHAT YOU KNOW!
(yelling in pain) I know nothing! Mike抯 a great guy, it was hypothetical!
All right. (she releases him). He is a good guy. You抮e right, he wouldn抰 cheat.
Believe me, if I did see with someone, there抯 no way I... (Phoebe starts pinching him again)
WHO DID YOU SEE HIM WITH?

summary: In this scene, the group is gathered at Joey's apartment, discussing a suspicion that Chandler might be cheating on Monica. Rachel claims she and Ross followed Chandler and another woman to a house in Westchester, where they spent 45 minutes together and emerged looking happy. Joey and Ross express disbelief that Chandler would cheat, especially with Monica expecting a baby. Phoebe suggests they should tell Monica, but Ross uses a hypothetical situation about Mike (Phoebe's boyfriend) to argue against it. Phoebe becomes suspicious and starts questioning Ross aggressively, demanding to know if he has seen Mike with another woman. Ross insists it was just a hypothetical scenario, and Phoebe eventually calms down, agreeing that Mike wouldn't cheat.

background: Scene: Joey and Rachel's apartment. Rachel and Monica are in there, and Phoebe enters

lines.dialogue: Hey!
Hi! Happy Thanksgiving!
Oh, yeah, happy needless-turkey-murder day.
You guys, I ordered some chocolate pies from that bakery on Bleecker. Could you pick them up for me?
You're not making the pies yourself?
No, no, no, I don't make chocolate pies. When I was younger I entered this pie-eating contest. I ate so many that just the thought of them made me sick.
Did you at least win the contest?
2 minutes, 12 pies and a part of one tin! Okay, I see you guys at 4.
Can't wait!
This dinner is gonna be so great! In your face, last year "me"!
Hey Rach.
Yeah.
What's Emma doing today?
Well, let's see... uh... I know that she has a meeting with her lawyer and then she has to make a very big poop. Why?
Well, I wanna enter her in a baby beauty pageant.
Oh my God! That's the creepiest thing I've ever heard!
Okay, but, well, before you say no, my friend Susanne is entering her kid and compared to Emma she's a real dog!
Oh! Phoebe, all babies are beautiful!
(sarcastic) Oh... okay.
Phoebe, just the idea of pitting one baby against another, I mean, you know, and judging who's cuter just for a trophy...
And a thousand dollars.
...is something I'm very interested in! Oh please, do not tell Ross. He still believes that (in a deep voice, mocking Ross) what's in the inside is important...
Okay, oh, and Emma needs a cowgirl outfit for the competition.
Where am I gonna get a cowgirl outfit on Thanksgiving?
Well, I was thinking...
Oh, take the clothes of Joey's Cabbage Patch Kid.
Yeah!

summary:
In this scene, Rachel, Monica, and Phoebe are in Joey and Rachel's apartment. They exchange greetings and Phoebe expresses her distaste for Thanksgiving, referring to it as "needless-turkey-murder day." Monica asks Rachel and Phoebe to pick up chocolate pies from a bakery, explaining that she doesn't make them herself because of a traumatic pie-eating contest experience from her childhood.

The conversation then shifts to Emma, Rachel's baby. Phoebe suggests entering Emma into a baby beauty pageant, which Rachel initially finds creepy but eventually becomes interested in, especially after hearing about the prize money. Phoebe mentions that Emma needs a cowgirl outfit for the competition, and Rachel jokingly suggests using Joey's Cabbage Patch Kid's clothes. The scene ends with the three women bantering and planning for the upcoming Thanksgiving dinner.

background: Scene: Madison Square Garden

lines.dialogue: Oh, Bob, get off the guy!
Oh! What a game, huh?
I know, yeah.
I can't believe Chandler is missing this!
Yeah. I am sorry he's not here too, but I got to say, (takes some nachos from a plate on the seat where Chandler should have been) I am really enjoying Nacho Chair.
Yeah, I'd probably enjoy it more if you didn't keep batting my hand away.
Ohhhh! These seats are great!
I know, I know! When I was here for Holidays on Ice (Joey looks around worried hoping no one heard that) I was sitting so far away Michelle Kwan couldn't read my banner!
(looks at the time) Wow, hey, we'd better get going. If we don't leave right now, we'll be late for dinner.
Oh, but it's a kind game! So we're a little late, you know, the girls will be there, let's stay just for one more goal.
I don't know...
One more fight!
Okay.
Okay.

summary: In this scene, Joey and Ross are at Madison Square Garden watching a game. They are enjoying the game and Joey is taking advantage of Chandler's absence by eating from his nacho plate, which he amusingly refers to as "Nacho Chair." Ross teases Joey for being possessive of the nachos. They both comment on how great their seats are, with Ross reminiscing about a previous event he attended there. As the game progresses, Joey suggests they leave to avoid being late for dinner, but Ross convinces him to stay for just one more goal, and possibly one more fight. The scene ends with them agreeing to stay a bit longer.

background: Scene: Joey's apartment. He walks in reading his mail, and plays back his messages on the answering machine

lines.dialogue: Joey, this is Al T. Booker, (Looks annoyed that he called him) the guy who eats paper. I'm sure you've heard that Estelle passed away. (Looks shocked) I wanted to let you know there's a memorial for her at the Westside chapel, tomorrow at ten. Hope you can make it.
Oh my God. (Still in shock when his mobile rings, he picks it up) Hello?
(on the other side of the line, still pretending to be Estelle) Joey, it's Estelle. (Joey's eyes bulge up, he looks afraid)
Estelle?
Yeah, I wanted to call and tell you that there's no hard feelings for firing me.
(still scared) Ok-ay. I just, I can't believe you're calling me?
Well, I didn't think I should just drop by...
No, no, no! (Starts looking around the room, terrified) Don't drop by, don't drop by!
Anyway, you did what you had to do. I'm okay.
Can I ask you something? Uhm, what's it like there?
(Looks around) It's alright. Look kiddo, I gotta go. Good luck with the career. You're gonna be huge.
Thanks for everything Estelle. Bye. (Hangs up and reads the phone display) "out of area". Boy, I'll say.

summary: In this scene, Joey returns to his apartment and listens to a message from Al T. Booker, who informs him about the passing of Estelle and a memorial service. Moments later, Joey receives a phone call from someone pretending to be Estelle, which deeply unnerves him. The caller reassures Joey that there are no hard feelings about being fired, but Joey is visibly terrified and asks about "what it's like there." The caller ends the call with a cryptic message, leaving Joey unsettled and confused.
